loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 35 years old and married.  She and her spouse have been blessed with 2 children. She also supports 4 people in her family and her spouse does provide additional income. She has a retail shop and has been in the business for 6 years. Right now her monthly income is KES 15,000.

She will be using this loan to add to her stock of sugar, rice and flour for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock to her shop. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to open a big wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and flour.

loans.name: Essénam

texts.fr:
-   
mariée et mère de  2 enfant à 49 ans, Essénam  réside à agoè. Elle vend  des fournitures scolaires. Elle  s'approvisionne 2 fois par mois au  grand marché de lomé. Elle  revend  de son domicile et est ambilente. Essénam sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: A married mother of two children, Essénam is 49 years old and resides in Agoè. She sells school supplies. She gets her supplies twice a month at the big market of Lomé. She resells the goods at her home and by hawking. Essénam is requesting this loan to expand her business in order to satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 30 packets of 100-page notebooks and 35 packets of 200-page notebooks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more litres of kerosene

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  a door and two windows for her home.

loans.name: Las Mariposas Group

texts.es:
“Las Mariposas” es un grupo de antaño en VisionFund México, después de 10 ciclos, los integrantes que continúan en el grupo desde que este se formó comentan que decidieron identificarse bajo ese nombre ya que la mariposa es un animal bello y libre, seguro de sí mismo. El barrio donde se reúnen los miembros es un lugar muy tranquilo, alejado del ruido a excepción de los momentos en que pasa el tren justo frente a la casa de la representante.

“Las Mariposas” se consideran una familia, al término de cada ciclo cooperan para realizar un convivio y festejar el cierre y el inicio de una nueva etapa juntos. Además, agradecen a Dios por otra oportunidad para continuar creciendo.

Tras cumplir el sueño americano hace ya 15 años y de haber regresado a su pueblo, Abel se ha dedicado al servicio de meseros, renta de manteles, sillas, equipo de sonido y arreglar salones para cualquier evento social. Abel explica que regresó de EE.UU. pues tenía un problema cardiaco “México lindo y querido si muero lejos de ti que digan que estoy dormido y que me traigan a ti” fueron las palabras de Abel al hacer referencia a la letra de una canción. Quedan recuerdos de su estancia en un lugar lejano y lo importante es que ahora vuelve a estar al lado de las personas que quiere. Actualmente, Abel se hace cargo de su madre quien vive con él, algunas veces por su trabajo, debe salir pero es entonces que sus sobrinas y hermanas se quedan en casa para cuidar de su mamá. 

Para Abel es su segundo ciclo en VisionFund México y está agradecido por la oportunidad que recibe para continuar mejorando su actividad. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de telas, sillas, bases, alfileres, naturaleza muerta y algunos otros artículos que le hacen falta para sus nuevas creaciones. Las ganancias siempre la reinvierte en variedad de mercancía pues sabe que siempre debe ofrecer algo nuevo y de acuerdo con los gustos de sus clientes. Por si fuera poco, la amabilidad y personalidad de Abel es algo que siempre lo distingue y es un valor extra para su negocio. 

Los demás compañeros de Abel iniciaron su actividad cuando recibieron su primer préstamo, otros ya tenían su negocio, pero absolutamente todos han crecido poco apoco con ayuda de los prástamos. 

Rafaela - Venta De Cerdos  
Noemi – Venta De Abarrotes Y Artículos De Plata 
Salvador –Cocina Economica
Cintia –Venta De Toperware
Ana –Venta De Refrescos Y Antojitos 
Bernardina – Venta De Ropa  
Mario-Venta De Refacciones Para Moto
Nancy –Calzado Por Catalogo 

*En la imagen: Abel viste playera a rayas color rojo y se ubica en la parte trasera.
texts.en:
"Las Mariposas" (The Butterflies) is a well-established credit group in VisionFund in Mexico.  After ten cycles the members are still together.  They tell us that they decided on the group name because the butterfly is a beautiful, free animal which is very sure of itself. The neighborhood where they meet is a very peaceful spot, away from any noise.  The only exception is the train that passes just in front of the representative's house.

"Las Mariposas" consider themselves a family.  At the end of every cycle they collaborate and organize a get-together to celebrate the end of one cycle and the start of a new one. Besides this, they are grateful to God for the opportunity they have to keep progressing.

After fulfilling the American dream 15 years ago and then returning to his home, Abel has devoted his career to supplying waiters, renting out tablecloths, chairs, sound system and arranging rooms for social events. He tells us that he came back from the USA because he had a heart problem. He cites the lyrics of a song to express his feelings towards his land and his desire not to die abroad. He still has fond memories of his stay in the US but the important thing for him was to be back with his loved ones. 

At the moment Abel is looking after his mother who lives with him.  Sometimes he needs to leave her because of work commitments, so his nieces or his sisters step in to look after her. 

This is his second cycle in VisionFund Mexico and he is very grateful for the opportunity that the organization gives him to improve his business. He will invest some money in cloth, chairs, bases, pins, still-life objects and other articles that he needs for his new creations. He always reinvests his profits in a variety of merchandise because he knows that he should always offer new things according to the tastes of his customers. If that wasn't enough, his friendliness and personality is something that always helps him to stand out and is an extra plus in his business. 

His colleagues in the group started when they received their first loans.  Some already had their business set up.  All of them are growing little by little with the help of the loans. 

Rafaela - Sale of Pigs  
Noemi - Sells groceries and silver  
Salvador - sells food at a reasonable price.
Cintia - sells Tupperware.
Ana - sale of soft drinks and snacks 
Bernardina - Clothing Sales.  
Mario - sells motorcycle spare parts.
Nancy - sells shoes by catalogue. 

In the image: Abel is wearing a red t-shirt with stripes and he is in the back.

loans.use: to buy cloth, chairs, bases, pins and still life objects.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi operates a grocery vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. Chizi appreciates the support of the previous loan that helped her to boost and sustain her business.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. Chizi decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Jimena

texts.es:
Jimena es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es una tienda de barrio con artículos de primera necesidad.
Ella es emprendedora, Alegre, optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su Trabajo es la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad en un cuarto que utiliza como tienda en la zona de  Rio Seco, Esta zona se caracteriza por la fiesta en honor a su patrono ‘San Francisco de Borja’, en este lugar el 80 por ciento de las calles tiene nombre de santos esto para poder coincidir con el mismo nombre de la zona.
Jimena es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es una mezcla entre español y aymara, se comunica con sus familiares en lengua nativa y en el comercio mayormente usa el español. Su negocio es una tienda de barrio que debido a la falta de comercio en el área no tiene mucha competencia. Le ayudan en su labor su pequeña hermanita menor y su primo porque sus padres están constantemente de viaje. Ella tiene una segunda labor, se dedica a la artesanía, crea instrumentos de aire con caña hueca como material principal (quenas y zampoñas) y los comercia en colegios y escuelas de su barrio.
Ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra por mayor de abarrotes y material escolar para la venta en su tienda, ya que existe una escuela cercana y existe demanda de esos productos.
Es por esos motivos que Jimena solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes y material escolar para surtir su tienda y con los beneficios empezar a estudiar.
texts.en:
Jimena is a 21 year old young woman who's single and without children. Her business is a neighborhood store with essential goods.

She is entrepreneurial, happy, optimistic, cheerful, with a good attitude, committed to her work, generous, friendly, responsible and very hardworking. 

Her work is the sale of staple goods in a room she uses as a store in the Rio Seco zone. This area is known for a festival in honor of its patron saint, San Francisco de Borja. In this location, 80 percent of the streets are named after saints, in order to match the name of the area.

Jimena is dark-skinned with long black hair, and of a medium height. Her native language is a mix of Spanish and Aymara - she communicates with her family members in her indigenous language, and uses mostly Spanish for business. 

Her business is a neighborhood store with essential goods, which doesn't have much competition in the area due to a lack of commerce. Her youngest sister helps her with her work, as does her cousin, because his parents are always traveling. 

She has a second job as an artisan, creating instruments out of hollow cane as the primary material (flutes and panpipes) and selling them in schools in her neighborhood.

She wants to grow her business, buying groceries and school supplies wholesale to stock her store, and use the income to begin studying.

loans.use: to buy groceries and school supplies to fill her shop and begin studying with the income.

loans.name: Daniela Marcela

texts.es:
Daniela es una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija de tres años y su negocio es la venta de libros y peliculas.
Ella es emprendedora, fuerte, luchadora, amable, generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, buena madre, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en un pequeño puesto de venta ubicado en la plaza Murillo que está situada en el centro de la ciudad de Nuestra Señora de La Paz, y es el centro del poder político de la República de Bolivia.
Daniela es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello largo negro, su lengua natal es el español y conoce el aymara. Su negocio es la venta de libros y peliculas, ella lucha a diario por hacerse un hueco en la venta del libros, para el que corren tiempos difíciles, comenta. Ella cree que hay factores de fondo que afectan a la venta como es que el libro siempre ha sido "un negocio minoritario", Y en un momento económico donde algunos no ven el libro como un objeto de consumo de primera necesidad, mucho más. Piensa que es importante emplear nuevos métodos para hacer los títulos más atractivos. 
El sueño de su vida es tener una casa propia para habitarla con su mamá y su hijita. Ella desea realizar una inversión en la compra de libros por mayor para generar mejores ingresos económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Daniela solicita un préstamo para la compra de libros por mayor y mejorar la calidad de vida de su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Daniela is a 27 year old woman. She is single, and has a 3 year old daughter. She works selling books and movies.

She is enterprising, strong, determined, nice, generous, understanding, patient, a good listener, caring, a good mother, optimistic, responsible, and hard-working. Her business is a little kiosk located in the Murillo Square, in the city of Nuestra Senora de la Paz, which is the political center of the Republic of Bolivia. 

Daniela has a dark complexion, average height, long black hair, her native language is Spanish, and she knows some Aymara.
She sells books and movies, and she struggles daily to make a space for herself selling books. She affirms that these are difficult times for that occupation.

 She thinks there are some factors that might affect the business; she states that the book business has always been “a minority business.” Especially in hard financial times where some people don’t see books as a first necessity object. She thinks is necessary to create new ways to make the titles more attractive.

Her dream is to have her own house where she can live with her mom and her little daughter. She wishes to invest in the purchase of books wholesale to get better profits. 

That’s why Daniela is requesting a loan, to buy books wholesale and to improve her daughter’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy books wholesale and to improve her daughter's quality of life.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 38 años de edad, casado, padre de tres hijos, y su negocio es el servicio de chapa y pintura de automóviles.
Él es emprendedor independiente, luchador, solidario, comprensivo, buen padre, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona 'San Sebastian' que se caracteriza por su arquitectura colonial y republicana, que actualmente conforma el casco viejo de la ciudad.
David es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua natal es el aymara y también habla español. Su negocio es un taller de chapa y pintura para vehículos, trabajo que viene realizando desde hace más de 20 años. David tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela primaria, ellos son muy felices al lado de su padre porque él se esfuerza mucho por su bienestar y sus estudios. Su trabajo le exige constantemente la compra de materiales para la reparación de los vehículos como la pintura y otros materiales que son imprescindibles.
El sueño de David es construir una casa propia y sacar a sus hijos profesionales. Él desea realizar la compra de una máquina compresora ya que la que usaba se deterioro y ya no sirve.
Es por esos motivos que David solicita un préstamo para comprar una máquina compresora y con los beneficios pagar el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
David is a 38-year-old man, married, with three children.  His business is metal plating and painting cars.

He is an independent, tenacious, supportive, understanding, responsible, and very hardworking entrepreneur who is also a good father.  David has three children, all of whom are elementary school students.  They are very happy at their father’s side, because he works hard for their well-being and schooling.  He works in the San Sebastian area, known for the colonial and republican architecture that currently make up the old quarter of the city.  David is dark complexioned with short black hair; he is of medium height.  His native language is Aymara, but he also speaks Spanish.  

His business is a metal plating and auto paint shop, a line of work he has been doing for more than twenty years.  His work demands that he constantly purchase materials to fix the vehicles, such as paint and other indispensable materials.  David’s dream is to build his own house and turn his children into professionals.  

He wants to purchase a compressor because the one he uses has broken down and doesn’t work anymore.  Because of this, David is asking for a loan to buy a compressor and, with his profits, to pay for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and, with the profits, to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.name: Ikhlas

texts.en: Ikhlas is a 33-year-old Lebanese married woman and has three children. Four years ago, with the aim of helping her husband to supplement the family’s income, she started to work in the agricultural field and also produces homemade food. At present, Ikhlas wants to apply for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase agricultural products and food provisions as well. Ikhlas is a very positive person who always seeks the best for her family.

loans.use: purchase agricultural products and food provisions

loans.name: Los Hijos De Qolquewasi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS HIJOS DE QOLQUEWASI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emma Carola ella es casada y tiene 42 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.
El socio que esta pegado a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the communal bank “Los Hijos de Qolquewasi”; this bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and in the department of Cusco.

The partner is Emma Carola, she is married, 42 years old, and has 3 children. The partner has her own cereal business; she sells corn, wheat and quinoa grains; she works from 8 AM until 5 PM. She has been working in this business for 4 years and she has been doing really well. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her cereals. The partner is requesting a loan to purchase wheat, corn and quinoa grains.

The partner who has his photo attached to the group photo had his photo taken after the group meeting; he asked for permission due to previously scheduled work. 

The other partners sell cereal grains, clothing goods, grocery goods and a restaurant business. 

The partner thanks everyone who makes this dream possible through Kiva and she is committed to repaying the loan in the established time frame.

loans.use: to purchase corn, wheat, and quinoa to sell.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is 27 years old and single. He runs a primary school in Nairobi's Uthiru area and he is also a teacher there. He also supports his brother, who is in school.

He will be using this loan to buy construction materials for building new classrooms. This will enable him to enrol more pupils. He plans to use the generated profits to expand the school.

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loan successfully. In future Arthur hopes to expand his school and be able to help his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building classrooms.

loans.name: Heber Jhovany

texts.es:
Heber es un hombre de 23 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y trabaja en el departamento de ventas de una empresa distribuidora.
Él es emprendedor, sincero, Inteligente, generoso, comprensivo, paciente, buen oyente, solidario, fuerte, luchador, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en una empresa de productos de consumo para el cuidado e higiene personal y familiar, ofrece productos como: pañales para niños y adultos, papel higiénico, toallas femeninas, toallitas húmedas, pañuelos faciales, servilletas, entre otros.
Heber es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el español. Él se encuentra estudiando la carrera de ingeniería industrial en la Universidad Mayor de San Andrés, y se encuentra adquiriendo profundos conocimientos en los aspectos técnicos, económicos y humanos inherentes a la marcha y evolución de las empresas tanto las de producción como las de servicios.
Su sueño es terminar de estudiar su carrera, trabajar en una empresa y mejorar su calidad de vida. Él desea invertir su préstamo en la compra de una laptop, un scanner y un data show para generar ingresos extras realizando el servicio de datashow en conferencias y disertaciones; para terminar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Heber, 23, is single and has no children.  He's enterprising, sincere, intelligent, generous, understanding, patient, a good listener, supportive, strong, persevering, responsible, and very hardworking.

He works in the sales department of a company that distributes personal and family hygiene products such as diapers for children and adults, toilet paper, feminine napkins, moist towelettes, facial tissue, napkins, and so on.

Heber is dark and of medium build, and has short black hair; his native language is Spanish.  Currently he's studying industrial engineering at the Universidad Mayor de San Andrés.  He's acquiring an in-depth knowledge of the technical, economic, and human aspects inherent to the progress and evolution of businesses, in terms of both production and service.

His dream is to finish his program, work for a company, and improve his quality of life.

Heber wants to invest his loan in buying a laptop computer, a scanner, and a data show projector to generate extra income by using this equipment for conferences and dissertations to finish school.

loans.use: a laptop computer, a scanner, and a data show projector to generate extra income by using this equipment for conferences and dissertations to finish school.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
Heriberto tiene 44 años, es conviviente, es conocido en el medio, por la labor de compra y venta de ganado. Vive en casa familiar, con su conyuge e hijas de 02 y 06 años respectivamente. Heribertoes cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales, vive en una comunidad habitada por personas respetuosas, dedicadas al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Heriberto se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno, caprino y ovino, desde hace más de 03 años aproximadamente, y también trabaja como jornalero agrícola, él necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado, para poder hacer crecer su negocio, lo que en corto plazo le generará mayores ingresos, dado que sus ventas aumentarán y por ende mejorarán sus ganancias al igual que su caldiad de vida y la de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Heriberto is 44 years old, married, and is known in the area for his work of buying and selling cattle. He lives with his spouse and his daughters, who are 2 and 6. Heriberto has good personal and work references, and lives in a community inhabited by respectable people, working in trade, agriculture, and livestock farming. This community is located in located in the Lagunas district, in the Chiclayo Province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Perú's northern coast.

For about three years, Heriberto has made a living buying and selling cattle, goats, and sheep. He also works as an agricultural day laborer. He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a larger amount of livestock to grow his business. This will, in the short term, generate higher revenues, since sales will increase and thus improve profits. Accordingly, his and his family’s quality of life will also improve.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount of livestock, in order to grow his business.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo tiene 66 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su conyugue, no cuenta con ningun hijo en su poder; vive en la parte rural del distrito de San Felipe, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú, pero cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

La actividad que realiza Amparo es el cultivo y venta de lima, cuenta con clientela fija, asi como compradores del caserio de San Felipe, cuenta con un aproximado de 8 años dedicandose a este rubro. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en compra de abonos para su parcela el cual le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Amparo  is 66 years old and he lives in his own rustic home with his wife. He does not have any children. He lives in a rural part of his district of San Felipe, but he has running water and electricity.
Ampara grows and sells lima beans and has a faithful clientele as well as buyers from San Felipe. He has been involved in this particular venture for 8 years. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizer for his land which will generate more income and help him be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer for his land to generate more income for his family.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 36-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. In 2010, she began to work from her home in producing homemade food. She works with excitement and enthusiasm as she likes this occupation. Maria is well known in her region by the delicious food that she prepares, noting that she cultivates some types of produce on her own. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase raw materials so that she can increase her productivity and therefore her profits.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her homemade-food business

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 46 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, con su conyugue y sus hijos, vive en la parte rural del distrito de Cañaris, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú; contando con servicios de agua y luz.

La actividad que realiza Manuel es el comercio y cria de ganado caprino, las compras las realiza en caserios aledaños y las ventas las realiza en Hualapampa, Manuel cuenta con 10 años dedicandose a este negocio, además cuenta con una mototaxi la cual le permite obtener ingresos adicionles. El destino del crédito serà para ivertir en su negocio en compra de mayor cantidad de ganado, con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is forty-six years old and lives in his own home, of rustic materials, with his wife and children.  He lives in the rural part of the Cañaris District of the Ferreñafe Province, in the Lambayeque Region on the north coast of Peru, where there is water and electric service.

Manuel makes a living in the business of raising goats, which he buys in nearby hamlets and sells them in Hualapampa.  For ten years Manuel has been making a living in this business.  Additionally he has a motorcycle taxi which permits him to earn additional income.  The purpose of the loan will be to invest in the purchase of more goats, with which he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in his business buying a greater quantity of goats, with which he will generate greater income and in this way improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos dependientes, vive con su familia (esposo e hijo)en el distrito de san Felipe, desde hace más de 10 años; ella cuenta con un terreno agrícola el cual esta ubicado a unos 15 minutos de su domicilio; Rosa vive en una comunidad en donde la actividad principal es la agricultura mayormente el cultivo de lima, sus pobladores son muy amables y respetuosos; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Rosa se dedica a la cría de animales de corral como cuyes, gallinas, patos, etc., cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro, además se dedica a la elaboración y venta de helados en su distrito y en caserío cercanos; su conyugue se desempeña como maestro de construcción en su distrito, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Rosa necesita el préstamo para invirtirlo en la compra de una mayor cantidad y variedad de animales para poder complacer todos los gustos de su público consumidor, y esta manera poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old, she is in a common law marriage and has 3 dependent children. She has lived with her family (husband and children) in the district of San Felipe for more than 10 years, and she has some agricultural land that is located about 15 minutes from her home. Rosa lives in a community where the principal activity is agriculture, mainly the growing of limes. The people are very nice and respectful, and the community is located in the Jaen province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

Rosa earns a living raising barnyard animals like guinea pigs, chickens, ducks, etc. She has more than 5 years of experience in this industry, and she also makes and sells ice creams in the district and in nearby villages. Her husband works as a master builder in their district, and has very good personal and work references. Rosa is requesting the loan to invest it in buying a larger number and variety of animals to be able to please all of the needs of the public consumer, and in this way she can obtain an acceptable activity to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger number and variety of animals.

loans.name: Yannet Mariella

texts.es:
Yannet es una persona entusiasta de 29 años, soltera y vive junto a su familia en Independencia. En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar voley con sus vecinas y su mayor motivación en la vida son sus padres.
Debido a algunos problemas económicos no pudo estudiar una profesión y para ayudar a su familia buscó un trabajo. Actualmente labora en una prestigiosa empresa como empleada, Yannet cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y  principalmente porque quiere brindar un futuro mejor a sus padres y hermanos.
Yannet está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar algunos enseres para su hogar, como ollas, platos, y juego de muebles pasa su casa así mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yannet is an enthusiastic person. She's 29, single, and lives with her family in Independencia. In her spare time, she likes to play volleyball with her neighbors and her main motivation in life is her parents.

Due to some economic problems, she could not study for a profession. To help her family, she sought a job. She is currently working in a prestigious company as an employee. Yannet believes she is doing well in her job mainly because she wants to provide a better future for her parents and siblings.

Yannet is grateful to Kiva lenders because the support they are giving. She wants to purchase pots, plates, and a furniture set for her home to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pots, plates, and a furniture set for her home to improve her quality of life

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Caacupe está en su 1° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana quien se dedica a la elaboración de comidas, dice estar muy contenta por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que a través de las capacitaciones y la instrucción, podrá incrementar sus ganancias, y seguir ayudando a su familia.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, pollo, jamón, queso, y demás.
texts.en:
The group “Virgen de Caacupe” is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members have taken the poverty elimination survey.

One of the members is Sra. Juana, who prepares food. She says that she is very pleased with the opportunity she has received. Through the training and instruction, Juana will be able to increase her earnings and continue helping her family. She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for preparing her dishes such as vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese, and other items.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, ham, cheese, and other supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Siana

texts.en:
Siana has been running a small cafe in the town of Armavir for two years now. She rents a small space in one of the busy parts of the city. Siana works with various grocery distributors on credit sales. As her clients' demands are growing each day, Siana is willing to buy some assets to better present her cafe (new tables and chairs). The loan will also be very useful for this hardworking young entrepreneur to purchase some drinks for her cafe.

Siana lives with her two school-age children and works hard to cover their daily needs.

Siana's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Siana will be very grateful to lenders for their support and the opportunity to develop her business.

loans.use: to pay for new tables and chairs for her cafe and also to purchase drinks

loans.name: Naripragati Shg Group

texts.en:
Sundarmani is 26 years old and lives with her husband and her four children. Sundarmani is running a small grocery shop that she started two years ago to support her family. Her husband helps her to bring grocery items from the market, as he is a farmer involved in vegetable cultivation. Both earn 4,000 INR per month, which is very low. That is why she wants to expand her business to earn more money for her children. 

Sundarmani has formed a self-help group called Naripragati Self-Help Group (SHG) with nine other women from her village. All members of this group are engaged in different kinds of activities such as vegetable cultivation, milk selling, flower selling, etc., and all are very responsible and loyal towards their businesses. 

Sundarmani, along with her group, has requested a loan amount of 150,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase more grocery items such as sugar, oil, biscuits, rice, etc. She wants to educate her children, give them a better standard of living, and save some money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, oil, biscuits, tea, rice, etc.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is 38 years old, married, and blessed with three children. 

Her husband is self-employed and runs a tailoring business in his community. He takes orders from different boutiques in Lahore, completes, and delivers them. He has five years of experience in this business. He started this business with the intention to grow it, open his own boutique, and, most of all, raise income for the family. His business has since grown and now he gets frequent orders. 

Currently, his Juki sewing machine is out of order due to constant usage and it needs to be replaced with a new one. But, Ayesha's husband has insufficient funds. He needs the machine urgently because he has to complete orders from a boutique. Therefore, Ayesha has requested a loan to help her husband buy a new Juki sewing machine. 

Ayesha is thankful and her dream is to get her children educated.

loans.use: to buy a Juki sewing machine for her husband's tailoring work.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood and charcoal in the village. 

With the KES 10,000 loan, Mwanaisha wants to purchase bundles of charcoal to sell. She decided to join to Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a hardworking woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Resty has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Resty has requested a loan of Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell and will help Resty to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for her child. Resty hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a saloon business. 

Resty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nurlanbek

texts.ru: Нурланбеку 39 лет, женат, трое детей школьного возраста. Нурланбек в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи в 1998 году начал свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря упорному труду Нурланбека на сегодняшний день в его хозяйстве имеется 2 коровы, 50 овец, 2 лошади. Прибыль от ведения бизнеса составляет в среднем 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своей деятельности, Нурланбек обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, а именно 10 овец. Нурланбек является лидером группы "Степ", в которой кроме него состоят еще 2 человека, всего в группе 3 участника. Доходы от кредита Нурланбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Nurlanbek is 39 years old, married and has three school-age children. In search of a source of income for his family, he started his own animal husbandry business in 1998. Thanks to Nurlanbek's hard work, today his business has 2 cows, 50 sheep and 2 horses. The profit from running the business amounts to an average of 25,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop his business, Nurlanbek requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock - 10 sheep. Nurlanbek is a leader of the "Step" group that, besides him, included 2 more people, with a total of 3 participants. Nurlanbek is planning to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing his business and building a large barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy five sheep in order to grow his business

loans.name: Fe En Dios Group

texts.es: David, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 1 hijo, reside  en una aldea del municipio de Tela, Atlántida cerca a la zona del Progreso. Anteriormente trabajo como jornalero en la finca de palma y hace 3 años decidió por su propio negocio de venta de  carnes de res y cerdo, esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante, compra y vende las carnes. Ha solicitado dos prestamos anteriores para mantener el negocio, actualmente solicita otro en forma grupal por 11,000 lempiras para comprar mas carnes para aumentar las ventas. Su plan es establecerse económicamente y mejorar la calidad de vida con su familia. El grupo se llama Fe en Dios, integrado por  8 personas que se dedican a varias actividades comerciales como venta de carnes, ropa, sandalias y golosinas. Residen en la misma comunidad. El  monto del préstamo grupal es de 88,000 lempiras, este dinero lo invertirán en la compra de mas productos como carnes, ropa, sandalias, golosinas etc. para la venta. En la foto están, a la izquierda Feliciano, Jesús, Marlon, David, Sandra, Karen, Maria y Alba a la derecha.
texts.en:
David is 31 years old, and he lives with his common-law-wife, with whom he has one child.  He lives in a village in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida, near the zone of El Progreso. Previously, he worked for daily wages on a palm plantation, and three years ago he decided to go into business for himself, selling beef and pork.  He carries out this activity--purchasing and selling the meats--in an ambulatory fashion. 

He has requested two previous loans in order to maintain his business, and he is currently requesting a group loan of 11,000 lempiras in order to purchase meat and increase his sales. His plan is to establish himself financially and improve his family's quality of life. 

The group is called "Fe en Dios" [Faith in God], and it is composed of 8 people who devote themselves to various business activities such as selling meat, clothing, sandals, and snacks. They live in the same community. They will invest the loan amount, 88,000 lempiras, in the purchase of more products such as meat, clothing, sandals, snacks, and similar items in order to sell them. 

Going from left to right in the photo are Feliciano, Jesús, Marlon, David, Sandra, Karen, María and Alba.

loans.use: to purchase meat to sell.

loans.name: Marguba

texts.ru: Маргуба родилась в 1989 году. Она целеустремленная девушка. Маргуба не замужем и живет в отдаленном регионе со своими родителями. Маргуба после окончания средней школы она не имела возможности поступить в университет и получить высшее образование. Ее родители занимаются скотоводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур. Маргуба с детства помогала родителям откармливать скот. Теперь она хочет начать собственный бизнес. Она с такой целью участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она обратилась за займом в сумму 550 сомони для покупки мелко-рогатого скота, чтобы начать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Marguba was born in 1989. She is a goal-oriented young woman. Marguba is not married and lives in a remote region with her parents. After completing secondary school, Marguba did not have the opportunity to go to a university and obtain a higher education. Her parents are involved in animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops. Marguba has been helping her parents to feed livestock since childhood. Now she wants to start her own business. With this goal in mind, she participated in the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained a certificate. She requested a loan in the amount of 550 somoni to buy small livestock and start her new business. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to buy small livestock and start her new business

loans.name: Lydia's Group

texts.en:
Lydia's group is comprised of hardworking women. Lydia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household commodities. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more household items, and will help Lydia to generate greater profits and provide for her children. Lydia hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a super market. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more household items to sell

loans.name: Shikha

texts.en:
Shikha is a 30-year-old married woman living with her husband, Kanu, in Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. Shikha's husband is a trader of electronic appliances. He started his business many years back. He sells many kinds of electrical accessories and appliances in a small store. His business is located in the local market, and he has a lot of customers. His profits from his business are good. Shikha also helps her husband in his work.

For further expanding her husband's business, Shikha applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She will use this money to increase her husband's business through purchasing many kinds of electronic accessories and simple electrical goods (wire, bulbs, tube lights, fans, cords, etc.) for his store in order to meet all the demands of the customers.

Shikha expects that the loan will help her husband to expand his business and will strengthen the economic condition of her family, for which she is much grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase electrical accessories and goods for her husband's business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge in her business. Halima dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil.

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Uma is a 31-year-old woman from a remote region of Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Uttam, and is a mother of two sons. Her sons go to school.

Uma's husband is associated with a grill business. He manufactures iron grills and sells them to his neighbors and villagers. He has been involved in this business for many years. He decided to start this business because it is a profitable business, as there are very few grill shops in the village. He has a small shop near their house. 

With their present economic situation when prices of essential commodities are increasing daily, Uma and her husband decided to expand their business. Thus, Uma has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase raw materials such as iron rods, colors, etc. from the wholesale market. She and her husband hope it will improve their business and that they can satisfy the demand of their customers.

Uma wants to provide a good education to her children with the profit from her business. She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva for this financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her husband’s grill business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.  With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Ketevani

texts.en:
Ketevani, who is a 25-year-old single woman, lives in Lagodekhi district. She lives alone and makes her living working as a store manager and earns a fixed salary. In order to increase her productivity and increase her income, Ketevani decided to start her own business. 

Ketevani requested a loan and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up program gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. So Ketevani decided to purchase stock of used clothing and open a store. She has already rented a place for her store, which has a good location. 

This additional source of income to this hardworking woman will greatly help her to make better living condition and save money for future. Ketevani will be really grateful for the help Kiva lenders can provide her new business initiative.

loans.use: to purchase stock of used clothing

loans.name: Romaine

texts.fr:
- 
Romaine a 49 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants résident à agoè. Elle  Achat et vente de la viande de brousse. Elle s'approvisionne 3 fois par mois à la  frontière Togo- Ghana et revend a sa  devanture de son domicile. Romaine sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en: Romaine is 49 years old, married, and the mother of three children residing in Agoè. She buys and sells bushmeat. She gets her supplies three times a month at the Togo-Ghana border and resells the goods in front of her home. Romaine is requesting this loan to expand her commerce in order to make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase 2 loads of boa meat, 4 loads of “waranbs”, and 15 loads of vipers.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: Mercedes tiene  37 años de edad  es la mayor  de sus hermanos  nos comenta   que creció en un hogar humilde pero con con bastante  unión familiar afortunadamente  ella conto con todo el apoyo de sus padres  y pudo estudiar  y terminar su bachillerato  eso le ha servido mucho ya que su familia tiene una pequeña finca y un negocio de buses  así que ella es la encargada de la administración  de estos negocios , ella es madre soltera tiene una hija y siempre  ha vivido en casa de sus padres , en la pequeña finca que tienen  no  hay energía eléctrica  es por eso que aplicara a trámite de crédito  para comprar un sistema solar e instalarlo  esto ayudara a que la propiedad adquiera  más valor  y se pueda realizar otras actividades en la misma
texts.en:
Mercedes is 37 years old.  She is the oldest of her siblings.  She says that she grew up in a home that was humble but had plenty of family unity.  Fortunately, she had her parents’ full support and she managed to study and finish high school.  This has served her well because her family has a small farm and a bus business, so she is in charge of administration for these businesses.  She is a single mother—she has one daughter and has always lived in her parents’ home.  

There isn’t any electricity on their small farm, so she has applied for a loan to purchase and install a solar energy system.  This will help improve the value of the property, and it would be possible to do other types of work there.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system

loans.name: Bakhtiniso

texts.ru:
Бахтинисо год назад купила земельный дом в селе района Джиликуль и переехала туда со своей семьей. Теперь она хотела бы там заняться животноводством, так как это основной вид деятельности в сельской местности. Бахтинисо замужняя женщина в возрасте 43 лет. Ее дочь работает в больнице, а сын официант в столовой. 
Бахтинисо на сумму запрашиваемого кредита хочет купить двух голов крупнорогатого скота и начать бизнес по их откорму и продаже. В виде начального капитала она имеет коровник и корм для скотов. Бахтинисо надеется на поддержку. Она хочет принести в семью дополнительный источник дохода и улучшить жизненные условия.
texts.en: Bakhtiniso purchased a house and land in a village of the Jilikul district a year ago and moved there with her family. Now she wants to start an animal husbandry business there because this is the primary type of business in rural areas. Bakhtiniso is a married 43-year-old woman. Her daughter works at a hospital, and son is a waiter at a cafe. Bakhtiniso wants to use this loan to buy two heads of cattle and start a business of fattening up and selling livestock. She has a cowshed and livestock feed as the initial capital. Bakhtiniso hopes for the support. She wants to bring in an additional source of income for her family and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two heads of cattle and start a business of fattening up and selling livestock

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 26 years old and married. Her spouse Duncan does provide additional income and together they have been blessed with three children. She does dairy farming and she supplies milk to various customers in her area.

She will be using this loan amount to buy another dairy cow. This will enable her to increase her milk produce. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more dairy cows. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and in the future she hopes to add more stock of dairy cows and also to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma operates a fish-selling business. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Fatuma dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future and she appreciates for the support of the previous loan that helped her to grow her business. 

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik has been involved in clothing sales for four years. She purchases the stock of clothing from Yerevan town and resells it in Gyumri town and nearby communities.  Arevik lives with her husband who is a taxi driver, and her retired father-in-law. 

She is applying for a loan in order to travel and purchase large orders of goods at a lower cost to improve her business. The loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of clothing to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is a 48-year-old widowed woman, from the village Martkopi. She lives with her student son, and her mother-in-law who gets monthly assistance from local government. Vera has her own small business of sewing. In particular, she gets private orders from her villagers and generates insignificant income. She also owns several pigs, which are sold locally after growing. Vera wants somehow to increase her family's living condition and to start another activity. Particularly, she decided to request a loan and go to Turkey, where she will purchase stock of linens and various kinds of personal-use products and then sell them in her community at increased prices. The family belongs to the subsistence poor category, as they have no source of significant income and live in poverty.  

According to the above-mentioned situation, Vera lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Vera to get a loan of 1,500 GEL and start a trading business.  She is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure her son with good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Vera is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase stock to start a trading business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of women’s and men’s clothing, bags, purses, and costume jewelry pieces.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in Goris town with her husband and two school-age children. Narine's husband is a lecturer in the University. Narine herself has been involved in clothing sales for three years. She rents a small shop in the Goris town where she runs her business successfully. 

For staying competitive in the market, and also for meeting current demand, Narine asks for financial support from Kiva lenders to be able to acquire new stock of clothing for her shop. The loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The startup loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing

loans.name: Njeri

texts.en:
Njeri owns rental houses in Nairobi's Thika Road area and has been in the business for five years. She is 58 years old and widowed. Her five children are all grown up and she supports four members of her family. Right now she makes a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She will use this loan to buy construction materials such as iron sheets, timber, nails, wall paint and cement. This will enable her to repair her rental houses and keep them in good condition. She will use the anticipated profits to build more rental houses.  This is her fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she has repaid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes and dreams are to build more rental houses and to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairing rental houses.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en: Margarit has been running her clothing sales business successfully for three years. She lives in Kapan town with her mother. Margarit trades with different clothing supplies from her house and gets income, which is very important for the family's living. The requested loan is very important for Margarit to purchase new stock of clothing for selling to her customers. The loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is 46 years old. She is married with three children aged between 20 and 12 years, and all of them go to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been running in a business for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more ground nuts, sorghum, beans and maize to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more ground nuts, sorghum, beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 51-year-old widow from Akhmeta district. She lives with her pensioner mother and daughter, who is temporarily unemployed. In spite of her high education, Ana was unable to find any stable job, so she developed her agricultural business. She cultivates family-owned agricultural land, grows various kinds of vegetables, and sells it in the local market. The income is seasonal and is hardly enough for covering even basic needs. Due to this situation, Ana decided to request a loan for starting a stable activity. After several unsuccessful attempts, Ana applied for the credit from MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 
So, Ana plans to go to Turkey, purchase home products at wholesale prices, and sell it locally in increased prices. The family's living conditions will significantly improve, and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.
Ana and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their trading business.

loans.use: To start trading with home products and increase her income

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Françoise is 35 years old. She is married with one child who is one year, not yet going to school. She has a shop and has been working in her business for the past 7 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, soaps, paraffin, salt, and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and expand her business in order to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more rice, soaps, paraffin, salt, and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Valeriy

texts.en:
Valeriy is married. He has three adult sons. Valeriy lives in a village and has a small business. He grows vegetables and has been doing this for 35 years. He has two greenhouses for vegetables and two greenhouses for seedlings. 

Now he is helping his middle son to start his own business. Together they bought land to build a new greenhouse. Valeriy is asking for a loan in the amount of 40,000 UAH to buy a boiler to heat the new greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy a boiler for heating the greenhouse.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en:
Pastora has switched from selling snacks to "snack vending" (making snacks for others to sell). Her business is doing well when she doubles her time, perfecting her own snack vending recipe. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keep pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

The reason why she availed another loan from PMPC is to buy more food ingredients for her "snack vending" business. Today, Pastora is able to help others have retailing businesses by selling her snacks aand they too can earn for their own family.

loans.use: to buy more food ingredients for her "snack vending" business.

loans.name: Elisi

texts.en: Elisi is 41 years old. She is married with five children aged between 18 and 5 years, and all of them go to school. She sells building materials and has been running this business for the past seven years. With the loan, she would like to buy more paints, iron sheets and cement to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more paints, iron sheets and cement to sell.

loans.name: Costance

texts.en: Constance is 55 years old. She is married with seven children aged between 32 and 14 years, and three of them go school. She sells foodstuffs and has been working in this business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, sorghum and rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and for their welfare.

loans.use: to buy more beans, sorghum and rice to sell.

loans.name: Segundo Luis

texts.es:
Segundo hace 30 años está radicado en Colombia es un ecuatoriano que vino en busca de mejores oportunidades para su vida, trabajo como comerciante trayendo productos novedoso a Colombia.

Es un hombre casado y tiene 3 hijos y recibe gran apoyo de uno de ellos que siempre está ahí para él y le atiende su negocio cuando Segundo se encuentra ausente.

Tiene un café internet donde genera un empleo el de su hijo, como estamos en vísperas de septiembre donde en Colombia se celebra el día del amor y la amistad quiere comprar surtido en peluches, chocolates, tarjetas emotivas, también quiere comprar una impreso, fotocopiadora, y productos de papelería lo que justifica el monto del préstamo. 

Su sueño es seguir gozando su vida en Colombia un país que le brindó la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida, de crecer como persona, como empresario y como padre
texts.en:
Segundo has lived in Colombia for 30 years. He is an Ecuadoran that came in search of better opportunities for his life. He worked as a salesman, bringing new products to Colombia. He is a married man and has three children. He gets a lot of support from one of them who is always there from him and he attends to the business when Segundo can't be there. 

He has an internet cafe where his son works. Since we are in the eve of September, during which Colombia celebrates the day of love and friendship, he wants to buy stuffed animals, chocolates and emotional cards. He also wants to buy a printer, copier and paper products. This explains the amount of the loan. His dream is to continue enjoying his life in Colombia, a country to which he owes the opportunity to improve his quality of life, to grow as a person, businessman and father.

loans.use: to buy a copier, printer, paper goods, stuffed animals, chocolates, cards and posters for the month of love and friendship in Colombia.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more accessories and cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn has benefited through poultry farming. The previous loan from UGAFODE was used to buy poultry feeds and increased the egg production and the growth rate. 

She is now applying for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to complete her house that is located in Kagadi. She hopes this will help her cut down on the cost spent on rent and also provide modest shelter for her siblings. She is a hardworking person whose dream is to create employment opportunities for the many jobless youth. Her major challenge is the high cost of feeds for the chickens.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 48-year-old living in Rawalpindi. She is a stay-at-home mother of seven children. Given their big family, her husband works really hard to make sure that their needs are met.

A year ago her husband started an auto spare parts shop business. So far, this business has been doing well and her husband has been able to cover a major portion of his start up costs.

Given the growth in his business, he wants to buy more auto spare part items to sell in order to increase his earnings, but he does not have sufficient funds to pay for the purchases as his business is new. Therefore, in order to help her husband, Irshad has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner. She is hopeful that this will help her husband in his business.

loans.use: to increase her husband's auto spare parts shop

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina is 27 years old. She is married with 2 children ages 5 and 4 years old, both of them go to school. She has a shop and has been running her business for the past 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cooking oil, lotion, soap, maize flour, and small fish for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy land in order to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, lotion, soap, maize flour, and small fish for sale

loans.name: Kizinga Group

texts.en:
Kizinga, a new group from Tujijenge Tanzania, consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Geladina is among the members who are requesting their first loan. She will invest this loan in buying a water storage tank and cooking oil for her business. She wants to store more water so that she can sell up to the day when there will be no power for pumping water. She dreams that one day she will be able to renovate her house and live a better life.  

Geladina is in her late fifties and a divorcee with four grown children. She takes care of some relatives, four children who are at school. Genge is her business which she has been with for eleven years now, selling fruits, vegetables, cooking oil and bananas for food. Bananas were her first business prior to moving to genge. After running it for several years, she decided to change so that she would be able to sell a variety of products. 

Now, she also sells local chickens. She is a busy mother who is dreaming high, working from 05:00am to 09:00pm per working day and is able to realize a good monthly profit.

loans.use: to buy a water storage tank and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Suchitepéquez se caracteriza por ser una ciudad bien poblada con casas muy bien estructuradas y modernas,  construidas con materiales muy sofisticada. El desarrollo socioeconómico ha sido un factor principal pero también la mano de obra por albañiles y constructores calificados como es el caso de Cruz albañil de 56 años de edad con una familia de siete  hijos, los dos primeros hijos ya tiene familias separadas y los cinco últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que el realiza es la albañilería el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 50 años y se a convertido en una muy buena fuente de ingresos par el y su familia,  el es muy dedicado a su trabajo lo realiza de la forma más correcta y rápida para dejar las construcciones de su comunidad muy bien hechas.

El crédito que ha solicitado lo quiere utilizar para la compra de herramientas de albañilería para poder trabajar y realizar su trabajo con más rapidez y bien hecho, uno de sus sueños mientras corre el tiempo es convertirse en un maestro de obras y enseñarles a sus hijos el mismo oficio y que ellos estudien para que sean profesionales en el mañana.
texts.en:
Suchitepéquez is known for being a populous city with well-structured and modern homes built from sophisticated materials. Socioeconomic development has been a principal factor but also the work by brick-layers and qualified builders like the bricklayer Cruz. He is 56 years old with a family of seven children. The two first children already have their own families and the last five are excellent students in the school in their community. 

The work that he does is bricklaying. He has been doing this for 50 years and it has become a very good source of income for himself and his family. He is very dedicated to his and he does his work as efficiently and quickly as possible so that the buildings in his community are very well done. He wants to use the loan that his is requesting is to buy bricklaying tools to be able to work and do his job as quickly and as well as possible. One of his dreams is to become a master builder and to teach his children that same work and that they study to become professionals later in life.

loans.use: to buy bricklaying tools.

loans.name: Zandra

texts.en:
Guatemalan artist Zandra specializes in handcrafted jade jewelry. She would like to invest in purchasing silver and jade in bulk for her designs.

Zandra has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"I was born in Quiché, but I grew up in an orphanage in San Lucas, Toliman. The first thing I ever made on my own was a pair of silver earrings. My husband taught me so I could help him. I remember watching him work on his own 'til all hours of the night and I really wanted to learn how to craft jewelry. As I saw the jewelry I had been crafting and saw how beautiful it was, I felt happy. I like to work with jade because it is a sacred stone for us Maya people. Jade used to be worn as an amulet, and those who wore the most jade pieces were considered to be the most important people in the community. Rescuing the value of our traditions is always important."

"Thank you very much your support through this microcredit! I am honored to see people beyond Guatemala's borders wear my designs. Each of them bears my best wishes."

Use the link below to view Zandra's jade jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8030

loans.use: to purchase silver and jade in bulk for her designs.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a house wife and lives in Rawalpindi with her family. She is 34 years old and a mother of four children. She has applied for a loan from Brac Pakistan to help her husband to pay for the maintenance cost of his taxi. 

Her husband is a taxi driver by profession and has been driving a taxi for the last seven years. He is an honest and hardworking man. He works day and night to make sure that their daily needs are met. He does not have sufficient income to save for other purposes. As the income they get from driving the taxi only covers their daily expenses, they are unable to save money. After receiving this loan, her husband will be able to repair his taxi. 

Rubina and her husband want their children to get formal education and have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's taxi repair.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.en:
Juan Ramon is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in hand-carved wood sculptures. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood, so that he can begin to prepare items for the holiday selling season.

Juan Ramon has been selling through NOVICA since 2014. This is his story:

"I've always enjoyed working with wood, as a kid in school it was my favorite craft. This passion continued when I studied architecture, especially when planning the models. Can you guess which one was my favorite? Yes of course, wood! Why do I tell you all of this? Well, because that's how I came to realize that wood and I have always gotten along really well. I believe it is innate in me. Most of my inspiration comes from the Maya culture and I try to use wood as a medium to convey the greatness of the Maya and their relevance. It's so important for humanity to know about the Mayas, their charm, their discoveries and their mysteries!"

"I really appreciate this microcredit, as it will allow me to prepare in advance for the busiest time of year. I hope you will all like the quality of the items that I design and craft."

Use the link below to view Juan Ramon's hand-carved wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/9297

loans.use: to purchase wood in bulk, so that he can begin to prepare items for the holiday selling season.

loans.name: Muhammad Aslam Sallu

texts.en:
M Aslam belongs to Karachi. He has a bakery business in the nearby market. He is 45 years old, is married and has three children.  He started this business 10 years ago and it has been doing well. In order to make his business more profitable he wants to bake more bakery items such as cakes, biscuits and nimko etc. Given that his sales are good he is positive that this extra investment will help him reap more benefits from his business. Due to shortage of money he has requested a loan to make more bakery items from Brac Pakistan, a Kiva Partner that he will repay from his monthly income from the business. 

He dreams of a quality life for his family and wants a brighter future for his children.

loans.use: To buy material to make bakery products

loans.name: Mafia

texts.en:
Mafia is a 32-year-old woman, living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Mostly people like to chew betel leaf, so that a few years ago her husband decided to open a paan shop to offer different kinds of betel leaf to the people. He offers kinds of betel leaf such as sweet pan, which consists of a mixture of chopped or coarsely ground areca nuts, mint, coconut, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves), and various spices, and tobacco pan, which consists of powdered tobacco. 

He is an expert in preparing pan because he has been running this shop for many years, and lots of customers like to take betel leaf that is prepared by him. To cope with the increasing demand, he wants keep more stock of ingredients so that he can maximize his income. 

Therefore, Mafia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy betel leaf, chopped areca nuts, tobacco, etc. to sell. 

Mafia thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy betel leaf, chopped areca nuts, tobacco, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en: Ghazala belongs to Rawalpindi. She is 35 years old. She is a housewife and has 4 children. Her husband has a paint shop business. He has been running this business for over nine years now. Her husband is the sole earner in the family. They have a big family and their expenses are increasing everyday. Her husband feels that if he purchase more stock for his paint shop, he will be able to do more business. Given the shortage of funds, Ghazala has requested a loan from Brac Pakistan, a Kiva partner. They are hoping that this investment will help them increase their monthly income.

loans.use: to expand her husband's paint shop business

loans.name: Salmanullah Khan

texts.en:
Salmanullah comes from Karachi. He has a a welding shop. His wife is a housewife and looks after the house and their child. He is a hard-working person and makes sure that he is able to provide his family with a better standard of living. He has been in the welding business for more than five years now. His hard work and dedication to his work has paid off and now he is more stable and in a better position to take care of his family. 

In order make his business more lucrative, he wants to buy some welding equipment for his shop. For this reason he has applied for a loan to help him buy equipment. He is hopeful that this will help his business flourish.

loans.use: To purchase welding equipment for his shop

loans.name: Magdaleen

texts.en:
Magdaleen is 41 years old and lives in Rawalpindi with her family. She has 6 children. Not only is she a housewife, but she also financially supports her family. Given her low family income it was not possible for them to meet the daily expenses and make the ends meet. Therefore, she started sewing clothes. This small business has helped her generate income and helps her meet her daily family expenses. She has four years experience in this business. 

Given the increase in demand for tailoring, she wants to buy additional items to increase her income through sewing more clothes. Therefore she has requested for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner. She is hopeful that her business will flourish and aims to provide a better standard of living to her children.

loans.use: to buy items to increase her stitching business.

loans.name: Oyahida

texts.en:
Oyahida is 24 years old. She is a rural woman who hails from Dhupguri.  She is married and is blessed with one young and lovely daughter. She lives in Baroghoria village in Jalpaiguri district with her husband and daughter. Oyahida has a secondary education whereas her husband is an Arts graduate.

Oyahida's husband Mahabul (25 years old) is engaged in farming. He cultivates his ancestral plot of land, where he grows tomatoes, cucumbers, beans and other seasonal vegetables. He has experience in the sector. But these days, it has become difficult to maintain his family with his small income, when the prices of essential goods are increasing by leaps and bounds. So Oyahida and her husband have decided to grow a profitable crop like paddy on their farmland. For this, they need financial support.

She has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to start and complete the land cultivation during this rainy season. She wants to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers. Successful cultivation of the land will allow Oyahida to gather a rich harvest to sell, and thereby increase her income from agriculture.

Her dreams are to give a proper education to her daughter, strengthen the family economy, and save money for the future.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for lending her the money.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies to cultivate paddy.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for his barber shop.

loans.name: Hadel Group

texts.en:
Adel is the featured borrower of Hadel group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends, and they all seek to develop their business and family's living.

Adel is a 56-year-old married mother of eight. She is a Syrian citizen who runs a grocery store to support her husband in covering their family's living expenses. Adel is well known in her region with the good reputation she has. She is a hard worker who puts so much effort into developing her family's social and financial living. Adel is the first lady from the far left side of the picture. Her acquired loan will be invested in developing her current business through buying special offer products, that will attract customers' attention and increase her income.

As for the other members, Sawsan is a 36-year-old Syrian Citizen. She is a married mother of three, who will start her own clothes and accessories selling business. She is the lady at the center of the picture, while Raghida is the first from the right. She is an English teacher and her acquired loan will be invested in starting her own business. She is a 59-year-old single lady.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special offer products.

loans.name: Heherson

texts.en: Heherson is married and has three children. His wife is a housekeeper who is taking care of their kids. Heherson is engaged in growing rice in their field. He shares that farm work is not easy to perform, if you have not enough experience in farming. But, even for him it’s hard to make it. He needs to do it because it is his family’s source of living.
