His generating income from farming business helps him provide his family’s necessities. Heherson depends only on borrowing money from the traders in able to operate his farm. With this, Heherson decided to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides. He chose ASKI in acquiring a loan because he knows they will help him financially, and for having a low interest.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy herbicides, pesticides, and fertilizers to apply on his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a pumping machine for irrigating the farm.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny (right), pictured with his father (left), is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in handcrafted leather home decor. He would like to invest in the purchase of leather and varnish in bulk for his designs.

Johnny has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story:

"When my dad ran the workshop, we specialized in Colonial motifs. I prefer Inca motifs. I like to try new things, including different leather tooling methods, and in doing so I realize the quality of my work improves drastically. Some people from the United States visited my workshop and liked my work, and since then they keep commissioning items for cowboys. This experience has taught me the value of constantly creating and renovating, and working with different materials, including leather, wood, and forged iron. I am regarded as being one of the few tanners in Peru that still works with his hands. There used to be many leather tannery workshops, but now there are only two where I live, and ours is one of them."

"I would like to thank you for making this microcredit possible, because you're making it possible for me to purchase the materials I need to continue crafting the products you like."

Use the link below to view Johnny's handcrafted leather home decor on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7081

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of leather and varnish in bulk for his designs.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Rosibel, tiene 30 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene dos hijos y reside en una aldea del Municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Barbara.  Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, lleva 5 años de dedicarse a vender ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante en la comunidad, vende vestidos para niñas, ropa para niños, camisetas, blusas  y otros. El préstamo es por 8,000 lempiras para surtir de más ropa para niños, niñas, damas y caballeros, con el fin de tener variedad y aumentar las ventas. En un futuro piensa poner su negocio en un local propio y poder darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosibel is 30 years old. She is married and has two children. They live in the town of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. She has always worked in sales. She has been working for five years selling clothing for women, men and children. She travels through the community with her products, selling dresses for girls, clothing for boys, shirts and blouses among other things. 

The loan is for 8,000 Lempiras to increase her supply of clothing for boys, girls, women and men in order to have more variety and increase sales. In the future, she is thinking about putting her business in a store to allow her to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy clothing for boys, girls, women and men to sell.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 55 years old. She is married with five children aged between 28 and 18 years; three of them go to school. She sells sorghum and has been selling for 10 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more sorghum for resale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in handcrafted silver jewelry. She and her mother Lily would like to invest in the bulk purchase of silver and gemstones for their designs.

Sandra has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is her story:

"At first it was difficult to find authentic gems, so we traveled abroad to get them, until one day a friend told us that indeed one could find genuine stones if they looked in the correct place. We were encouraged to look further, and eventually we found good quality gemstones in Peru. It's been a few years since we began formally designing and crafting jewelry, and we have been met with a large acceptance. Our work is a constant source of inspiration, and we find motivation in the inner peace we feel as we create. Our designs search to transmit and share the positive energy we receive from the stones."

"We are infinitely grateful to you for supporting artisans like us to improve our sales. Your microcredit will make it possible for us to stock up on silver, as well as on natural gemstones, which individually, are available only at certain times of the year."

Use the link below to view Sandra's silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4395

loans.use: to purchase silver and gemstones in bulk for their designs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a Peruvian artisan specializing in leather and silver jewelry. She would like to invest in the bulk purchase of leather and silver to prepare a good stock for the holiday season.

Rosa has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is her story:

"When I was very young, my family saw my natural instinct for drawing, so they found an art teacher for me. Thus I followed this path, and I found it more and more beautiful. I'm a painter but as a girl I learned all about leather, as my father worked with tanners. I design and work with leather, and I also craft jewelry. With both, I select the very best materials. I love to mix natural elements with silver."


"I'd like to send you a big hug across the miles, and my most heartfelt thanks for your support. With your microcredit I can stock up on the materials I use and be ready for the holiday season sales."

Use the link below to view Rosa's leather and silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4665

loans.use: to invest in the bulk purchase of leather and silver to prepare a good stock for the holiday season.

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called 'Blessing' which consists of active women who are driven by a clear desire to change the living conditions of their respective families. They enjoy long experience in their various businesses. They all live in the same area and share strong ties. Their main activity is small business and includes chicken wing and thigh, foodstuff, fresh fish, and second hand clothing. 

Rebecca (standing second from right in the photo) is the representative of this group. She is a very dynamic woman and plays a decisive role in the development of the family. She is 57 years old, single, and has one dependent child. She has a place at her residence where she sells both fried and fresh fish. She has extensive experience in this domain. With this loan, she wants to buy three cartons of fish and oil to fry and sell to customers at her residence. The profits will allow her to increase her savings and better help her child. 

The group members will hold each other responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy three cartons of fish and oil to fry and sell to customers at her residence.

loans.name: Sheeda

texts.en: Sheeda is the age of 45. She is mother of five children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Sheeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her son to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sheeda is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repairing cost of her son's rickshaw.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 34-year-old married woman from Lahore. She is a mother of 4. She is a polite and hardworking person. She is self-employed and is very skillful at embroidery. She stitches intricate designs that her customers really like. This is the reason she has become famous for her work in her community. People appreciate her work and come to her frequently to buy embroidered shirts, clothes and stoles, etc. This small business helps her fulfill her expenses. But she can not save money with her current income. Given the increase in demand for her products and customer base, she wants to enhance her business. But due to a shortage of money, she has requested a loan to help her buy material to make more embroidered products.

loans.use: to enhance her own embroidery work.

loans.name: Nadeem Ahmed

texts.en:
Nadeem is 36 year old and lives in Kotri.  He runs a grocery store in his community.  He has been in this business for 7 years now.  The people in his community know him well and he is reknown for his fair dealing.  This goodwill has helped him retain many customers and now he has a good pool of regular customers. 

He wishes to buy additional grocery items for his store.  He believes this will help him stay proactive so he won't run out of stock and will help him increase him profits.  Therefore, he has requested for a loan from Brac Pakistan, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for his grocery store.

loans.name: Manssour Group

texts.en:
Hayat is the featured borrower for Manssour's group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Hayat is a 58-year-old married woman. Twenty years ago, she started a tailoring business from her house to help her husband, who has a limited salary, to cover their needs and expenses. She worked hard throughout these years, and has succeeded in using her professional tailoring skills to provide her customers with the best service and become well known in her region.

Due to the economic downturn in Lebanon, Hayat has not been able to increase her limited income, which is only enough to cover her basic needs. Hayat needs to improve her housing situation by making it a healthy living place. For this reason, she is acquiring this Kiva loan to make necessary maintenance repairs to her house, since it is both a business space and living place.

Hayat is the first lady at the far right side of the picture. As for the other group members, Monifeh, pictured in the middle, is married and has sold Tupperware for the last ten years, while Maha, on the left, is a married mother of one child and works as a teacher.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance repairs to her house since it is both a business space and living place.

loans.name: Jovilyn

texts.en: Jovilyn formerly worked as an employee. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children she is sending to school. Her husband works abroad as electrician. Jovilyn manages their two vans for hire and for passenger’s transportation as well. While waiting for daily income from her vans, Jovilyn also engages herself in a direct selling business. She collects all her customers’ orders around their village before purchasing the merchandise. With her good service to her customers, she encourages more customers, and more orders as well. In this connection, Jovilyn is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase shoes, powder soap, toothpaste, underwear, and shirts. Jovilyn’s goal is to satisfy her customers with the service she offers.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, powder soap, toothpaste, underwear, and shirts.

loans.name: Nike Air Group

texts.en:
Grace, who is in her early 30s, is married and has one son who is in school. 

For seven years now, she has been running a cafe where she sells fresh milk, soft drinks, and serves lunch foods, such as cooked bananas, ugali and rice with meat, beans, and vegetables. She wakes up early in the morning, works from 06:00am to 09:00pm daily, and is able to realize a good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Grace's second credit request, to be apportioned amongst Nike Air Group, a four-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Grace used the previous credit, since repaid, to start selling some soft drinks wholesale and she bought cooking items, such as a sack of rice, cooking oil, maize, and meals. She is so much happier. She used the extra income she received to cover part of her household expenses and to reinvest in her business. 

Grace has now approached Tujijenge Tanzania to find a new credit which she will use to open her new business, selling clothes, madela, and fabrics. She dreams that, one day, she will further grow her business and become better off. Grace is thankful to everyone who will take the time to support her group.

loans.use: to open her new business, selling clothes, madela, and fabrics.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 50-year-old separated woman.. She has been depending on herself financially by selling household wares for three years. She is planning to expand her business in the future by opening an independent household wares shop. 

Now she needs to buy more household wares in order to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy new household products to re-sell them

loans.name: Trinath Thakur Shg Group

texts.en:
A portion of this group loan will go to support Draupadi. She is the president of Trinath Thakur Self Help Group and is pictured here in the bright red sari in the front row. Most of the women in her group are working in dairy farming or own other small businesses in their village in Odisha, a state on the eastern coast of India. With her portion of the loan, Draupadi will buy more cows to increase her dairy farming business. Her husband works as a florist in the village, and they both support their three children together. After this loan, Draupadi will be able to be more independent and help give her family a better standard of living. 

Draupadi is an entrepreneur at heart and has big dreams of one day owning a large dairy farm. The women in the group also plan to save the money they earn by expanding their businesses to buy a food processing machine, which they can all use to make spices and pickled vegetables together.

Note:- A man standing in the last corner of right hand side is not the part of this loan.

loans.use: to buy more cows and expand her dairy farm

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower has been a patient with Socios En Salud for two years.  She has concluded her studies in speech therapy and physical therapy for rehabilitation, but due to both financial and medical reasons, she was unable to obtain her professional degree.  She wishes to set up her own practice, but in order to do so she must first complete the necessary processes to obtain her license, as well as rent a facility for her practice.
At present, she is offering services at a rehabilitation center, and has been saving money for the purchase of the equipment she needs for her own office. However, she needs support to fully implement her practice.  She is requesting a loan to cover the costs related to the functioning of her rehabilitation facility. 
She is certain that she will succeed due to her experience and ability. As a single mother, she does her best to provide for her ten-year old daughter.

loans.use: To cover the expenses to set up a speech therapy center

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 30 years old, married and a mother of two children.  Her husband owns a small mobile shop where he sells mobile phones and accessories. He also provides maintenance services for his customers. He has eight years of experience in this business. Establishing his business was a big risk for him  and he began it as a young man by saving some money and buying a few mobile phones.
 
Part of his profit is spent on his family and the rest on his business. He has gained good experience and become well known in the surrounding area. He has developed a good reputation in his community.

Nazia is requesting a loan for her husband to buy more mobile devices. He wants to develop his business and meet his customer's requirements. This loan will increase his income and improve the financial conditions for his family. This shows how Kiva BRAC Pakistan helps and supports the economic development of its clients.

loans.use: to help her husband buy mobile phones and accessories for his mobile shop

loans.name: Jali

texts.en:
Jali is 24 years old. She is an active and optimistic woman. She is from Maynaguri. She is a housewife who lives with her husband and their only daughter in Patkati, a small village in Jalpaiguri district. Both Jali and her husband attended school till grade 9, and after that they had to give up education as their families could not afford it. Their very young daughter is in grade 1.

To look after his family and bear the household expenses, Jali’s husband is running a stationary shop, Jali also helps her husband and looks after the shop in his absence. But the store does not provide them with much profit, as they are unable to stock variety for lack of capital. So it is difficult for them to make both ends meet.

Thus Jali is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner)  to buy varieties of stationary products to grow their business as well to satisfy the demand of their customers. This loan will help her in running her business smoothly.

She dreams to admit her only daughter in a renowned school so that she comes out being a professional with profit from her business. She conveys her thanks to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her husband's stationery shop.

loans.name: Hachem

texts.en:
Hachem is a 25-year-old single man. Nine years ago, he found himself responsible for the living expenses of two other members of his family. That’s why he started working in cultivation, fishing, and poultry businesses to cover his family’s living expenses and needs.
 
Hachem succeeded with his hard work and ambition to increase his income and improve his work. He benefited from his previous Al Majmoua loan by buying a small truck to facilitate his work. This is his second loan cycle and he proved to be a borrower in good standing. 

Today, Hachem is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy a new Irrigation network, which will increase his agricultural crop and thus increase his income.

Hachem hopes to improve his agricultural production and expand his poultry farm, which will help him save some profit for his upcoming future.

loans.use: To buy a new Irrigation network

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mop-tying machine.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 23-year-old bachelor’s degree student majoring in Economics, and he is in his second year. He lives with his family consisting of six members in Mafraq-Jordan. Mohammad wants to get his bachelor’s degree to start working in his field and to start depending on himself. But he unfortunately doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he is applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay his next semester fees.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 21-year-old university student majoring in Computer Information Systems, and he is in his second year. Ahmad is seeking to move out of the country after he gets his Bachelor's to find a good job in his field from which he can earn good income. To reach his dream, he needs your help to pay for his upcoming semester fees because he doesn't have enough money to do so in view of the financial crisis his family has been facing.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural products to help with coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Aalema

texts.en:
Aalema, 27, is from Dhupguri. She a young and energetic entrepreneur who lives in a small village West Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district. Her family comprises of her husband, Bakul, and three daughters. Two of them are students and one is too young for school.

Aalema's husband is involved in agribusiness and grows vegetables that he sells in the market. His income is too scant to bear all the costs of the family. So for an additional income, Aalema runs a milk-selling business. She started the business few years back when her husband's agribusiness did not go well. Now she is the main source of income for the family. She has a cow and she sells milk to her neighbors. The business brings sufficient profits to cover the family's living expenses. As their children are growing up and their educational expenses are increasing subsequently, she needs to earn more each month, and so she seeks to grow her milk business by buying another cow.

Aalema seeks a loan to buy a cow.

The loan will help this hardworking woman with the impetus to carry forward her plan and achieve her simple goals. She wants to provide higher education to her daughters and upgrade their present house to a concrete-made house with the profit from her business..

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for further growth of her milk business.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
"Gender is not the hindrance for not doing one thing that is not suitable for you,” is Bernardo’s guiding principle. Bernardo is 45 years of age, married, and has four children. 

Through the selling of blankets, pillows, floor mats, and kitchen utensils, he is able to give a better standard of living to his family. Bernardo walks around villages to sell his products. Due to his customers requests, and wanting them to become his regular customers, Bernardo wishes he could immediately meet their requests. 

With this in mind, Bernardo is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stocks of kitchen utensils and home appliances to sell. Bernardo loves his business. He would be thankful if he could avail himself of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of kitchen utensils and home appliances to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs to start a pig farm and manure for his coffee crops. He is a 61 year old single man, but he needs help because he doesn't have family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a good amount of goats in order to raise and sell them.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya, 45 years old, is married and lives with her family in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her four children. Suriya's husband runs a sweet shop in the local community. He is very hardworking and has four years of experience in this business. He makes and sells different varieties of local sweets. Sales increase during Eid and other festive occasions such as engagements, weddings, births of a child, passing exams, etc. as it is the tradition to have sweets on such occasions. 

Suriya's husband is the sole income earner in the family. He believes that he can earn more by enhancing his business by making more varieties of sweets and beautifying his shop. Suriya has, therefore, requested a loan to help her husband in his business. It will enable him to enhance his business and increase his earnings. Their dream is to provide a better life for their children and to educate them.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's sweet sales business.

loans.name: Radharani Mahila Samuha Group

texts.en:
Radharani Self-Help Group is formed with four diligent women, Urmila, Rinku, Bebi and Rekha, who live in Rohini village, Deoghar district, Jharkhand. All of them are working very hard to improve their livelihoods. Among them, Urmila is the featured borrower of the group.
  
Urmila lives with her family of seven including her husband and five children. They make a living by running a grocery store that Urmila and her husband run. Five years back, only her husband was running this shop, but then he became ill so Urmila took care of the business. The income is stretched very diligently to cover their needs and also savings. But with growing costs, and her children set to go to college in the next few years, Urmila wants to start saving more. She would also like to insure her family, safeguarding against losses from illnesses and other emergencies.

To garner more business, she plans on adding more items that can bring in good sales. So she seeks a loan to invest in new purchases. 

The other members are also seeking a loan to improve their livelihoods. Your loan will help them to increase their income.

loans.use: to buy items to her grocery store.

loans.name: Padaivittaman Shg-Kathiramangalam Group

texts.en:
Maheswari leads a group called Padaivittaman comprised of 14 other women residing in the Kathiramangalam village of Tamil Nadu. They are all married, and to support their family income and meet their monthly expenditures, they have to work. They are hardworking daily wage laborers, working in agricultural land and some of them have their own livelihood. For cooking, they mostly use the traditional chulhas, makeshift stoves that use firewood and emit a lot of smoke. The smoke not only causes health problems among the family members, but also pollutes their surroundings.

This 15-member group is seeking a loan to purchase 15 Greenway cooking stoves. The benefits of the Greenway stoves are fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of harmful carbon components, fast and convenient cooking, and high durability, being maintenance free, and being smokeless. This loan product will help them in preventing diseases, saving on firewood expenses, and promoting a clean environment.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en:
Musrat is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been running a milk sales business with her husband for many years. They have two milk buffalo and they sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that Musrat makes from the milk. She looks after the buffalo and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis.

Musrat is a mother of four children. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she has applied for a loan of PKR 55,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Musrat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and that it will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Mahalakshmi Shg-Thenkatchiperumalnatham Group

texts.en:
Jaya leads Mahalakshmi group, which includes 15 other women residing in the Thenkatchi Perumal Natham village in Ariyalur district of Tamil Nadu. They are all hardworking married women, and to support their family income and meet their monthly expenditure, they have to work. They are engaged in diverse occupations and either work as daily wage agricultural laborers, or as employees in small private firms, or they run their own small rural businesses. However, with their meager incomes, they still have some way to go in terms of improving their living conditions. 

Jaya is the featured borrower. For cooking, she, like the others, mostly uses the traditional chulha, a makeshift stove that uses firewood, which emits a lot of smoke. The smoke not only causes health problems among the family members, but also pollutes their surroundings.
            
She, like the other members, is seeking a loan to purchase a Greenway cooking stove. The benefits of the Greenway stoves are fuel savings, using all solid fuels, minimized emissions of harmful carbon components, fast and convenient cooking, and high durability, being maintenance free, and being smokeless. This loan product will help them in preventing diseases, saving on firewood expenses, and promoting a clean environment.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of cooking stoves and biomass pellets

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Mujeres emprendedoras no hacen falta en el país de la eterna primavera que es Guatemala donde la mujer forma parte importante en los campos laborales, tal es el caso de Pascuala de 38 años de edad que tiene 3 hijo los cuales son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que ella desempeña con tanto orgullo es la producción de banano en los campos fértiles de su comunidad dicho trabajo lo ha venido realizando desde hace 25 años y genera buena ganancia para la economía de su familia ya que es la herencia que su padre le pudo dejar para que ella tenga una calidad de vida mejor en el futuro.

El uso respectivo que Pascuala le dará al préstamo que ella solicita es para el mantenimiento de banano  para que produzcan sus frutos y sean llevados en los mercados de la comunidad para su respectiva venta.

Los sueños de ella es la plantación de más banano en las tierras fértiles con que ella cuenta y de esa manera ella quiere apoyar al medio ambiente y así mismo sacar un provecho económico para su familia para que lleguen a profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
There is no lack of enterprising women in the country of eternal springtime, Guatemala.  Women make up an important part of the labor force.  This is the case with Pascuala, age 38,  She has three children, and they attend the community school.

The business activity that she proudly engages in is banana production in the fertile fields of her community.  She has been doing this work for 25 years, and it generates good income for her family.  The business is the legacy that her father was able to leave her so that she would have a better quality of life in the future.

Pascuala will use the loan that she is requesting for maintenance of the bananas.  She will do this so that they produce their fruit and are taken to the community markets to sell.

Her dream is to plant more bananas on the fertile fields that she has.  This way she wants to support the environment and also get a financial benefit so that her family can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her banana crop.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 61 años de edad, está soltera, vive sola en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la venta de mercadería como blusas, pantalones, camisetas, camisas y ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños. Este negocio lo tiene hace 10 años y vende de manera ambulante y por pedidos. La ropa que vende es nueva y de segunda. El  préstamo que solicita actualmente es el tercer ciclo y es por 21,000 lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de ropa como blusas, camisetas, pantalones y ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños con el fin de tener mayor inventario para vender. Su meta es que el negocio crezca cada día para tener un buen patrimonio y lograr tener un local propio.
texts.en: Maria, 61, is single and lives alone in the Municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara.  She has always made a living selling merchandise such as blouses, pants, T-shirts, shirts, and underwear for ladies, men and children.  She has had this business for ten years and sells on foot and by request.  The clothing she sells is new and used.  The loan she is requesting now is the third cycle and is 21,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of clothing such as blouses, T-shirts, pants, and underwear for ladies, men and children with the aim of having a greater inventory to sell.  Her goal is that her business grow every day in order to have a good patrimony and be able to have her own shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as blouses, T-shirts, pants, and underwear for ladies, men, and children to sell.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es: Mirian,  tiene 44 años de edad, está casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una comunidad que pertenece al municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Hace 12 años estableció su propio negocio de una pulpería que funciona en su  casa. Ofrece productos alimenticios como arroz, maíz, frijoles, harina, churros, refrescos, condimentos, productos enlatados, verduras  etc.  Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras, el cual invertirá en la compra de productos de la canasta básica como granos básicos, refrescos, harina, manteca, huevos, lácteos, jugos, verduras etc. Para surtir y mejorar las ventas. Su meta es sacar adelante el negocio y darles un mejor estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Mirian is 44 years old. She is married, has two children, and lives with her family in a community which belongs to the municipality of Esparta, Atlántida. Twelve years ago she established her own grocery store business in her house. She offers food items such as rice, corn, beans, flour, churros, soft drinks, spices, canned goods, vegetables, etc. She has requested a loan of 10,000 lempiras which she will invest buying staple products such as basic grains, soft drinks, flour, lard, eggs, dairy products, vegetables, etc., in order to stock up her store and improve sales. Her goal is to move her business ahead and give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy staple products such as basic grains, soft drinks, flour, lard, dairy products, juices, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Bayanmongol

texts.en: Mr. Bayanmongol, who is 33 years old, lives with his sister, brother and brother in law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital Mongolia. For the last four years, he has earned most of his income by running a jewelry business. He used a previous loan to buy raw materials and increase his working capital. Now he is requesting a new loan, for 4,000,000 MNT, to buy silver in bulk to create silver bowls for his client, a retailer. This order is very important for his business, because if he can provide high-quality bowls to this company, it will sign a long-term contract with him. This is a huge opportunity for him and his business.

loans.use: to buy silver in large amounts to make silver bowls

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhjargal, 44 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an interior designer for four years. Her husband is a serviceman and works at the police department. 

Their children study at the university. As the academic year begins, she has faced difficulties of paying two children's tuition fee at the same time. So she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to pay for her daughter's tuition fees. She wants her children to be well educated.

In the borrower profile picture, she is sitting with her husband and daughter.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina’s greatest dream is for her two children to finish their studies and became professionals someday. Josefina patiently cares for her children while her husband operates their tricycle for passengers' transportation. Her husband's income from their motorcycle serves as their children's daily allowances for going to school. 

Josefina wish to have another source of income, so that even in a simple way, she could help her husband. In the meantime, Josefina wants to beautify her husband's tricycle so that more passengers will be encouraged to ride, which will earn them more income as well. 

In the end, Josefina is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy tires and fuel for the maintenance of her husband's motorcycle. She hopes to save some of her husband's earnings for the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy tires and fuel for the maintenance of her husband's motorcycle.

loans.name: Bayarbat

texts.en:
Bayarbat, 28 years old, lives with his wife and three years old son in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been working as a repairman at an automobile repair workshop since 2013. 

His wife renders taxi services to local people. Their son stays at kindergarten during the day time. His family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on rental land. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy a plot of land. With his own land, he will no longer pay rental fees for land, and his family will use the land for other purposes such as growing vegetables and raising livestock.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa, 42, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Wilfredo, a farmer, she is a mother of three children, one is in high school and the other two are not yet studying. She works hard, together with her husband, to meet the family's daily basic needs and for the education of her child. 

Felipa operates a pineapple growing farm. She grows pineapple in their farm located in Cavite, it is in the highlands where it is suited to grow pineapple. She sells her product to market and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 10,000 in sales a month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. She is positive that her hard work will yield more sales and income for her.  

Felipa dreams to give her family a better life and provide her children the best education possible. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Berdimurod

texts.ru: Бердимурод добрый мужчина. Он живет вместе с семьей в отдаленном регионе. Бердимурод женат и на воспитании  имеет 3 детей. Ее жена Нигора очень добрая женщина. Бердимурод более 25 лет занимается агро -бизнесом. Она в основном выращивает пшеницу. Дополнительно он занимается скотоводством. Его жена Нигора помогает ей введению бизнеса. Бердимурод каждый год два раза делает посев пшеницы. Он должен сделать второй посев, но не имеет денег, чтобы купить минеральные удобрение и семена пшеницы. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Berdimurod is a good man. He lives with his family in a remote area of Tajikistan. He is married to a kind woman, called Nigora, and he is raising three children.  Berdimurod has more than 25 years of experience in the field of agriculture and he mostly grows wheat.  In addition, he is involved in animal husbandry.  His wife helps him to run the business.  Berdimurod sows wheat twice a year.  He is now ready for the second planting season but he doesn't have enough money to buy mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds.  He is taking a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Stella

texts.es:
María tiene una cafetería negocio que aprendió de una cuñada y el cual lleva más de 20 años operando entre los diferente barrios que ha vivido, tiene 62 años, una mujer muy correcta, honesta siempre busca alternativas y la manera de generar recursos, empezó con pequeñas  chazas vendiendo en calles sus fritos y hoy se siente orgullosa de tener su propio negocio comprado con su propio esfuerzo y sudor. 

Ella destaca que la ser independiente no él tiene que rendir cuentas a nadie y con sus fritos y cafés ha levantado a su hijo de 20 años sola, pues se separó de su esposo y quedo con él y no el quedo grande pues sus esfuerzo y ganas de progreso fueron suficientes. 

Solicita un crédito para comprar un celular y un plan de datos para vender minutos a todo operador colombiano y también surtido para realizar sus fritos como empanas, buñuelos, pasteles, arepas con carne, panzerotis, etc. 

Si es posible ayúdenle a la cliente es una mujer ya de edad que solo depende de su negocio para vivir, ayudarle es darle la oportunidad de que siga emprendiendo y a pesar de su edad siga progresando y luchando por su hijo y ella.
texts.en:
Maria has a cafeteria business that she learned from an in-law and she has been operating for more than 20 years in the different neighborhoods where she has lived.  She is 62 years old and she is a very proper and honest woman who always looks for alternatives and the way to generate income.  She began with small rounds selling her fried goods in the streets and now she is proud to have her own business purchased through her own effort and sweat.
She emphasizes that, being independent, she doesn't answer to anyone and, with her fried goods and coffees, she raised her twenty-year-old son alone since she separated from her husband. She stayed with him and he wasn't big, but her efforts and desire to progress were enough.
She is asking for the loan to purchase a cell phone and a data plan in order to sell minutes to all Colombian operators and also supplies to make her fried goods such as turnovers, buns, cakes, tortillas with meat, empanadas, etc.
If it is possible, help this client who is already an older woman who depends on her business to live.  To help her is to give her the opportunity to continue going and, despite her age, continue to progress and struggle for her son and herself.

loans.use: to buy a cell phone and a data plan in order to begin selling cellular minutes to complement her cafeteria service.  She is a female head of household.

loans.name: Samai

texts.en: A mother of three children, Samai is 45 years old and living in Kampong Thom province. To support her family, she earns an income via selling grocery items and raising pigs. Moreover, her husband can earn more income to support the family via teaching at primary school. This is the third cycle for Samai with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She will use this loan portion to pay tuition fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor degree majoring in accounting. She hopes that her daughter can get a new job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Oyzodakhon

texts.ru: Ойзодахон трудолюбивая девушка. Она родилась в 1987 году. Ойзодахон не замужем и живет с родителями на Северной части страны. Она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур более 6 лет. Ойзодахон в основном выращивает зерновые культуры. Она продает свой урожай зимой, так как цены поднимаются в этот период. Она нуждается в амбаре, чтобы хранить урожай до продажи. С такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, чтобы построить амбар. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Oyzodakhon, born in 1987, is a hardworking young woman.  She is single and lives with her parents in northern Tajikistan.  She has been working in agriculture for the past six years, mostly growing cereals.  She sells her crops at the market during the winter, because prices are higher then.  She needs to build a shed to store her grains until it is time to sells them.  For this reason, she is taking a loan of 5,000 somoni.  This loan will allow her to buy the building materials needed to build a shed.  Oyzodakhon is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to build a shed.

loans.name: Altankhuyag

texts.en: Mr. Altankhuyag, 52 years old, lives with his wife and youngest daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been selling clothes to local people since 2005. Due to his disability, his wife travels to China and brings clothes to Mongolia. His youngest daughter studies at university. His other three daughters all moved out after getting married. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and fiberglass to renovate his house. As a result, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and then less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and fiberglass to renovate his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue the master’s degree in Banking and Finance.

loans.name: Sorphorn's Group

texts.en: A farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province, Sorphorn is 43 years old and a mother of three children. She struggles for a living via rice cropping and selling grocery items to earn more income. She can earn income about 36,100 KHR per day to support her family's living conditions. This is first loan for Sorphorn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will take her loan portion to buy a solar energy system. She hopes that her house will have electricity to use and she can get a good yield from her farm to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ligia

texts.en: Ligia lives in Oecusse with her husband and two children. She has been involved in business since 2008, when she opened a store with $100 of her own working capital. Today, she runs a kiosk and is requesting a loan for $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to sell including water, milk, instant noodles, biscuits, lighters, perfume and other items, such as soft and hard drinks. Her goal for the future is to improve her business and increase her income by opening a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: Navy is 29 years old and a mother of one kid who lives in Kampong Thom province. She overcomes her family’s hardship via teaching at school. Besides this job, her husband works as a motor taxi driver to earn extra income which has returned her about 10 USD per day. For Navy, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to pay school fees to study hair design. She hopes that she can earn more income to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay school fees to study hair design.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Yet

texts.en: A resident of Kampong Thom province, Yet is 51 years old and the mother of five children. To support her family, she weaves baskets to sell as her main source of income and grows rice to supplement those earnings. This not first loan for Yet from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), but she has fully repaid a past loan wisely to improve her living conditions at a gradually pace. Yet will spend her entire loan to pay school fees for her daughter, who wants to pursue a master’s degree in English. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's school fees.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Kampong Svay District

loans.name: Grupo Chuamango Group

texts.es:
Mujeres emprendedoras no hacen falta en el país de la eterna primavera que es Guatemala donde la mujer forma parte importante en los campos laborales, tal es el caso de Lucia de 32 años de edad soltera que tiene 3 hijo los cuales son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad, (Lucia es la que se encuentra en la primera de izquierda a la derecha  en la fotografía)
La  actividad que ella desempeña con tanto orgullo es la producción de banano en los campos fértiles de su comunidad dicho trabajo lo ha venido realizando desde hace 25 años y genera buena ganancia para la economía de su familia ya que es la herencia que su padre le pudo dejar para que ella tenga una calidad de vida mejor en el futuro.
El uso respectivo que Lucia le dará al préstamo que ella solicita es para el mantenimiento de banano  para que produzcan sus frutos y sean llevados en los mercados de la comunidad para su respectiva venta.
Un grupo de personas se decidieron unirse con Lucia  para poder emprender y aprovecho al máximo la tierra de su comunidad ya que está llena de vida para producir cualquier producto agrícola.
Los sueños de ella es la plantación de más banano en las tierras fértiles con que ella cuenta y de esa manera ella quiere apoyar al medio ambiente y así mismo sacar un provecho económico para su familia para que lleguen a profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
There is no shortage of enterprising women in Guatemala, the country of eternal spring, where women take an important part in field work.  That is the case for Lucia, 32 years old and single, with three children who are in school in her community.  (Lucia is the  woman who is first on the left in the photograph.)

The field of work she's proud to be involved in is growing bananas on the fertile fields of her community.  She has been doing this work for more than 25 years and earns a good return for her family's finances. This is the heritage her father was able to provide her so that she could have a better quality of life in the future.

Lucia will use the loan she is seeking to maintain the banana fields so they will produce their fruit to be carried to the community's markets for sale.  A group of people decided to join with Lucia to be able to make new efforts and take advantage of  the rich land in their community, full of life for producing any agricultural product.

Lucia's dream is to plant more bananas in the fertile lands she can count on and in this way support the environment and at the same time obtain  financial health for her family so that her children can one day become professionals.

loans.use: to maintain a banana plantation

loans.name: Mankhushi

texts.en:
Mankhushi is a hardworking woman. She is only 22 years old, and a housewife. She is the mother of one son. Her husband is Palash, aged 27 years, a painter by profession. They live in the small village of Anandanagar in Maynaguri, district Jalpaiguri, in their own small house.

Mankhushi’s husband is a painter by profession; he usually paints almirahs (cabinets), fridges, doors, windows, etc. in his village. Mankhushi manages the household work and assists her husband in his work. 

The business of her husband is running well, but now they want to grow their business. Their customers are increasing day by day. Now they want to buy a spray-painting machine, to attract more customers, but they lack capital.

Mankhushi heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and applied for a loan of 11,000 INR.

Now, Mankhushi and her husband hope to earn more profit from their business. She and her husband give hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy a spray-painting machine for their painting business.

loans.name: Benny

texts.en: Benny is aged 40, married and blessed with five children. He has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost 24 years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. His net income from this business is usually spent on the school allowances of his children. Due to insufficient funds he would like to avail himself of a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to purchase bread, beverages, canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell. He is hoping that his business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase bread, beverages, canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
This is Mercedes, 53, resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to her three children and married to Virgilio, a driver. She, together with her husband, manages their household. She works hard to augment their income to meet their daily household expenses and school needs of her children.

Mercedes makes and sells native delicacies like rice cakes. These are commonly eaten for snacks and also for desserts. She sells them per order and on demand on special occasions and holidays. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue with her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy raw ingredients like sticky rice, flour, sugar, and coconut milk. She is positive of a good turnout for her business. 
 
Mercedes aims to grow her business and dreams to own a vehicle to easily transport her rice cakes. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sticky rice, flour, sugar and coconut milk to make native delicacies.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Originally from Pursat province, Mom is 48 years old. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is in school and one of whom is in university. To earn a living, she grows rice on five hectares of farmland while her husband works as a driver. This is Mom's fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans completely and her living conditions are getting better than before. Now, she wants to focus on her son's education. That is why she has applied for a new loan to pay tuition fees for son, who wants to pursue a master’s degree in Economics. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son, who wants to pursue a master’s degree in Economics.

loans.name: Dalia Elvira

texts.es:
Dolía es muy responsable y trabajadora, gracias a la venta de sus productos por catálogo y ropa que alterna con venta de comidas ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante, lleva el sustento, es una mujer que vive con sus tres hijos de 20, 16, y 2 años de edad se separó de su pareja y desde ese entonces es madre cabeza de familia. 

Dolía ha tenido que pasar muchas dificultades es muy difícil hacerse cargo de tres hijos, de un arrendamiento, de una cuenta de servicios, de la alimentación estudio etc. pero a pesar de todo sigue en pie y con una sonrisa para sus hijos a los cuales por la excelente labor de Dolía nunca les ha faltado nada.

Solicita un crédito para mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando pues sus responsabilidades monetarias no le dejan mucho capital para trabajar, por lo que para ella será transcendental esta ayuda que le está brindando interactuar, con el capital comprara productos de catálogo, perfumes y cosméticos principalmente, ropa para hombre y dama como pantalones, blusas, camisas y camisetas, y materia prima para elaborar sus alimentos, carnes, frutas, verduras, abarrotes y granos. 
Su sueño es tener un punto de venta fijo al cual puedan llegar sus clientes, pues actualmente trabaja en su casa y sale a vender sus productos, la verdad es difícil la labor que Dolía realiza pero gracias a esto puede tener una vida digna para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolía is very responsible and hardworking.  Thanks to the sales of her catalog products and clothing, which she alternates with selling food, she has been able to raise and provide for her family. She lives with her three children, ages 20, 16, and 2. 

She is separated from her husband, and since that time, she has been both mother and head of the family. Dolía has had to go through many difficulties, as it is hard to take charge of three children, the rent, the utilities, meals, and such.  But in spite of it all she continues on, with a smile for her children, who thanks to her excellent work have never lacked anything. 

She is requesting a loan in order to improve her business and continue working. As her financial responsibilities don’t leave her much working capital,  the help that Interactuar is giving her will be perfect.   She will purchase catalog products with the capital, especially perfumes and cosmetics, and also men’s and women’s clothing such as  pants, blouses, shirts and t-shirts.  She will also purchase supplies for making her food such as meat, fruit, vegetables, groceries, and grains.  

Her dream is to have a permanent store for her customers, as she works in her house and goes out to sell her products.  The work that Dolía does is truly difficult, but thanks to this she can have a decent life for herself and for her children.

loans.use: to purchase catalog products such as perfume, cosmetics, and clothing, and to purchase meat, fruit, vegetables, and grains in order to prepare her food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay workers to help with her coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie. She is 38 years old and currently resides with her husband, Jerry, in Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Rosemarie would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 14,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Rosemarie hopes to grow and expand her business. She dreams for her children to finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hen

texts.en: Hen, 44, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kratie province. She has four children, one of whom remains in school. To tackle her family’s hardship, she grows rice as a single source of income. This generates her a decent income. This is the first loan for Hen with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will take this loan to buy solar panels. She hopes that solar panels will help her to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy solar panels.

loans.name: Nayantara

texts.en:
Nayantara is a cheerful and hardworking woman of age 31. She is married and has two children (one son and one daughter). She and her husband raise their children together. They live in a small village, Gadang, in Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri district. Her children go to school.

Nayantara’s husband is a farmer by profession. He grows different crops and sells them to the market. His earnings are hardly sufficient to cover all the household and educational expenses of their children. So, to assist her husband financially, Nayantara is involved in a business of sewing and needlework. She learnt it from her mother. Currently, this knowledge helps her to have a normal income for food and other household expenses. She sews women's clothing. She earns a good income for the family. Her neighbors are her main customers. They appreciate her work; thus, she has goodwill in her neighborhood.  

Currently, she would like to purchase a more modern sewing machine, which will work better and stitch higher-quality clothing. So, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She hopes for a better result, and she also dreams to have her own tailoring shop in the future in the market, where she can employ more women like her.

Nayantara is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her existing tailoring business.

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru: Точинисо ответственная трудолюбивая женщина из района Фархор, проживающая там  вместе с мужем и двумя маленькими сыновьями. Ей 34 года. У нее среднее школьное образование. Точинисо при поддержке брата и мужа 10 лет назад начала свой торговый бизнес. Она на рынке района имеет торговую точку, где предлагает покупателям детскую подростковую одежду и обувь. Точинисо хорошая продавщица, она любит свое дело и всегда думает о его расширении. На сумму запрашиваемого кредита Точинисо хотела бы привести сезонный товар для своих покупателей. Благодаря кредиту она увеличит ассортимент сезонного товара и объем ее продаж увеличатся, что приведет к успеху ее бизнеса. Поэтому этот кредит ей очень важен.
texts.en: Tojiniso is a responsible and hardworking woman .  She comes from the Farkhor district of Tajikistan, where she lives with her husband and her two young sons.  She is 34 years old and has a secondary education.  With her brother's and husband's support, she was able to start her own business ten years ago.  She owns a retail outlet at the market and she sells children's and teenagers' clothing and shoes.  Tojiniso is a very good salesperson.  She loves her job and is always thinking about ways to expand her business.  She would like to use the money from her loan to bring seasonal merchandise for resale to her customers.  This loan will allow her to increase her inventory of seasonal merchandise as well as her sales' volume, which will in turn be beneficial for her business.  This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy seasonal children's and teenagers' clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: María de 27 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 3 años de edad y su hermano de 19 años de edad. Ella es una mujer sencilla pero trabajadora que todos los días se esfuerza por ganarse la vida con su pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas y verduras como: tomates, cebollas, papas, chile verde, güisquil, zanahoria, etc. Y es gracias a estos negocios que está sacando adelante a su pequeño hijo, su hermano apoya con los gastos del hogar gracias a su trabajo como pescador en el cual debe trabajar 24 horas seguidas en una lancha en alta mar. María desea mejorar sus ingresos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, cal, gas propano, tomates, cebollas, güisquiles, papas, etc.
texts.en: María is a 27 year old single mother who lives in her own house with her three year old son and her 19 year old brother. She is a simple woman who works hard every day. She is trying to get ahead in life with her small business of selling tortillas and vegetables like tomatoes, onions, potatoes, green chilies, chayote, carrots, etc. And thanks to her businesses she is raising her small boy. Her brother helps with the household expenses thanks to his work as a fisherman. He works 24 hours straight on a boat in the open ocean. María  wants to improve her income so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn, lime, propane, tomatoes, onions, chayote, potatoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, propane, tomatoes, onions, chayote, potatoes, etc

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en: Modesta is requesting a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including toothbrushes, noodles, soap, candies, glue, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. She has been doing business since 2013, starting with her own working capital of $100. Now she is applying for a loan of $600. She is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to open a big store in the future, and with the loan that is offered by Tuba Rai Metin, she can get good management for her business. She also wants to improve her business for her life. So she is happy with the loan that is offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy toothbrushes, noodles, soap, candies, glue, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is 22 years old. She is from Dhupguri, which is in a remote region in Jalpaiguri district. She is married to Ismail, aged 27 years. Nilima and her husband studied until grade ten. Together they are raising their one daughter, who reads in preschool, with love and care.

Nilima's husband is a farmer. Nilima is also a very hardworking woman who pursues the domestic duties in her home and also helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Along with her partner, she grows potatoes, beans, bottle gourds, chilies, etc. They developed this business many years ago, and she learned along with him. 

Like other cultivators, her plans for the future are to expand her property and grow other vegetables, which will allow her to grow with her business and with her family. She wants to cultivate paddy, which is an all-season crop, having much demand in West Bengal.

So, she is applying for a financial help from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc. to start cultivation as early as possible. Nilima hopes she will get an excellent result from this. She wants to utilize her income to support her daughter in her studies, since that is the best inheritance that she can offer to her.

Nilima also aspires to purchase more agricultural land in the future with the profit. She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, etc. to grow paddy.

loans.name: Mamani

texts.en:
Mamani is a 34-year-old woman from the small village of Maynaguri at Jalpaiguri district. She is married and is blessed with three children (one son and two daughters). All are receiving education. 
 
Mamani is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer. Her husband decided to farm, as they have their own land and her husband has experience in this field. He grows different vegetables in different seasons. Mamani also assists her husband in the field after managing her household activities. 

Now they have decided to cultivate rice paddy on their land. Being a staple food of the people, there is a great demand for rice in West Bengal. So, in this monsoon, which is the suitable time to cultivate this crop, they want to start cultivation of rice/paddy. They need financial help.

Mamani has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase seeds, pesticides, and insecticides for farming rice paddy. After the harvest, they will sell the product in the wholesale market.

She hopes she will develop her business and with the profit, she can improve her family's condition and can give further education in the future. She wants to purchase more land with the profit from the business. 

Mamani is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva for the funding.

loans.use: to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en: Originally from Kratie province, Chhom is 30 years old and a mother of three children. Now, she needs to support three schoolchildren. She struggles for a living via raising pigs and sells vegetables to supplement her income. She earns about 20,000 KHR per day. For Chhom, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely and it has improved her lifestyle gradually. She will use her loan portion to buy solar panels. Chhom hopes that she can upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy solar panels.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru: Илхомчон целеустремленный человек. Он с детства стремился поступить в университет и получить высшее образование. В этом году он окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Он студент первого курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Политики и Бизнеса. Сбылась его детская мечта. Он учится в факультете Международное отношение. Илхомчон стремится учиться хорошо и окончить университет также успешно как школу. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ilhomjon is a highly focused young man.  Since his childhood, he has always dreamed of attending a university one day and to get a higher education. This year he graduated from secondary school and enrolled at the Tajik State University of Business and Politics, where he is now a first-year student. His childhood dream has come true.  Ilhomjon takes courses from the School of International Affairs.  He wants to excel in his studies and to graduate with outstanding grades, like he did in secondary school.  He is taking a loan of 800 USD to pay his university tuition.  He is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Yaquelin Maricela

texts.es: Yaquelin de 21 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia en conjunto con su esposo, por lo que todos los días sale a vender diversidad de pan francés y pan dulce en su comunidad, la venta la realiza por las mañanas y por las tardes desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que cada vez son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos. Yaquelin ha observado que su venta es buena por lo que desea adquirir más productos para ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, además desea elaborar tamales de gallina para vender aprovechando la clientela con la que cuenta. Ella no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir en su venta por lo que se ha acercado a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito para invertir en: pan dulce, pan francés, maíz, gallinas, aceite, tomates, etc.
texts.en:
Yaquelin, age 21, lives in her own home with her life companion and their two children, ages 5 and 3. She is an enterprising woman who along with her husband, is working hard in order to raise her family.

To this end, she goes out every day to sell a variety of French bread and sweet bread in her community.  She has been selling in the mornings and in the afternoons for a long time, thus there are more and more customers requesting her products. 

Yaquelin has observed that her sales are good, so she wants to add more products in order to offer more variety to her customers.  Additionally, she wants to make and sell chicken tamales, taking advantage of her customer base. She does not have the money that is necessary in order to invest in her sales, so she is  requesting a loan from FUSAI.  With it, she will invest in sweet bread, French bread, corn, chickens, oil, tomatoes, and similar items.

loans.use: to invest in sweet bread, French bread, corn, chickens, oil, tomatoes, and similar items.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina de 62 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 28 años de edad y sus 3 nietos de 11, 14 y 16 años de edad. Ella es una mujer humilde que se esfuerza cada día por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y es por ello que se gana la vida como vendedora de mariscos tales como: conchas, camarones, langostas, pescado, etc. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante por las calles de las colonias vecinas donde ya es muy reconocida por vender buenos productos por lo que sus clientes siempre la esperan para adquirirlos, ademas Adelina se dedica a cuidar de sus nietos ya que los padres de ellos tuvieron que emigrar al extranjero buscando darles mejores condiciones de vida. Adelina sabe que tiene una buena cartera de clientes, por lo que desea contar con mas productos para ofrecer y al no contar con el financiamiento necesario solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: conchas, camarones, langostas, pescado, etc.
texts.en: Adelina is 62 years old and lives in her own house with her 28 year old son and her three grandchildren aged 11, 14 and 16 years old. She is a simple woman who each day tries to improve her living conditions.She makes her living selling seafood like mussels, shrimp, lobster, fish etc. She sells walking through the streets of the neighboring areas. She is well recognized as selling good products so customers always wait for her to buy goods. Also Adelina works at caring for her grandchildren as their parents had to emigrate to other countries looking to improve their living conditions. Adelina knows that she has a good clientele so she wants to have more products to offer them. She doesn't have the finances needed so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in mussels, shrimp, lobsters, fish, etc.

loans.use: to buy mussels, shrimp, lobster, fish, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to support and maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pork, chicken and frozen foods to resell in the market.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy owns a variety store and operates a school canteen. Aside from the retail store, she also manages a motorcycle transportation business as an additional source of income. Lucy is married with three children. Her three children currently attend school. She and her husband would like to educate their children, so they are doing their best in order to earn greater income. To make her goals possible, she is seeking financial assistance in the amount of PHP 7,000. She will use this loan amount to buy ingredients, assorted biscuits and school supplies to re-stock her variety store. Lucy is hoping for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, assorted biscuits and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth de 57 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 nietos de 12 y 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que toda su vida se ha dedicado a ganarse la vida con diferentes tipos de venta, actualmente vende frutas de temporada y antojitos típicos, además vende conservas de frutas. Elizabeth no se deja vencer por las necesidades si no más bien, lucha como puede para ir saliendo adelante y es gracias a esa actitud que es reconocida en su cantón, por lo que siempre esperan que lleve sus productos para adquirirlos y cada día son más sus clientes, por ese motivo ella desea invertir más en sus productos para ofrecer más variedad y tener mejores ganancias. Al no contar con el financiamiento necesario Elizabeth ha solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: frutas de temporada, ingredientes para antojitos típicos y conservas de fruta.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 57 is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her two grandchildren, ages 12 and 14. She is an enterprising woman who has devoted herself to earning a living through sales all of her life. Currently, she sells seasonal fruit and traditional snacks, and she also sells preserved fruit.

Elizabeth does not let hardship defeat her, but fights to keep moving forward. Thanks to this attitude she is known in her canton, and people wait for her to bring her products so that they can buy them. Every day she has more customers, so she wants to invest more in her products in order to offer more variety and have better earnings.

As she doesn't have the necessary financing, Elizabeth has requested a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in seasonal fruit, ingredients for traditional snacks, and preserved fruit.

loans.use: to invest in seasonal fruit, ingredients for making traditional snacks, and preserved fruit.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that he used to buy additional household products for his rolling store business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for him to buy pails, brushes, plates, hangers, and other household products needed in his business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. His profits from the business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Rodolfo hopes for his business to continue flourishing and dreams for his children to complete their studies. He meets up weekly with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for toys and household products such as pails, basins, and dippers for his rolling store.

loans.name: Maa Jagulei Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Jagulei Self-Help Group is a group consisting of ten members who are all women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start grocery shops where they could provide the basic household consumables to their customers. One of them is Jharana, who was selected as their president. 

Jharana is a 39-year-old lady living with her husband. The lady standing with her hand raised is Jharana. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory situated near her village. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. Jharana likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers, for which reason she has requested a loan to purchase items such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains, and other household consumables. 

Jharana, along with her group members, has requested a loan amount of 150,000 INR. She will use her portion to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains, and other household consumables for her shop.

loans.name: Sao Ra's Group

texts.en:
