A mother of little kid, Ra is 24 years old and lives in Kampong Speu province. Her main sources of income are from her rice farming and from her handmade clay pots. She can earn about 35,000 KHR per day from the business that she has had for ages. 

This is the first loan for Ra with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She leads a group of six to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can update her family's living conditions and make them more healthy.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Speu province, Ra is 30 years old and a mother of two children, one of whom is in school and the other is too young. To earn a living, she grows rice as her main source income. During her spare time, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

This is the first loan for Ra with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that her family will be living in better health than before.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Ziba

texts.en:
Ziba is 20 years old and married. She owns and manages a small retail store within her community to generate income. She dreams of becoming successful and financially stable in the future. 

To attain her goal, she wants to further improve her business and make it more profitable to earn a higher income. Having insufficient capital, she would like to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to 13,000 PHP to buy more canned goods, noodles, breads, beverages, seasonings, candies, laundry soaps, and soft drinks to resell. 

She hopes that she will secure her loan request to be able to improve her retail store.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, breads, beverages, seasonings, candies, laundry soaps, and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Erika Xiomara

texts.es: Erika de 23 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que ha demostrado tener una gran tenacidad y emprendedurismo ya que ha sabido mantener su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, durante mucho tiempo en el gusto de su clientela, por lo que es muy reconocida por su trato agradable con las personas. Erika desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que actualmente este se encuentra deteriorado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Erika, age 23, lives in her own home with her life companion and her two-year-old son.  

She has shown herself to be a woman with great tenacity and entrepreneurship, as she has been able to maintain her fruit and vegetable sales business and please her customers for a long time; and she is well known for the friendly way that she treats people. 

Erika wants to replace the roof of her home, as it is currently deteriorated, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI.  She will invest it in the purchase of galvanized sheeting, wood, and nails, in order to replace the roof of her home.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood, and nails in order to replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Dina Elizabeth

texts.es: Dina de 27 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como cocinera de un restaurante de playa, además los fines de semana elabora pupusas en su vivienda, obteniendo un ingreso extra. Dina tiene temor que un talud de tierra cercano a su vivienda se desplome, por lo que desea construir un muro de contención y una cuneta para que el agua no se siga filtrando pero no cuenta con el financiamiento necesario, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y bloques de cemento para construir un muro de contención  y una cuneta en su vivienda.
texts.en: Dina, who is 27 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her own house along with her 10-year-old son. She is an entrepreneurial woman who works as a cook in a beach restaurant. In addition, she makes pupusas (a typical Salvadoran food) in her home on the weekends, obtaining extra income. Dina fears that a slope of land near her home could collapse, and so she wants to construct a containment wall and a ditch so that the water doesn't continue leaking, but she doesn't have the necessary financing. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and cement blocks to construct a containment wall and a ditch for her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and cement blocks to build a containment wall and a ditch for her house.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her youngest child and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her child’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marietta dreams of having another branch for her business and wants her child to finish his education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ipan

texts.en:
Ipan is a mobile phone shop owner. He lives in Bandung, the third-largest city in Indonesia, with a population of 2.394 million. He is single, and he lives with four of his family members, in the family home. Ipan joined Ruma two years ago, because he wanted to increase his income. He also wanted to improve his small shop that sells mobile phones and mobile phone accessories.

Now, Ipan is selling mobile phone airtime credits and the business continues to run well. Not only has his income increased, but he has also learned that mobile service is needed in his community. Ipan hopes to get a working capital loan from Ruma, in order to provide more airtime transactions on the weekends. Ipan is pictured in the photo, sitting in his small shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile phone airtime transactions on weekends

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 40 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que todos los días sale a ganarse el pan de cada día con su pequeño negocio de comedor y pupusería el cual se encuentra ubicado en las afueras de su cantón, en su negocio también vende bebidas aprovechando su clientela. Sonia desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente las láminas y madera se encuentran deteriorados, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Sonia, who is 40 years old, is a single mother. She lives in her own house along with her two children, ages 9 and 5. She is an entrepreneurial woman who goes out every day to earn their daily bread with her little dining area and pupuseria business, which is located in the outskirts of her canton. In her business, she also sells beverages, making the most of her clientele. Sonia wants to replace the roof of her house, since the metal sheeting and the wood are now deteriorated. For this reason, she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheeting, nails, and wood to replace the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting, nails, and wood to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Muhyiddin

texts.en:
Muhyiddin is a construction worker who lives in Kudus, Central Java. By history, Kudus was an important holy city in the sixteenth century in Indonesia. Muhyiddin is married, and he lives with his wife and his two children in the family home.

To increase his family's income, he runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. He joined Ruma about a month ago, because he wanted to try the mobile airtime business. He has also added some friends to his network, as he interacts well with Ruma staff members. As the business runs, Muhyiddin hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan in order to provide more mobile airtime transactions in his community on the weekends. Muhyiddin is pictured in the photo, sitting in front of his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile phone airtime transactions on weekends

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor, his wife, and their two children live in Kudus, Central Java. By history, Kudus was an important holy city in the sixteenth century in Indonesia. Noor runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. To contribute to the family's income, his wife works in a hair/beauty salon.

Noor decided to join Ruma about two months ago, because he was excited to start selling mobile airtime. He wants to increase his income and save the extra money for his children’s education. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan in order to provide more airtime transactions on the weekends. Noor is pictured in the photo, sitting in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile phone airtime transactions on the weekends

loans.name: Sheralyn

texts.en: Sheralyn is 29 years old and married. She and her husband have been working hand-in-hand in order to improve their living condition. Sheralyn has been running a general store for two years. She is thankful because her husband is supportive of the improvement of the business. She is determined to continually grow her business, and so she is seeking a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, ingredients, sugar, fish sauce and Nescafe. She believes that with this loan she could earn a greater income and invest in another kind of business someday.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, soft drinks, ingredients, sugar, fish sauce and Nescafe for resale

loans.name: Chev

texts.en:
Chev is a 43-year-old, married woman. She has one dependent child and one married child. She lives in a small village of Banteay Meanchy Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business. She grows rice and sells the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this career for twenty-one years, with average income of USD 2.50 a day.

Chev wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL, which comes with a much lower interest rate than other, general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia belongs to Lahore. She is a loving housewife. She is 30 years old and a mother of three. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, by profession. He provides transportation services in the local community. Up to now, her husband has been driving a rented rickshaw. The income he earned has been mostly consumed in paying out the rent for use of the rickshaw, and he was left with little income for his household expenses. He has decided, therefore, to buy his own rickshaw, to increase his income.

As they have low income, it's not possible for them to save. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan, which she will use to help her husband buy a rickshaw. They will repay the loan from the income he will receive by driving the rickshaw. Shazia is thankful to Kiva lenders, for their kind support. The dream of Shazia and her husband is to educate their children.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's use

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel, tiene 42 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene dos hijos, y reside en una aldea del municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Manuel se ha dedicado a la agricultura pero en vista de mejorar sus  ingresos logro establecer su propio negocio junto a su esposa. Lleva 5 años de vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como ser arroz, maíz, frijoles, azúcar, manteca, cal, sal, café, pan, refrescos, lácteos, churros, y otros.  Ha invertido tres prestamos a su negocio para mantenerlo activo, actualmente solicita otro por 15,000 lempiras para surtir la pulpería de granos básicos, manteca, churros, refrescos, azúcar, harina y otros abarrotes. Su sueño es llegar a tener un supermercado para darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old, he lives in a common law marriage with his wife, he has two children, and resides in a village in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara. Manuel had been working in agriculture, but in sight of improving his income he was able to establish his own business together with his wife. For 5 years he has been selling basic consumer goods such as rice, corn, beans, sugar, butter, lime, salt, coffee, bread, sodas, dairy, churros and other items.

He has invested three loans into his business in order to keep it active, and he is currently requesting another for 15,000 Honduran Lempiras to stock his store with basic grains, butter, churros, sodas, sugar, flour and other groceries. His dream is to grow to have a supermarket in order to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock his store with basic grains, butter, churros, sodas, sugar, flour and other groceries.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel de 29 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 3 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios de seguridad, pero además buscando tener más ingresos es jornalero en sus días libres, lo que le permite darle estabilidad económica a su familia. Miguel desea terminar de construir un techo para el área de la cocina ya que actualmente solo ha colocado un plástico, el cual no protege mucho de la lluvia, por lo que él desea construir un techo de lámina. Por lo anterior Miguel solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lamina galvanizada, tubos de hierro, polines y pines para construir un techo de lamina en el área de la cocina.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 29, lives in his own home with his life companion and their 3-year-old child. 

He is a hardworking man who earns a living as a security guard, but as he is looking to have more income, he works for daily wages on his days off. This allows him to provide his family with financial stability. 

Miguel wants to finish building a roof for the kitchen area, as currently there is only a plastic sheet placed there.  It does not provide much protection from the rain, so he wants to build a tin roof.

For this, Miguel is requesting a loan from FUSAI for the purchase of galvanized sheeting, iron pipes, beams, and pins, in order to build a tin roof in the kitchen area.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheeting, iron tubes, beams, and pins, in order to build a tin roof in the kitchen area.

loans.name: Erna

texts.en: Erna lives in West Bandung, a regency area located in West Java province. Erna is a mother of two children, both of whom go to school. Her husband is an employee in a private company. Erna contributes to the family income by running a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, household appliances, school stationery and mobile phone airtime credits. She joined Ruma about a month ago because she wanted to expand her business. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more airtime transactions in her community on the weekends. Erna is pictured in the photo sitting in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To provide mobile services in her community

loans.name: Grupo Yoxaja 5 Group

texts.es:
La agricultura es una actividad solamente apta para toda aquella persona que ama la tierra como a una madre, como una engendradora de futuros para la vida.  Buenos futuros de esperanzas para generaciones siguientes. Mujeres emprendedoras no hacen falta en el país de la eterna primavera que es Guatemala donde la mujer forma parte importante en los campos laborales, tal es el caso de Manuela de 27 años de edad que tiene 2 hijo los cuales son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad. (Manuela es la que se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha en la fotografía)

La actividad que ella desempeña con tanto orgullo es la producción de banano en los campos fértiles de su comunidad dicho trabajo lo ha venido realizando desde hace 18 años y genera buena ganancia para la economía de su familia ya que es la herencia que su padre le pudo dejar para que ella tenga una calidad de vida mejor en el futuro.
El uso respectivo que Manuela le dará al préstamo que ella solicita es para el mantenimiento de banano  para que produzcan sus frutos y sean llevados en los mercados de la comunidad para su respectiva venta.

Ella es un ejemplo a seguir en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se decidieron unirse con Manuela para poder sacarles el provecho máximo de las tierras de su comunidad ya que está llena de vida para producir cualquier producto agrícola.
Los sueños de ella es la plantación de más banano en las tierras fértiles con que ella cuenta y de esa manera ella quiere apoyar al medio ambiente y así mismo sacar un provecho económico para su familia para que lleguen a profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
Agriculture is an activity that is only appropriate for all those people who love the earth like a mother, as a generator of futures for life, good futures of hope for the following generations. Entrepreneurial women are not lacking in the country of eternal spring that is Guatemala, where the woman plays an important role in the farm work. Such is the case with Manuela, who is 27 years old and has two children who go to the school in the community. (Manuela is the first one going from left to right in the photograph.)

The work that she carries out with such pride is producing bananas in the fertile fields of her community. She has been doing this work for 18 years and generates good earnings for the economy of her family, since it is the inheritance that her father was able to leave her so that she could have a better quality of life in the future.

The use that Manuela will give to the loan that she is applying for is to maintain her banana plantings so that they produce their fruits, which can be taken to the markets in the community to sell.

She is an example to follow in her community, and it is for that reason that a group of women decided to unite with Manuela to be able to get the maximum benefits from the land in their community, since it is full of life for producing any agricultural product.

Her dreams are to plant more bananas in the fertile land that she has, and in this way she wants to help the environment and at the same time to get economic earnings for her family, so that they [her children] can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to maintain her banana plantings

loans.name: Osman

texts.es: Osman, tiene 23 años de edad, está casado, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia, en el municipio de Jesús de Otoro. Se dedica a la producción de café desde hace 4 años. La producción de café la vende en la zona y es su fuente de ingresos.  El  préstamo que solicita es de 15,000 lempiras para invertirlo  en la compra de fertilizantes y darle un buen mantenimiento a su finca para lograr aumentar la cosecha. Su propósito es que su familia se supere.
texts.en: Osman is 23 years old. He is married and has one son. He lives with his family in the township of Jesús de Otoro. He has worked in coffee production for four years. He sells his coffee in the zone [where he lives], and this is his source of income. The loan that he is applying for is for 15,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and give good maintenance to his farm to increase his harvest. His goal is that his family can better themselves.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to apply to his coffee farm.

loans.name: Zulma Marisol

texts.es: Zulma de 22 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hermano y la esposa de él. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida como instructora en una empresa desde hace 4 años, además su hermano y la esposa también aportan para los gastos económicos del hogar. El cuarto dormitorio de Zulma está construido por láminas por lo que ella desea repararlo ya que actualmente las láminas están deterioradas por lo que al no contar con el presupuesto necesario solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar su cuarto dormitorio.
texts.en:
Zulma is 22 years old and lives in her own home together with her brother and his wife. She is an entrepreneurial woman that has earned a living as an instructor in a company for 4 years. Also, her brother and his wife help out with the home expenses.

The fourth room, which is Zulma's, is made of sheeting that she would like to repair since currently the sheets are deteriorated. Because she does not have the budget necessary, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to repair her room.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to repair her room.

loans.name: Maclaren Group

texts.en:
Calister, who is in her late 40s, is married and has four sons and one daughter. Calister's children are in school. She has been supporting her family by running a store selling beer, soda, water, spirits and wine. She also manages a kitchen where she has a helper who provides food service. Calister works from 9 am to midnight and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her 16th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Maclaren, a four-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. With her previous credits, since repaid, she bought business stock, bought new chairs and tables, changed her business premises to look more attractive, and added three business rooms.  She is so happy and thankful to everyone who has supported them. She earned extra income that she used to buy a plot of land to build a house with her husband, to cover part of her children's school fees, and to pay household food expenses. Calister will use her new credit to buy drinks for her store. Her desire is to expand her business portfolio.

Calister is so proud of lenders' support, and she believe that lending is something everyone should consider doing.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her store

loans.name: Eloy Adolfo

texts.es:
Eloy es un padre de familia muy amoroso de 36 años y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Siempre ha luchado por sacar adelante a su familia, en especial a su preciosa hija. El excelente desempeño en su trabajo es el resultado de todos los valores inculcados en él por sus padres y la ética intachable con la que trabaja. Eloy se levanta motivado cada día porque quiere brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
Con este crédito Eloy piensa comprar enseres para amoblar su casa, es por ello que está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado va a mejorar su calidad de vida y así seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder brindarle una educación de calidad a su hijo.
texts.en:
Eloy is the very loving 36-year-old father of a family. He lives in Ica with his family. He has always worked hard to raise his family, especially his precious daughter. His excellent performance in his work is the result of all the values inculcated in him by his parents and the irreproachable ethic with which he works. Eloy gets up motivated every day because he wants to offer the best to his family.

With this loan, Eloy is thinking of buying furnishings for his house. It is for this reason that he is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have offered him, he is going to improve their quality of life, and thus he will continue striving so that in the future he will be able to offer a quality education to his child.

loans.use: to buy furnishings for his house

loans.name: Gissela Renata

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí, conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Las Américas.
En este lugar vive la señora Gissela, tiene 27 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 4 años que está en jardín de infantes, su marido se dedica al comercio. 
Doña Gissela es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así salir adelante y con sus esfuerzo ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene una pequeña distribuidora de agua en bidón, en botellas o galones de acuerdo a lo que necesiten sus clientes, también vende ropa de todo tipo, sandalias, bisutería entre otras cosas, vende en su local y también sale a ofrecer puerta a puerta. Ella deja sus productos a créditos y cobra cada ocho días. Ella empezó su negocio con los créditos que recibió del grupo por lo cual está muy agradecida. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar agua, ropa y zapatos. Lleva 9 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia ya que arrienda donde vive.
texts.en:
The members of the loan group "Las Américas" meet every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.

Señora Gissela lives in this place. She is 27 years old and maintains a free union relationship from which she has a 4-year-old son who is in preschool. He husband works in business.

Doña Gissela is a woman who likes to work to get ahead and with her efforts to help her husband with the household expenses. She has a little distributorship of water in large cans, in bottles, or in gallons, according to what her customers need. She also sells clothing of all types, sandals, and jewelry, among other items. She sells in her locale and also goes out to offer her products door to door. She leaves her products on credit and collects every week. She began her business with the loans that she received from the group, for which she is very grateful.

She is going to use this loan to buy water, clothing, and shoes. She has been in the loan group for 9 years, and she likes it because she began her business thanks to the loans. Her dreams are to have her own house, since they rent where they live.

loans.use: to buy water, clothing, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine for his dressmaking business.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Al trabajar la tierra bajo un sol agotador sin embargo dispuesto a sudar todo el tiempo para brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos. De 31 años de edad casado Carlos tiene 3 hijos por la que se esfuerza todos los días para una mejor vida, el lucha por el futuro de sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida mejor a la que el tubo, su primer hijo ya tiene familia aparte y los dos últimos son estudiantes de su comunidad.

La actividad que el realiza con  todo empeño todos los días es al cultivo de maíz ya que para el se ha convertido en un buen negocio para tener un ingresos económico, el viene realizando dicha actividad durante 15 años a el le ha gustado ver crecer la milpa y como llega el tiempo de cosecha, el realiza esta actividad con su esposa y si les ha dejado buena ganancia.

El motivo de la realización del préstamo es para la compra de fertilizantes para que su cosecha de maíz sean mejores que los años anteriores, los sueños de Carlos en conjunto con su esposa es poder instalar en su comunidad un depósito de venta de maíz para poder atender mejor a las personas que requieren de este producto de primera necesidad como lo es el maíz y brindarles estudios a sus hijos para que sean profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Working the land under an exhausting sun, but nevertheless ready to sweat all day in order to offer a better future to his children, Carlos, who is 31 and is married, has three children for whom he exerts himself every day for a better life. He strives for the future of his children so that they can have better living conditions that those that he had. His first son already has a separate family, and the two younger children go to school in the community.

The work that he does every day with all his effort is raising corn, since for him it has become a good business for having economic income. He has been doing this work for 15 years, and he has liked seeing his cornfield become larger and seeing the time of harvest arrive. He does this work with his wife, and it has given them good earnings.

The reason for taking out the loan is to purchase fertilizers so that his harvest of corn will be better than in the previous years. Carlos' dreams, in conjunction with his wife, are to be able to set up in his community a sales warehouse for corn in order to better serve the people who need this product as a basic necessity, which is what corn is, and to offer his children an education so that they can be professionals in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhtuvshin, 32 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a heavy truck operator at a mining company since 2010. His wife is unemployed and currently stays at home, taking care of domestic work. Their daughter goes to secondary school. His brother studies at a university in China and is having trouble paying his tuition fees. As a big brother, he is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to pay for his brother's tuition fees.

In the borrower profile picture the borrower is sitting with his family.

loans.use: to pay his brother's tuition fees.

loans.name: Maria Maribel

texts.es: María de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida vendiendo artículos de belleza por catálogo como: cremas, lociones, desodorantes, maquillaje, accesorios, etc. Además su compañero de vida se gana la vida como albañil actividad que le permite junto a su compañera de vida sostener la economía familiar. María desea reparar la pared de su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorada, como se puede observar en la fotografía, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento y arena para reparar la pared de su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorada.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and lives in her own home with her life companion and their two children, ages 12 and 13.
She is a hard-working woman who earns her living  selling beauty items by catalog, such as creams, lotions, deodorants, make-up, accessories, etc. In addition, her life companion earns a living as a construction worker, a livelihood which allows him and his life companion to support their family. Maria wishes to repair the wall of their home which is in poor condition  as can be seen in the photo, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement and sand for repairing the wall of her home.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand for repairing the wall of her home, which is in poor condition.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 41 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Amy has a food vending business in the Philippines. Amy requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Amy has been in this business for seven years. In the future Amy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Un accidente hace 16 años le quito la oportunidad a Carlos de seguir ejerciendo una labor pues no era apto para trabajar, pro su emprendimiento y ganas logro montar un negocio donde vende snaks, dulces, refrescos, cerveza y bebidas alcohólicas y también oferta su servicio de billar. 

Carlos es un hombre que quiere demostrar que ninguna discapacidad es motivo de resignarse y rendirse y en base a trabajo le ha cambiado el pensamiento a muchas personas que lo creían un inútil, solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en compra de dulces, bebidas alcohólicas y cerveza en grandes cantidades para contar con un buen surtido perecedero en el tiempo. 

Tiene dos hijos de 16 y 6 años de edad y son el motor de su vida su fuente de inspiración, su alegría son su todo y quiere brindarle un estudio una vida estable y digna para que se siente orgullosos de ese padre que supero todo obstáculo por ellos.
texts.en:
Sixteen years ago an accident took away Carlos' opportunity to continue working, as he was not suitable for work. Through his entrepreneurship and enthusiasm he was able to start a business in which he sells snacks, sweets, soft drinks, beer and alcoholic beverages, and also offers billiards. 

Carlos wants to show that no disability is reason to resign oneself and surrender; and through his work he has changed the thinking of many people who believed that he was helpless. He is requesting a loan, which he will invest in purchasing  large quantities of snacks, alcoholic beverages, and beer, in order to have a good supply of perishable items on hand.

He has two children ages 16 and 6, who are his life's driving force and his source of inspiration. Their happiness means everything to him, and he wants to provide them with an education and a stable and decent life, so that they will be proud of their father who overcame every obstacle for them.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of beer, alcoholic beverages, soft drinks, and large quantities of snacks and sweets, demonstrating that a disability is not an obstacle.

loans.name: Bano

texts.en:
Bano is 36, married and a mother of three children. She is a kind and caring housewife. Her husband sells milk to the local households in Lahore. Her husband rises early in the morning and prepares the animal feed. He then takes the milk to fill containers and heads to different households to deliver milk to his customers. Bano always lends a hand to her husband. He has been doing this for eight years now. Their financial condition is not very good. Her husband wants to buy another buffalo to produce more milk and increase the sale of milk.
 
Bano has therefore requested a loan to help her husband buy a buffalo. They are hopeful for a better and more prosperous future and thank Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her husband's milk sale business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maintain his cacao plantation.

loans.name: Mt Udzungwa Group

texts.en:
Philipo is a businessman running a clothes selling business door-to-door. He sells second hand clothes, crossing street to street with his stock on hand. He has been in this business for five years now and is able to realize a good profit. Philipo is married and aged in his thirties, working from 6am to 8pm daily. 

Philipo is requesting his third loan via Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to improve his business; he bought more clothes which sold out. Philipo received an extra income which he used to cover school fees and plow back into his business. He has paid back all previous loans successfully. He will use this new loan to replenish his business with most the up-to-date clothes to resell. Philipo desires to further improve his business and to purchase lots of stock.

He will share this loan with his loan group, Mt Udzungwa, which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his business with the most up-to-date clothes to resell.

loans.name: Pascuela

texts.en: A loan of $600 is offered to Pascuela to improve her business. She has a kiosk and she is selling bread. She is doing this business because she earns a good income from this business, where many people come to buy her bread every day. She started her business in 2010 with her own working capital of $100. Now she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy some supplies, such as cooking oil, red dye, green dye, wheat and other materials, to make bread. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. She is happy that she is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants her business to grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, red dye, green dye, wheat and other materials to make bread.

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is a rural woman hailing from Dhupguri.  She is 27 years old and married to Amal.  She is blessed with three children (one son and two daughters).  Her children go to school. She is illiterate and only knows how to sign her name. They live at PaschimMagurmari, a remote region in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Parbati's husband, Amal, is engaged in a small business, but his income is insufficient to cover all the family expenses. So Parbati has been involved in the business of rearing livestock. She has been engaged in this business for the last few years to provide financial help to her family.  She somehow developed her business to some extent through her dedication and hard work.  She fattens the goats and sells their milk to the local people. Sometimes she sells the goats to the butcher when they grow up. In this way, she tries to extend a helping hand to her husband to run the family. However, owing to a lack of capital, she is not in a position to take full advantage of her knowledge of rearing livestock.

That is why she seeks a loan from BJS to use as working capital.  The loan will help her to purchase more goats for her business. She wants to buy land and provide an uninterrupted education to her children with the profit generated from her business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this financial help. .

loans.use: To purchase goats for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Her name is Marlina, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, a taxi driver, with three children. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to meet their family's daily household needs and for their children's education.

Marlina is in that direct selling business. She sells Tupperware and also popular direct selling personal branded popular products like Natasha, Boardwalk toiletries, clothing, and beauty products. Dealers buy the products at a lower price from the catalogue shown to the customers and sell them on one-month-to-pay credit. Filipinos nowadays prefer to buy these branded personal goods since they are of good quality. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of 9,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan which she will use to buy merchandise items and fill orders for her customers. She is positive for a good return on her business since beauty products are now very salable. 
 
Marlina fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise items and fill orders for her customers.

loans.name: Alema

texts.en:
Alema is 53 years old, married and a mother of three sons. She is uneducated and can only sign her name. Due to the miserable conditions of her family, Alema did not get an opportunity to study. Her sons are grown up. One is engaged in their grocery business and other two are unemployed. They live in West Magurmari, a remote region in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own mud house.

Alema's husband, 60-year-old Momin, runs a grocery store from their house. He was deprived of an education due to the poor financial resources of his parents. He doesn't surrender to the miserable conditions of his family, but strives to improve the living standard of his family. He has a good reputation among his neighbors as a kind and hardworking man.  Over time, he has been able to accumulate a good amount of money and start his own small grocery business. He started his own business more than 15 years ago. He started this business with a small amount of capital. Over the course of his hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed him to expand his sales volume.

For the purpose of further developing her husband's business, Alema turned to Kiva's partner BJS.  She is requesting a loan to buy more grocery items like salt, sugar, oil, biscuits, flour, rice, etc. to be able to meet the demands of his customers as well as earn more income to strengthen the family economy for a better future.

Her dream is to construct a better and decent house with access to basic amenities like electricity and piped water. So she is grateful to her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Kadar

texts.en:
Kadar is from a small village in West Magurmari, Dhupguri, West Bengal.  She is a homemaker, 46 years old, who looks after her husband and two sons. Her sons are receiving an education and are in college and grade 12, respectively. 

The couple has been engaged in agriculture for many years. Kadar's husband cultivates different crops and sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. As the income is too scant to provide the basic needs of his family, he is thinking of cultivating a crop that is profitable and an all season crop. So they have decided to grow paddy on their farmland. Because they have inadequate capital, they have decided to take some financial help for cultivation.

Kadar has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) and the requested loan is very important for Kadar to be able to purchase fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation. The loan will greatly help this family to organize their cultivation work and they hope for a good harvest.  They hope it will be a lucrative business as the crop has a tremendous demand in the market. She dreams of upgrading her house to a concrete-made house.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for growing paddy.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Jyotsna hails from Dhupguri.  She is a widow who lost her husband a few years back. She lives with her only son in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. She is a rural woman who could only acquire a primary education and could not continue due to parental poverty.  For the very same reason, her only son was also deprived of a higher education.  Now he has grown up and is involved in the cultivation of vegetables.

Jyotsna is ready to fight against the odds in her life. After her husband's death, finding no other way to look after her son and meet the family's expenses, she engaged in cultivation. Now her son looks after their agribusiness and she helps him. They have agricultural land where her son grows vegetables like potatoes, gourds, ladies fingers, and beans and sells at the local market to support his family. But they need to improve their cultivation for additional income that is badly needed for the family. Her son is interested in growing eggplant, which is widely used in Bengali dishes.

So Jyotsna plans to buy quality seeds and fertilizers and for this reason, she is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). This income will be used for the family's wellbeing and future savings. She aspires to make a concrete-made house with the additional profit.

Jyotsna thanks her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase eggplant seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta has been operating her own party supplies and catering business for seven years, and she earns well. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her three children. She and her husband work hard, with the determination of earning a better income to provide their children with a better education.

In order to increase sales, Julieta is requesting a new loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional supplies needed to improve her business. These include more quantities of party poppers, balloons, hats and souvenirs. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Julieta dreams of having an additional outlet for her business. She also wants to help save for her children and give them a better future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for party supplies, including party poppers, balloons, hats and souvenirs.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Group

texts.en:
Bedamati, the leader of the group, lives in Beherapali Village in Tarbha in the district of Subarnapur, Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 26 years. She has a small family comprised of four members: her husband, one son and one daughter who are 6 and 10 years old, respectively. The member sitting first from the right with her hand raised in the first row is Bedamati. 

Like most families in the locality, she and her husband are doing the business of waste material (Tin, Silver, Rubber Tire, Plastics, etc.) in their house.  Her husband helps her in procuring waste material from different places and accumulates and sells it by the lot to the factory. This is the first loan she wants to take. 

To improve her living condition and earn some extra income, she wants to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. In order to take the loan, she formed a group of 12 women from her locality. At present, her monthly income is Rs 5,500 from her business, which is not sufficient to lead a better life. So, she wants to take a loan to purchase waste materials in bulk and sell it in lots to save transportation cost and time. She has a dream of making a store room in her house.

The other 11 members are Minchi, Tapaswini, Sukanti, Budhabari, Kalabati, Banita, Santilata, Chema, Rasmita, Kuma, Ur and Para. They are doing separate businesses

loans.use: To purchase waste materials like silver, rubber,and plastic

loans.name: Pedronela

texts.en: Pedronela lives in Oecusse and she is a businesswoman. She has been involved in business activities since 2012. She started with her own working capital of $200. She is requesting a loan of $800, because she has a kiosk and she is very interested in her business. She is taking out a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more goods such as sugar,  noodles, coffee, soap, cooking oil, shampoo, wheat, salt, candies and other things to sell. She is happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She needs to take out a loan because she wants to improve her management for her business and she wants to increase her income in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar,  noodles, coffee, soap, cooking oil, shampoo, wheat, salt, candies and other things to sell.

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling salt in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her salt making business.

Ednalyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Ednalyn's business profile again for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her salt making business.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is 41 years old and married with four children.

Liezl works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Liezl has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Liezl aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Xenia Patricia

texts.es:
Xenia, tiene cambios positivos en su negocio por el apoyo que se le brindo con el financiamiento anterior, se ha mantenido abasteciendo a sus clientes de lo que necesiten, su situación económica ha mejorado y su núcleo familiar se mantiene.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar papel higiénico, jabón, detergentes, aceite, granos básicos y otros productos que sean necesarios para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Xenia has experienced a lot of improvements to her business thanks to the last loan she received.  She has been able to keep a stock to satisfy her customers and her financial situation has improved as a result, helping her to support her family.

She has decided to ask for a new loan to buy toilet paper, soap, detergent, oil, basic grains and other products which are necessary to satisfy her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery products.

loans.name: Efren Flor  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Efrén Flor se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, este es un grupo formado por 8 mujeres y 2 hombres que decidieron unirse y formar este grupo el cual les va a servir  para mejorar sus negocios y su calidad de vida, la mayoría se dedica al comercio informal.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Gissela, tiene 38 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos  de  19, 18  y 14 años, la menor estudia en colegio y es la que aun vive con ella. 
Doña Gissela con la finalidad de salir adelante y que a su hija no le falte nada se dedica al comercio informal, ella  vende ropa, sabanas, edredones cortinas y varios productos más, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, así ella aprovecha  al momento de cobrar realizar nuevas ventas,  lleva 7 años con esta actividad la misma que espera mejorar con los créditos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como ropa, sabanas, edredones, toldos, cortinas entre otras cosas que vende. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños  son que su hija sea una buena profesional.
texts.en:
The credit group "Efren Flor" meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This area is well-known for its commerce.  The group is made up of eight women and two men who decided to join forces by setting up this group.  It helps them to improve their business and their quality of life.  Most of the members work in commerce.

One of the members is Gissela.  She is 38 and is separated from her husband who she has three children with.  The children are 19, 18 and 14 years old.  The youngest is studying at school and is the only one who still lives with her. 

Gissela sells clothes, sheets, duvets, curtains and things like that.  She does this in order to earn a living to be able to look after her daughter and make sure that she has all that she needs.  She sells door to door, but also from her home.  She sells on credit and collects payment every eight days.  When she goes to collect her money, she tries to use the moment to sell more.  She has been doing this for seven years and she hopes that with the use of the loans she will be able to improve.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as clothes, sheets, duvets, awnings, curtains and other things that she sells. This is her first cycle with this credit group and she appreciates the help they offer with the loan system. Her desire is that her daughter will have a successful professional career.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sheets, duvets, awnings, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to be able to apply for his official qualification.

loans.name: Jose Ilerman

texts.es:
José, logro dar mantenimiento a su equipo de trabajo con ayuda del crédito anterior, su prosperidad  en el negocio le da la oportunidad de generar mayores ingresos con los que cumple puntualmente con sus compromisos.
Opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar papelería, repuestos para computadoras y cámaras, con los que abastecerá su inventario para mantener su negocio funcionando, espera tener tan buenos resultados como en los financiamientos anteriores.
texts.en:
Jose has been able to keep his business running thanks to the last loan he received.  The prosperity he has experienced has allowed him to generate more of an income and pay off his bills on time.

He has decided to ask for a new loan to buy paper and spare parts for computers and cameras.  He hopes that he will be able to stock his business which will keep it running.  He'd like to see the same positive results that he had when he got the last loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his photography business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela, comercializa lácteos y elabora pupusas para vender, vive con dos hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad, ella es jefa de su hogar, actualmente está soltera, su negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años, surge por la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos con los que cubre las necesidades básicas de su familia, lo realiza de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, la venta de lácteos la desempeña por la mañana y por las tardes realiza la venta de pupusas, el negocio lo aprendió de su mamá, tiene como ventaja la poca competencia en la zona.
El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de quesos, quesillo, cremas, aderezos, bebidas, etc., así tendrá mercadería fresca y de calidad con la que sus clientes estarán satisfechos, su propósito es aumentar las ventas y ganancias.
Las aspiraciones de Ángela son ampliar el negocio, cancelar su deuda y seguir dando lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Angela buys and sells dairy products and stuffed tortillas.  She lives with her children aged 15 and 17.  She is the head of the household as at the moment she is single.  She has been in business for four years.  

She set it up out of necessity, so that she could generate an income to be able to cover the basic needs of her family.  She starts work at 8:00 am and finishes at 5:00 pm.  She sells dairy products in the morning and then in the afternoon she concentrates on the tortillas.  She learnt her skills from her mother and she has the advantage that there is not a lot of competition in her local area.

She will use the loan to buy cheese, cream cheese, dressings, drinks, etc.  This will allow her to keep her products fresh and of a good enough quality to please her customers.  Her aim is to increase her sales and profits.

She hopes to expand her business and pay off the loan, while at the same time providing all that her children need.

loans.use: to buy cheese, dressings, drinks and other products so that she can offer quality fresh food.

loans.name: Guillermo De La Cruz

texts.es:
Guillermo, se mantiene cultivando granos básicos, la productividad ha aumentado, sus ingresos son mejores, el estilo de vida familiar es más confortable y cancelo la deuda adquirida, todos estos cambios positivos son posibles por la inversión del crédito anterior.
Requiere un nuevo financiamiento por los buenos resultados que estos le dan,  comprara semilla, abono e insecticidas, también pagara mozos para realizar los trabajos en menor tiempo, espera que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Guillermo supports himself by growing staple grains; his productivity has increased; his profits are better; his family's lifestyle is more comfortable; and he has repaid the debt he took on.  All of these positive changes were made possible by his investment of his previous loan.  

He needs a new loan because of the good results they afford; he will buy seed, fertilizer, and insecticides, and he will also pay workers to get tasks done in less time.  He hopes his business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and insecticides, as well as to pay workers to get tasks done in less time

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a hard working woman. Prossy is 22 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. 

For the past 3 years, Prossy has been working hard to manage her business, which is selling charcoal. 
To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of charcoal, and will help Prossy to generate greater profits and provide for the family. 

Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita earns income from helping her husband working on their own farm to make a living. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan which was used for farm fertilization costs. She was also able to put up capital for her retail store. She was very happy to provide an increase in their income. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to sell.
 
They are determined to be successful in farming so that they can provide a better standard of living for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 37 year old mother who aims to improve her small retail store. She wants to increase her income to satisfy the necessities of her family and finance the education of her four children. 

She wants to acquire more stock of grocery items to sell but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to take a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more snack foods, noodles, eggs, canned goods, beverages, candies, soft drinks and frozen foods to resell. She is hoping that this financial assistance will enable her to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods, noodles, eggs, canned goods, beverages, candies, soft drinks and frozen foods to resell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Margie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and raising livestock businesses. Margie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Maa Mangala Group

texts.en:
Sarada, 32 years old and the leader of the group, hails from Nadhara, Tarbha in the district of Subarnapur, Odisha, India.  She has a small family comprised of four members: her husband and two sons who are 11 and 14 years old. The member sitting first from the left holding a file in her hand is Sarada.

Sarada and her husband are doing paddy cultivation along with vegetables. They do vegetables for four months after harvesting the paddy and earn handsome money. Her husband gets the vegetable seeds, vegetable plants and fertilizers from town for vegetable cultivation. Sarada, along with 11 other members in her locality, formed a group to take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing businesses.

Now she is very much confident in doing vegetable cultivation and has developed her business significantly. At present, her monthly income is about Rs 6,000. She wants to avail herself of a further loan to purchase seeds, and fertilizers for vegetable and paddy cultivation to earn some money.  She has a long desire to educate her children in a better school.

The other 11 members of her groups are Banita, Parthabi, Dhar, Ukia, Gukuni, Kalabati, Kiaphula, Bhagabati, Bedamati, Parameswari and Tribeni doing separate businesses of their own.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Dongboun Group

texts.en: Mr. Inthee's village takes water from wells and from the local streams.  Some people in the village are able to buy bottled water.  The water in this area is dirty and unsuitable for drinking without treatment.  The nearby villages also suffer from dirty and unsafe drinking water. Mr. Inthee is excited that he and his neighbors were able to purchase a water filter. Most families report a threefold reduction in diarrhea after they begin using the filter because the filter removes bacteria and other water-borne diseases. The water filter also increases disposable income and available working days due to the decreased cost of purchasing charcoal or foraging for wood and/or purchasing bottled water. The filter is guaranteed for two years, though most find the filter works for three to five years.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIALAKOROBA, commune de KEBILA, une des sous-préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide et le sésame avec MAMINE LOSSENI 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position debout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 3 hectares. La production est vendue à KEBILA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women who, on average, are 39 years old and have three children. They all live in polygamous families in Dialakoroba, in Kebila, one of the areas in the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming during the rainy season. The group is on their first loan with the institution.

Mamine Losseni, who is standing first on the left in the photo, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs and seeds. She will also pay the cost of plowing three hectares of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in Kebila to male and female customers. 

Mamine Losseni hopes to earn 75,000 francs CFA in profit, which will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband in the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay the cost of plowing

loans.name: Chevy

texts.en:
Chevy is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Iloilo, Philippines. Chevy has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a fisherman.

Several months ago, a super typhoon hit the country and ruined thousands of houses and businesses including Chevy's. As of now, Chevy is in need of additional capital for her business. She is requesting a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, animal feed, supplements and a new boat engine. With this, Chevy will be able to raise more healthy pigs that she can sell to the market after a few months. Besides that, her husband will be able to go back to fishing and augment his catch. In the future, Chevy hopes to make her business a success and save money for the schooling of her seven children.

loans.use: to buy piglets, animal feed, supplements and a new boat engine

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Nena works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling fermented fish in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising ducks. Nena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for making fermented fish.

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making fermented fish.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIALAKOROBA, commune de KEBILA, une des sous-préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide et le sésame avec AMI BOURAMA 1ère personne à droite sur la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 1 hectare. La production est vendue à KEBILA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75 000f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have four children. They all live in polygamous families in Dialakoroba, in Kebila, one of the areas of the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their first loan with the institution.

Ami Bourama, who is seated first on the right in the photo, grows groundnuts and sesame. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs and seeds. She will also pay the cost of plowing one hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in Kebila to male and female customers.

Ami Bourama hopes to earn 75,000 francs CFA in profit, which will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband in the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay the cost of plowing

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is married and runs a general store while her husband works in the government to make a living. For over 10 years in running the business, it is doing well enough to sustain their daily needs. To increase sales, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She plans to expand her store to increase sales and improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  41 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DIALAKOROBA, commune de KEBILA, une des sous-préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution. La spéculation cultivée est le riz, l’arachide et le sésame avec SETOU SALIF 1ère personne à gauche sur la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter 0,5 hectare. La production est vendue à KEBILA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 37 500f cfa qui  la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 4 group are married women who, on average, are 41 years old and have two children. They all live in polygamous families in Dialakoroba, in Kebila, an area of the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. The group is on their first loan with the institution.

Setou Salif, who is seated first on the left in the photo, grows rice, groundnuts, and sesame. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs and seeds. She will also pay the cost of plowing a half hectare of land. 

After the harvest, crops are sold in Kebila to male and female customers.

Setou Salif hopes to earn 37,500 francs CFA in profit, which will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and to pay the cost of plowing

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 70 years old and married with 10 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ninfa is borrowing PHP 9,500 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ninfa has been farming rice for 20 years and earns additional income from pig fattening and her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 35, married and blessed with seven children. She is the leader of her group. She is the one raising her hand in the picture.  Her husband has a milk sales business. He sells milk to households and retailers in the local market. They live in a rented house. He is a humble and hardworking person. Their children go to a local government school. As they have a big family, meeting day-to-day expenses is not easy for them.
 
Nasreen's husband wants to buy a buffalo as his buffalo died of disease and this has affected milk production and his sales. But he does not have enough cash on hand to buy a buffalo. Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan to help her husband. They are thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her milk sales business

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis de 60 años es la propietaria de una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres licores, verduras, cárnicos, refrescos etc. actividad en la que tiene 10 años de experiencia. Ella y su esposo la iniciaron, cuando su hijo mayor había emprendido una panadería y debió viajar a otro lugar, razón por la cual quedaron el y su cónyuge administrando el negocio, convirtiéndolo en una tienda, donde vende artículos de la canasta familiar a crédito y de contado principalmente,  en horarios diarios que van desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Para ofrecer precios competitivos, Denis compra  de contado en graneros. Como   su meta es ampliar los inventarios y la cobertura de clientes para continuar apoyando a sus hijos y nietos, requiere hacer crecer su negocio. Por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, verduras, carnes y pollo. Con esta inversión se incrementarán los inventarios y aumentará su oferta mejorando así su negocio.
texts.en:
Denis, 60, is the owner of a store where she sells meals, provisions, liquors, vegetables, meat, soft drinks, etc.  She has ten years' experience in the business.  She and her husband started the business when their eldest son was running a bakery but had to move elsewhere.  So she and her husband took over the business and converted it into a store where they sell staple goods on a credit and cash basis, although mainly the latter.  Their schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.

In order to offer competitive prices, Denis buys in cash from graineries.  Since she wants to increase her stock and attract more customers to continue supporting her children and grandchildren, she wants to expand her business.  Therefore, she is currently applying for a CrediKiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy provisions, vegetables, meats and chicken.  With this investment she will increase her stock and product line and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions, vegetables, meat and chicken.

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio, requiere capital para comprar cemento, ladrillos, hierro, arena, una pulidora y variedad marisco,  son los materiales necesarios para realizar modificaciones en su vivienda y mantener su venta de mariscos funcionando, mejorará el entorno en que vive su familia y tendrá nuevas herramientas para seguir trabajando en la albañilería.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo resultados positivos porque ha equipado mejor su negocio y ofrece a sus clientes mariscos frescos, ha mejorado sus ingresos, la familia se mantiene, espera ahorrar para apoyar a su esposa en hacer la apertura de su propio negocio, para así construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Julio needs a loan to buy cement, bricks, steel, sand, a buffer, and a variety of seafood. These are the supplies he needs to make modifications to his house and keep his seafood sales going. He will make the environment that his family lives in better and will get new tools to continue working as a bricklayer.

With his previous loan he had positive results, because his business was better stocked and he could offer his customers fresh seafood. He improved his income, supported his family, he hopes to save to help his wife open her own business, in order to build their own home.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, steel, sand, a buffer, and a variety of seafood to keep his business going.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is single and runs a general store to make a living. She has been doing this for over five years in order to sustain her needs. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a new loan to buy grocery goods to sell. She wants to improve her store and offer more goods and services to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo, opta por solicitar más capital para comprar vestidos, camisas, pantalones, blusas, etc., ofrecerá a sus clientes nuevos estilos de prendas de  vestir, tendrá su fuente de ingresos funcionando y podrá sobresalir ante su competencia.
Con ayuda del préstamo anterior fortaleció su negocio, las circunstancias familiares son más favorables y tiene estabilidad económica con la cumple con sus obligaciones.
texts.en: Rodolfo is requesting more resources to buy dresses, shirts, pants, blouses, etc. so he can offer his customers new clothing styles.  This will boost his source of income so he can defend himself against the competition.  The previous loan helped strengthen his business.  His family circumstances are favorable and he has the economic stability to meet his obligations.

loans.use: To buy dresses, shirts, pants, blouses, etc., and offer new clothing styles to his customers.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia lives in Lahore. She is married and a housewife. She is blessed with four children. Her husband does shuttering work where he prepares molds for construction purposes. He makes iron and wooden molds. He has seven years of experience with his shuttering work. He is the sole earner in the family and has to work hard day and night to bring in income to meet his family's expenses. 

Fozia's husband wants to increase his income by purchasing more material for his shuttering work. For this purpose, Fozia has requested a loan through BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. They are thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en: Juditha is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Iloilo, Philippines. Juditha and her husband own a fishing business. They have been fishing for more than 12 years. This is the source of their income. Unfortunately, their fishing business was ruined when a super typhoon hit their place several months ago, leaving them with a shattered house and a damaged fishing boat. Juditha has just started to rebuild. She is now asking for a loan to be used as an additional payment for purchasing a new fishing boat. Through this, her husband will be able to go back to fishing and augment his catch. They sell their catch in the market. In the future, Judith dreams of improving their fishing business to generate more income. Furthermore, she wants to save money for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing boat

loans.name: Mercury Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 20s, is single.  She has been a food vendor for one year now.  She works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Mariam's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use her loan to buy rice, wheat flour, beans, meat, and soft drinks and meet her customers' demands.  She dreams of opening a clothing shop

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Mercury" with 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to buy rice, wheat flour, beans, meat, and soft drinks to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
