Remia is married and works hard to support her family. She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising chickens. Remia is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Remia has sustained her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery.

loans.name: Mata

texts.en:
Mata is married and a mother of four children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Mata is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials and sewing supplies such as fabric and thread.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Being a responsible mother, Grace aims to make her business profitable to help her husband in generating income to sustain the necessities of their family. She and her husband want to educate their five children so that they will become professionals and have a good job someday. With this regard, Grace is asking for financial assistance of PHP 20,000 to buy more candies, biscuits, shampoos, beverages, seasonings, eggs, canned goods and soft drinks to resell. Through hard work and strong determination, she believes that she will be able to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more candies, biscuits, shampoo, beverages, seasonings, eggs, canned goods and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
This is Sofia. She has previously accessed a loan for her piggery, and she successfully repaid her loan. Sofia now focuses on their farm business, and she earns well. Sofia has also used the income from her previous loan to purchase some farming inputs.

Sofia is requesting a new loan, this time for her farm business, to purchase additional farming materials like wire, baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. She will use her loan to improve her profit and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. Sofia appears here in a photo at their farmland.

Sofia wants to plant other kinds of fruits and root crops available and suitable to their area so that she will be able to increase her income. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farming supplies and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy merchandise in the form of traditional garments

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es: Carlos de 42 años de edad habita en vivienda humilde pero propia por lo que se siente muy feliz. Él es un hombre trabajador que se desempeña como comerciante de granos básicos: maíz, frijoles y maicillo. Carlos con el ánimo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida, está construyendo su vivienda pero al no contar con el financiamiento necesario para terminar de construir y colocar ladrillo en el baño de su vivienda, ha decidido acercarse a FUSAI para solicitar un crédito con el fin de comprar: cemento, ladrillo de piso, arena y grava para terminar de construir y colocar ladrillo de piso en el baño de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is 42 years old. He lives in a humble house, but he owns it, so he is very happy. He is a hard-working man who works selling basic grains: corn, beans and millet. 

Carlos hopes to improve his living conditions. He is building his house, but since he doesn't have the necessary financing to finish construction and lay floor tile in his home's bathroom, he decided to come to FUSAI to apply for a loan in order to buy cement, floor tiles, sand and gravel to finish construction and lay floor tile in the bathroom of his home.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and gravel to finish construction and lay floor tile in the bathroom of his home.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa is married with two children and operates a general store while her husband works as a security guard to make a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for the business and to provide for their needs. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase a greater variety of grocery goods to sell.

She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the future education of her children and to improve the family's living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Yessica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yessica, actualmente cuenta con un negocio más surtido que le genera más ingresos, gracias al financiamiento anterior, sus clientes han aumentado por lo que la demanda de sus productos ha crecido y el estilo de vida es más confortable.
Por los buenos resultados que tiene al invertir capital en su negocio opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar azúcar, sal, granos básicos, jugos, golosinas, etc., que le permitan cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes y mantener su fuente de ingresos con vida.
texts.en: Currently, Yessica has a better stocked up business which generates more income thanks to a previous loan. She has more customers because the demand for her products has increased and her life style is more comfortable. Because of the good results she had after investing the capital in her business, she is requesting a new loan to buy sugar, salt, basic grains, juices, sweets, etc., in order to satisfy her customers' needs and to keep alive her source of income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, basic grains, juices, sweets, etc., in order to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Boga

texts.en:
Boga is a married woman; she has seven children, all of whom attend school. Boga owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

Boga operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the 10,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en: Erminda started to operate a school canteen last June. Before that, she had a business buying and selling bananas for six years. Erminda is widowed and has four children. It's been three years since her husband passed away and being a single parent is quite difficult because she has to manage all the responsibilities and burdens of the family. But she doesn't focus on her worries and instead has found ways to overcome them. Indeed, Erminda has requested additional capital of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy school supplies, meat, sausage, assorted biscuits and soft drinks to sell. She knows that through this loan she will further increase her sales and income, sustain her family needs, educate her four children and get ahead in life. Erminda is looking forward to the approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, meat, sausage, biscuits and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a widow and works hard to support her family. She has a pottery business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Thelma is borrowing 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en: Managing a general store is the primary activity that Angeline does within her community. Due to a lack of capital, she wants to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more goods for her store, such as snack foods, laundry soaps, beverages, canned goods, noodles, seasonings and soft drinks. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will further improve her business and pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Retche

texts.en: Retche has managed a general store for over  five years and she earns a good amount to support her husband’s income. She has sustained the business and was able to successfully repay her previous loan used for the business. Planning to offer more goods, she took a new loan recently to purchase additional grocery goods and grains to sell.  In the future she wants to improve the business as well as the general condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and grains to sell.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a 45-year-old widow who lives in Silang, Cavite, in the Philippines. She manages her household while operating the business, working hard for her children to provide income for their everyday needs.

Felipa has a direct selling business, selling clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular brands like Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk and Marikina Shoe Exchange. As a dealer, she buys her customers' orders in cash and then provides them to the customers with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the sales catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers depend upon as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue her business, Felipa is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan. She will use it to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener and undergarments. 

Felipa dreams of expanding her business and she also wants to have her own boutique so that she can display her products. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and merchandise  like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman and has three children. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

Elizabeth operates a food making business making items such as beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passers-by and neighbours. She mentioned the high cost of purchasing food stuff as her major challenge. 

With the loan of Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a cafe in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Dom

texts.en:
Dom, 55, lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.  She has three dependent children and two married children. To make a living and support her family, she runs a small grocery store out of her own house.  She has been involved in this business since 2010. Her husband, Sophat, is a motorcycle taxi driver. Together, this couple can make average daily earnings of around $6.00 (USD). 

Dom wants to extend her business by serving all kinds of drinks to her customers. Since there is a shortage of capital investment, she is applying for a Kiva loan via HKL to buy drinks and re-sell them to her customers. She hopes that this loan will help to grow her business, as well as produce for money for her family.  She would thank to all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to buy drinks and re-sell them to her customers

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is a 37-year-old garment-factory worker and a married woman with three children living in Takeo Province of Cambodia. 

She has been a garment-factory worker since 1998. Her husband is 30, a rice farmer. Two of her children are students. Together, they can make $10 a day. 

Now Chanthy would like to request a loan to buy a cow for farming and breeding for calves to resell. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to buy more cows, renovate her house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a cow for farming and breeding for calves to resell.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim is a 50-year-old married woman and a farmer with six children living in Takeo province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1980. Her husband is 50, a construction foreman (in the photo with his wife). Three of her children are construction and garment-factory workers and three others are students. Together, they can earn approximately $27 a day. 

Now Lim would like to request a loan to buy cement, sand and bricks to build a ground-floor room. This loan will help her have one more room for her family and live in better conditions. In the future, she is going to renovate the roof and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks to build ground-floor rooms.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 47 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Virginia has been farming vegetables for five years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward achieving her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 60-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Iloilo, Philippines. 

She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 10 years now. Her husband is a fisherman. Milagros' business was adversely affected when a super typhoon hit the country several months ago.

As of now, Milagros is starting to rebuild again and is now requesting more capital to buy additional piglets and materials for fishing like fishing nets, lead weights, hooks. With this, she will be able to raise more pigs, which she can sell after a few months, and her husband will be able to augment his catch as well. 

In the future, Milagros hopes to make her business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and materials for fishing like fishing nets, lead weights, hooks.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: To overcome the hardships of living, Teresita aims to improve her hog-raising business to generate sufficient income. She is 53 years old and blessed with seven children. She plans to acquire more pigs to raise, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of additional capital of 45,000 Philippine pesos to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. Being a kind and industrious mother, she believes that she will improve her business, cover the necessities of her family, and finance the education of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Sarafeen

texts.en:
Sarafeen is 39 years old, a married woman and mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Sarafeen has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

Sarafeen gives thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix their auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married and has one child. She sells fish in the  village while her husband works in the government to make a living. 

She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to buy more fish to resell. She sells her fish in the villages, and with this loan, she probably will be able to sell more than before. She hopes that with her investment, she would earn better income to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy accessories for a solar energy system

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer, a 36-year-old farmer from Cheptongei, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, is elegant and admirable in spirit and effort. She is a role model, a mentor and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges and her passion to support her four children as a primary caregiver. 

For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, tomatoes and also keeping dairy cows. Jenifer has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. 

After her husband lost his formal job, the role of primary caregiver of the family fell to Jenifer. It has been overwhelming because she now has to shoulder the responsibility of feeding the whole family. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said. 

Jenifer is requesting a loan to buy an additional quality dairy cow and to build a modern dairy unit. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profits and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Jenifer is very visionary, and she intends that in the near future, she will start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling it. She will also start selling dairy products such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. 

By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

Jenifer believes that if female farmers had the same access to resources as men, the number of the world's hungry could be reduced by half.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow and build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es una mujer de 46 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos de 18 y 15 años y su trabajo es la elaboración de queso artesanal.
Ella es emprendedora, alegre, fuerte, luchadora, perfeccionista, amable, sociable, de buen humor, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad de Batallas que se caracteriza por la producción de excelentes quesos, cremas de queso y yogures de manera artesanal y natural, con un control riguroso de calidad y de higiene. La leche proviene del mismo lugar y de otros lugares del Altiplano, las tierras de pasto más altas del mundo, que les proporcionan un carácter único. Las recetas de los quesos son originarias de Europa.
Natalia es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su forma de vestir es típica (manta, pollera, sombrero), su lengua materna es el aymara el cual utiliza para comunicarse en su comunidad y algunos lugares de el alto, para el comercio también utiliza el español. Su negocio es la producción de queso y derivados lácteos como; yogurt y crema de leche. Ella sueña mejorar su calidad de vida generando mejores ingresos económicos, para eso desea realizar la compra de una máquina industrial para la elaboración de queso, mejorando su calidad y sabor.
Es por esos motivos que Natalia solicita un préstamo para compra de una máquina industrial para la elaboración de queso artesanal.
texts.en:
Natalia is a 46-year-old-woman who is married, and the mother of 2 children, ages 18 and 15.  Her work is making artisanal cheese. She is enterprising, happy, and strong, with a fighting spirit. She is also a perfectionist; and she is friendly, sociable, good-natured, responsible, and very hardworking.

She carries out her work in the community of Batallas, which is characterized by the production of excellent cheese, cream cheese, and yogurt, that is produced naturally, using artisanal methods and rigorous quality and hygiene controls. The milk comes from the very same place, and from other places on the Altiplano--the highest grazing land in the world--giving it a unique character. The cheese recipes come from Europe.  

Natalia has tan skin, and she is of medium height with long black hair that she wears braided.  She dresses in the traditional style, with a shawl, a full, layered skirt, and a bowler hat.  Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she uses to communicate within her community and other places on the Altiplano, and she also uses Spanish for business. Her business is the production of dairy products such as yogurt and cream.

She dreams of improving her quality of life and of generating better income, so she wants to purchase an industrial machine for making cheese, improving its quality and flavor. To this end, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of an industrial machine for making artisanal cheese.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial machine for making cheese.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
From Batheay District, Kampong Cham Province, Toch, 61, is an experienced and active farmer. She is a lovely mother of two dependent children and one married child. 

By operating a farming business on a two-hectare plot of farmland, she can earn a decent income to support her family's daily demands.
 
To keep her rice growing well and produce more crops, she wants to use some natural fertilizers on her farmland. Because there is a shortage of money, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers. She also thanks all the lenders for their generous behaviors.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, utilizo el préstamo anterior en mejorar su negocio, adquiriendo lácteos frescos y fortaleciendo la venta de mariscos, tiene nuevos clientes, una mayor demanda, sus ingresos han tenido una mejoría, su familia está en óptimas condiciones y logra cubrir sus diferentes compromisos económico. 
Se ha decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo que le será de ayuda para comprar variedad de mariscos y lácteos, así ofrecerá productos frescos y del gusto de sus clientes, espera seguir teniendo cambios positivos en su entorno.
texts.en:
María used the previous loan to improve her business.  She got fresh dairy products and strengthened her seafood sales.  She has new customers and greater demand.  Her income has improved, and her family has good living conditions.  She is managing to cover her different financial commitments. 

She has decided to request a new loan, which will help her buy a variety of seafood and dairy products.  This way she will offer fresh products that are to her customers’ liking.  She hopes to continue having positive changes in her environment.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seafood and dairy products.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to increase her profit from her business. She was able to provide for her family and has successfully repaid her previous loan, used for farming. She earns well from her investments.

Nida wants to improve her business for she wants to ensure a better and greener farm. She would like to apply for a new loan, this time PHP 15,000, to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm.

In the future, Nida wants to see her business continue flourishing for she desires to improve their financial status. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay micr finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley has a motorcycle transport business in Nakuru town. He is 26 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 1 child. 

He has been in this business for 2 years now and he makes a monthly income of KES 14,000.

He will be using this loan amount, together with his savings, to buy another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a plot.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to be successful and live a better and more prosperous life.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Ndzadze

texts.en:
Ndzadze has operated a retail shop business selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

She comes to you again requesting a loan to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. 
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is 34 years old. She is married with 3 children between 13 and 7 years old, and all of them go to school. 

She has a shop and has been selling for the past 10 years. 

With the loan requested, she would like to buy more sugar, soap, cooking oil, and salt to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy more potatoes and improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, soap, cooking oil, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is a 36-years-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and four children. 

Her husband has been running a small printing press for many years. He also prints advertisement banners and logos on order.

Flex is a sheet of polythene widely used to deliver high-quality digital print for outdoor banners, mainly printed by large color plotters. These prints are used instead of hand-written banners for their low cost and durability.
 
He belongs to a poor family and is the single responsible person for his children and old parents. His parents most of the time remain sick, and he has to spend most of his income upon their cure. 

He wants to grow his business so he can easily generate more income than in the past so he can cherish his children and can bear the medical expenses of his parents.  

Therefore, Asia has requested a Kiva loan so her husband can buy polythene sheets and colors plotters to print more flex. In this way; he can easily generate additional income for his family. 

Asia deserves Kiva support; she hopes that the Kiva lenders will support her. Asia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy polythene sheets and color plotters to print flex.

loans.name: Héctor Antonio

texts.es:
Héctor de 39 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos. Es el presidente de La Asociación de Desarrollo Comunal (ADESCO) de su comunidad, por lo que es conocido por todos sus vecinos como una persona de mucha moral.

Desde pequeño Héctor trabajo como agricultor con sus padres, gracias a ellos tiene la experiencia de hoy en día, los días jueves comercializa ganado, compra animales para engordarlos y luego venderlos a buen precio y siempre lo acompaña su hijo mayor para tome experiencia en el negocio. También trabaja con estructura metálicas, tiene un taller de soldaduras en su casa con el que trabaja eventualmente.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar ganado, es la temporada en que se encuentra a buen precio se puede engordar y posteriormente venderlo para sacarle ganancia, otra parte será utilizada para la elaboración de alimento para sus animales, tiene bastante maíz que necesita ser molido para hacer harina para ganado.

En un futuro Héctor espera que sus hijos se gradúen en la universidad como veterinarios y como agrónomos, construir instalaciones más grandes para sus animales y además criar cerdos.
texts.en:
Héctor is 39 years old, is in a relationship and has 2 children.  He is the president of La Asociación de Desarrollo Comunal (ADESCO) in his community, for which he is known by all of his neighbors as a person with good morals. 

Since he was young, Héctor worked as a farmer with his parents, and thanks to them he has his current experience.  On Thursdays, there is a livestock market, where he buys animals to fatten them and later sell them at a good price.  His oldest son always accompanies him in order to gain experience in the business.  He also works with metals, and has a soldering workshop in his home in which he occasionally works.

The loan will be used to purchase livestock, as it is the season in which he can find them at a good price.  He will then be able to fatten them, and later sell them at a profit.  Another part of the loan will be used to make feed for his for his animals, since he has corn that needs to be milled to make flour for the livestock.

In the future Héctor hopes for his children to graduate university as veterinarians and agronomists. He also hopes to build bigger buildings for his animals and to raise pigs.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and manufacture feed for his animals.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is 26 years old. She is married with 3 children between 9 and 3 years old, and all of them go to school. 

She has a shop and has been running this business for the past 6 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice, biscuits, and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, biscuits, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao is a 54-year-old, married woman. She has three children who she is supporting. She lives in a small village in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business growing rice and selling the crops to local dealers. 

Sao wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is taking out a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

Sao is thankful for the loan granted through Hattha Kaksekar (HKL) with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial es una persona muy luchadora, de 54 años, con una familia maravillosa y vive en San Juan de Lurigancho.
Desde muy joven su padre le enseñó lo que significa el trabajo pesado, no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional porque tenía que apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar. Su éxito en su trabajo desempeñado como Maestro de obras es el resultado de años de esfuerzos y lucha constante, así como la experiencia adquirida a lo largo de su carrera.
Marcial está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un trompo mezclador ya que el que tiene ya está deteriorado y quiere evitar accidentes. Des esta manera, con mayores ingresos obtenidos podrá cumplir el sueño de toda su familia: "Construir el segundo piso de su casa para su comodidad y bienestar".
texts.en:
Marcial is a fighter. He is 54 years old and has a marvelous family with whom he lives in San Juan de Lurigancho. Since he was young his father taught him the meaning of hard work. He could not study to be a professional as he had to help support the family with the household expenses. His success in his work as a Master builder is the result of many years of effort and constant struggle as well as the experience accumulated throughout his career.

Marcial is very grateful to the lenders at KIva as thanks to their support he can buy a cement mixer as the one he has is in poor condition and he wants to avoid accidents. Doing this, with better revenues he can fulfill his family's dream "to construct a second floor on their house for their comfort and well-being".

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer for his construction work.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno operates a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice, and cooking oil. She cites theft and competition as the major challenges in her business. 

Luvuno is requesting Kshs 30,000 to boost business in her kiosk by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
This is Linda. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Linda dreams of improving both her business and their way of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Souroukoukin de la Commune de Koury qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, des Ustensiles de cuisines, Beignet et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe.
Minata est un membre du groupe Danaya, assise à droite, vendeuse d’Ustensiles de cuisines. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter ces Ustensiles de cuisines (marmites, tasses, louches) en aluminium de bonnes  qualités au fur et à mesure qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure à Koury. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Danaya comptent  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 170 000CFA  chacune au cours de ce cycle Mme Minata compte réaliser  200 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The Danaya Group is made of women who live in the Souroukoukin district of Koury Commune. They all know each other well and live within large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. The average age of a group member is 35 and each woman, on average, has at least five children. This group of women sell cooking utensils, fritters and various other items. In order to widen the scope of their activities, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. This will be their fifth group loan. 

Minata, the woman squatting on the right, is a member of the Danaya Group. She plans on using this loan to purchase good-quality aluminium cooking utensils (pots, cups, ladles...) which she will then resell to her various customers. She gets her supplies from Koury.

Whereas the other members of the Danaya Group are planning on making an average profit of 170,000 FCFA over the course of their loan cycles, Minata is planning on earning 200,000 FCFA.

In addition to paying back their loans, they will use part of this revenue to pay for personal expenses and for expanding their business assets.

These women wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that their stock never runs dry.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón, se siente agradecido por las oportunidades de crecimiento que ha tenido con ayuda del préstamo anterior, surtió su negocio con frutas y verduras frescas, sus nuevas ganancias las ha invertido en el pago de sus deudas y en hacer la apertura de una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, la cual está ubicada en su vivienda. Las circunstancias familiares han cambiado positivamente.
Se acercan las fechas de fiestas en su localidad por lo que Ramón se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar frutas, verduras, granos básicos, bebidas, pan, etc., así tendrá todo lo necesario para surtir mejor su inventario.
texts.en:
Ramón feels grateful for the opportunities for growth that he has had with the help of the previous loan. He stocked his business with fresh fruit and vegetables, and he invested his new earnings in paying off his debts and in opening a general store, which is located in his home.  His family's circumstances have changed for the better.

The holiday season is approaching in his area, so Ramón has decided to request a new loan, in order to purchase fruit, vegetables, basic grains, beverages, bread, and such, so that he will have everything that is necessary to better stock his inventory.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables, basic grains, beverages, bread, and such, so that he will have everything that is needed to better stock his inventory.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis, es un joven soltero que vive en casa familiar con su madre y un hermano; para tener ingresos con los que costea sus gastos personales y colaborar con los gastos familiares, se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol, desde hace 10 años trabaja de forma independiente y aprendió el oficio dentro de su familia, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas, con los que prepara el terreno y evitara que las plagas afecten a sus cultivos, su propósito es mejorar la productividad de su negocio, cambiar su situación económica para cancelar su deuda y seguir apoyando a su familia.
Para Luis sus sueños son seguir trabajando en la agricultura, tener recursos económicos para comprarse una propiedad y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis, is a single young man who lives with his mother and a brother. In order to have income to pay for his personal expenses and help with the family expenses, he has grown corn and beans for 10 years. He works on his own, and learned the trade from his family. His work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.

He will invest the loan in buying agricultural materials to prepare the soil and avoid the pests that affect his crops. His goal is to improve his business productivity and change his financial situation so he can pay off his debt and keep supporting his family.   

For Luis, his dream is to keep working and have financial resources to buy property and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to prepare the soil and avoid the pests that affect his crops.

loans.name: Koto-Allama Group

texts.fr:
Koto-Allama est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Kokode la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne42ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 4enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, pièces de pagnes, encensoirs et divers.Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur douzième prêt de groupe. 
Ramata est un membre du groupe Koto-Allama, assise 2ème de droite à Gauche, vendeuse de pièces de pagnes et encensoirs.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter ces pièces de pagnes, encensoirs et divers autres articles en qualité et en quantité au marché qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Koto-Allama comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de130000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle. Mme Ramata compte réaliser  150 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The Koto-Allama Group is made of women who live in the Kokode district of Koutiala. They all know each other well and live within large traditional families with their husbands, children and other parents. The average age of a group member is 42 and each woman, on average, has at least four children. This group of women sell pagne cloth, censers and various other items. In order to widen the scope of their activities, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. This will be their twelfth group loan. 

Ramata, the woman sat second from the left, is a member of the Koto-Allama Group. She plans on using this loan to purchase pagne cloth, censers and various other quality items from the market, which she will then resell to her various customers.

Whereas the other members of the Koto-Allama Group are planning on making an average profit of 130,000 FCFA over the course of their loan cycles, Ramata is planning on earning 150,000 FCFA.

In addition to paying back their loans, they will use part of this revenue to pay for personal expenses and for expanding their business assets.

These women wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that their stock never runs dry.

loans.use: to purchase pagne cloth, censers and various other items

loans.name: Sitoramo

texts.ru:
Ситорамо молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 24 лет. Она проживает в районе Фархор. Фархорский район расположен в долине реки Пяндж, на границе с Афганистаном. Площадь района составляет 1,18 тыс. кв. км., практически весь район расположен в долинной части реки Пяндж. 
Ситорамо живет в районе вместе с мужем, свекровью, сестрой мужа и ее детьми. У Ситорамо и ее мужа пока нету детей, но они очень хотят стать родителями.     
Ситорамо еще с юного возраста занимается торговлей. Она уже продолжает свой бизнес в течение 10 лет. У нее имеется лавка, где она занимается продажей детской одежды. В бизнесе ей помогают муж и золовка. Сейчас Ситорамо хочет обновить ассортимент одежд и привести сезонный товар. Для этой цели она обратилась за кредитом. Таким образом она хочет увеличить доходность своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Sitoramo is a young married woman of 24 who lives in the Farkhor region, which is located in the Pyandzh river valley on the border with Afghanistan. Farkhor makes up 1.18 thousand square km, nearly all of which is located along the valley area of the Pyandzh river. Sitiramo lives in the region along with her husband, her mother-in-law and her husband's sister and her children. She and her husband don't have any children yet, though they very much want to become parents.

Sitoramo has worked in retail since she was young. She has had her business for 10 years already, a shop where she sells children's clothing. Her husband and his sister help her with the business. Now she wants to refresh her assortment of inventory and bring in seasonal merchandise. It is with this goal in mind that she is requesting a loan. In such a way she wants to increase her shop's revenue.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for resale

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto, es una persona que lucha constantemente para salir adelante junto a su familia, es casado, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 28 años de edad; su fuente de ingresos es la siembra de granos básicos, crianza de cerdos y es propietario de una tienda de artículos varios, es una actividad que heredo de sus padres hace ya 10 años, tanto su esposa como su hijo le apoyan en atender su negocio, por lo que no es necesario pagar mano de obra, el horario de labores es de 5:30 a.m. a 2:00 p.m. 
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de 6 qq de abono e insecticidas, dará buen desarrollo al cultivo de maíz y eliminara la maleza, le servirá para mejorar la cosecha y sus condiciones económicas, los riesgos que está inversión representa son las malas condiciones del clima y plagas que afecten el cultivo.
Sus sueños son mantenerse trabajando para generar recursos económicos con los pueda cancelar su deuda, mejorar la alimentación, vestuario y salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Ernesto is a person who constantly fights to get himself and his family ahead.  He is married and lives with his wife and a son who is 28 years old.  

His source of income is farming basic grains and raising pigs. He is also the owner of a store selling various goods, a job he inherited from his parents 10 years ago.  His wife and son help tend to his business so that he does not have to pay for labor; the work schedule is from 5:30 AM to 2:00 PM.

The loan he is requesting he will invest in the purchase of 6 quintals of fertilizer and insecticides, in order to have good corn growth and eliminate undergrowth.  This will help to better his harvest and his financial condition.  The risks that this investment presents are poor climatic conditions and pests that affect the crop.

His dreams are to continue working to generate economic resources with which he can settle his debt and improve the diet, clothes, and health of his family.

loans.use: to purchase 6 quintals of fertilizer and insecticides in order to have good corn growth and eliminate undergrowth.

loans.name: Gabriela Florencia

texts.es: Gabriela Florencia, mayor de edad soltera originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, turística, y por sus hermosas playas, es una microempresaria administradora y propietaria de su propio negocio el cual consiste en un caramanchel(mini pulperia)donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar como: granos básicos, refrescos naturales, gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, detergentes, productos congelados, bolsitas de shampoo, café, medicamentos, entre otros mas al igual que ofrece productos de cosméticos como: lápiz labial, corrector de ojos, cremas de cuerpos, cremas fascilaes, tintes, maquillajes entre otros, sus compras las realiza al contado en esta misma localidad, al igual sus ventas son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, las cuales una parte las realiza de forma ambulante y otras en su domicilio, inicia su negocio con fondos propios al ver la necesidad de poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar, uno de sus mayores sueños es poder terminar de estudiar ya que ella interrumpió sus estudios el cual tenia tercer año de medicina veterinaria pero al ver la necesidad en su hogar decide mejor trabajar y de esa forma ayudar, hoy en día tiene mas de dos años de tener este negocio el cual ha ido creciendo poco  a poco y espera que un futuro no muy lejano pueda ser una gran pulperia y de esa forma tener mejores ingresos, Gabriela se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honrada, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, por lo que esta solicitando un financiamiento para reforzar su capital de trabajo e incrementar su inventario, en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar y en cosmeticos
texts.en: Gabriela Florencia is and adult from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. It is an area that is characterized by its commercial productivity, tourism, and by its beautiful beaches. She is a micro-business woman and owner of her own business. It is a "caramanchel", a mini-store, that offers household consumption products such as basic grains, natural juices, sodas, snacks, detergents, frozen products, shampoo envelopes, coffee, medications and more. She also offers cosmetics such as lipstick, under eye circle minimizer, body cream, facial cream, dyes, and more. She buys her products and pays for them up front in the same town. She also makes her sales in cash from regular and occasional customers. She does some of her sales as a street vendor and others from her home. She started her business with her own funds when she saw the need to help out with the household expenses. One of her biggest dreams is to finish her education because she interrupted her education in her third year of veterinary medicine. There was a need for her to help at home and she decided to work and help in that way. Today she has had her business for two years, which has grown a little year by year. In not so distant the future, she hopes to have a great store and better income. Gabriela is described as being a hardworking woman who is honest, responsible and really eager to get ahead personally. That is why she is asking for a loan to reinforce her working capital and increase her inventory by buying products for household consumption and cosmetics.

loans.use: to reinforce her working capital to increase her inventory of household consumption products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Yele Group

texts.fr:
YELE est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles la vente dans le restaurant à l’image de FANTA qui est la première personne  assise de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités vente dans le restaurant : viande, oignon et riz. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
FANTA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à N’TENTOU, excelle  vente dans le restaurant. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz et une quantité importante de viandes et oignons.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à N’TENTOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir le reste dans son activité vente dans le restaurant.
texts.en:
The Yele Group is affiliated with the Benkadi Association in N'tentou. The women members of this group all know each other through the bonds of family and community. They all live within large traditional families in N'tentou in the sub-prefecture of Ouélessébougou (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).
The average age of a group member is 44. They are all married and each member has at least four children on average. In order to better satisfy their growing customer base, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program four years ago. This will be their seventh group loan.

Each member runs their own business, such as running a restaurant. This is what Fanta, the woman squatting on to the right of the photo, does for a living. She is the president of the group and is very well known throughout N'tentou. She has been doing business for years and her restaurant services are widely sought after. She plans on using this loan to purchase two sacks of rice and a large amount of meat and onions. Fanta gets her supplies from the wholesalers in Bamako. She then sells her food in N'tentou in exchange for cash and credit to both male and female customers.

She plans on making a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, which will allow her to pay back the loan. She will then reinvest the rest back into her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase the ingredients needed to run a restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for labor.

loans.name: Betsy Johny

texts.es:
Betsy, invirtió el préstamo anterior en mejorar el inventario de su negocio con prendas de vestir, joyería y cosméticos, de esta manera sus ventas e ingresos son mucho más estables y mejores, ya cuenta con una empleada para que le ayude a tender su negocio. Su familia tiene un nuevo miembro, tiene un mejor estilo de vida y ha cancelado sus deudas.
En esta oportunidad opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar ropa interior lovable, joyería de acero, enchape plata y bisutería, así cubrirá la demanda de sus clientes, la cual actualmente es mayor, espera recuperar lo invertido en con mejores ganancias para resarcir su deuda.
texts.en: Betsy invested her last loan by increasing her business' inventory with clothing, jewellery and cosmetics. By doing this her sales and income were much more stable and higher. She now has an employee to help her take care of the business. Her family has a new member, has a better lifestyle and she has paid off her debts. At this time she has decided to request a new loan to buy Lovable lingerie, stainless steel, silver-plated and costume jewellery to meet the demand from clients which is now greater. She hopes to recover the investment with better revenues to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy Lovable lingerie, stainless steel, silver-plated and costume jewellery.

loans.name: Enerson Israel

texts.es:
Enerson, es un joven que ya se encuentra acompañado y se esfuerza por cumplir con todas sus responsabilidades, vive con su compañera de vida; con ayuda de su padre aprendió a trabajar en la elaboración de estructuras metálicas, realiza el oficio desde hace 8 años, cuando tiene mucha de manda de sus trabajos contrata ayudantes.
Solicita un financiamiento para comprar hierro, láminas, electrodos, tubos y otros materiales para fabricar puertas y ventanas, le permitirá cumplir con pedidos pendientes y buscar nuevos clientes, de esta manera se mantendrá trabajando y teniendo ingresos para subsistir con su familia.
Sus aspiraciones son tener recursos económicos para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Enerson is a young man who already has a partner and works hard to meet all his responsibilities. He lives with his partner. With his father's help, he learned to work making metal structures. He has been doing this for 8 years. When he has a high demand for his work, he employs assistants.

He is applying for financing in order to buy iron, metal sheets, electrodes, pipes and other materials to make doors and windows. This will allow him to fulfil current orders and find new customers. In this way he will be able to keep working and making income in order for him and  his family to get by.

His aspiration is to have the financial resources to build his own home.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal sheets, electrodes, pipes and other materials to make doors and windows

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 32 years old. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 12 and 4 years, all of whom go to school. 

She has a shop and has been running the business for the past ten years. With this loan, she would like to buy more sugar, salt, biscuits and pens to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used for reinvestment and to improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, biscuits, and pens to sell.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 37 years old. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 17 and 6 years, all of whom go to school. 

She has a shop and has been running the business for 13 years. With the requested loan, she would like to buy more biscuits, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from the business will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy more biscuits, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Hello World! Meet Rebecca. She is a true definition of a strong, spirited, young, dark, Kisii lady from Kenya. At only 32 years old, the single mother of one is a Branch Manager leading the oldest and most established office at Juhudi Kilimo. Passion, respect and integrity are the key values she upholds and that have got her this far. Her achievements have also been catapulted by her impeccable people skills. In the office, she is well-liked and respected.

Rebecca, however, hails from a very humble and traditional background. It is amazing how far she has got herself today. She is from Riabamanyi, a small remote village in the Central Kisii district of Kenya. Most of the people there are smallholder farmers who occupy small plots of land and practice subsistence farming. 

Rebecca grew up fighting so many social and personal battles that only few can relate to. For example, Riabamanyi village has a social codification that invariably colludes with patriarchy to oppress women, through cultural identities that advantage men and disadvantage women. Rebecca was really determined to move against this and to thrive in a community where girls are regarded with less value and not given equal opportunities to succeed. 
In her life’s journey, she has dealt with the pain of losing her mother, an elder brother and an elder sister. The two deceased siblings left behind four orphaned children. Being the only employed member in the family, she took the responsibility of looking after these children. Just recently, Rebecca’s world came crumbling down again after her father became paralyzed. She is grateful to God, however, that she still has him as part of her life. She is doing her best to provide him with the best medication she can afford.  With all these burdens on her shoulders, Rebecca still manages to keep herself together and strive for excellence in life.  

She is seeking a loan of KES 438,100 for higher education. A degree in Business Management will help her to increase her business skills: leadership, interpersonal communication, technology and other valuable hard skills in the business environment.

When Rebecca joined Juhudi Kilimo in 2010 as an Office Assistant, she was still a student. She used her monthly stipend to contribute to the tuition fees for a diploma in Business Management. In no time, she was promoted to become a Business Development Officer. She did a superb job as a BDO which led management to entrust her with more responsibilities of leading a Branch. Joining management has exposed her to a set of new challenges that have enabled her to identify some gaps which she seeks to fill through furthering her studies.

Rebecca says; “My zest is in helping farmers to become more productive and successful. By helping them to improve their enterprise, I am changing their lives. With your loan investment in my education, I promise to use the acquired knowledge and skills to become a better manager and deliver the promise of a better life to our farmers.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 38-years-old married woman.
Her financial situation is not good and she has to think many times before starting any task. 

Now her husband has recently started to drive a moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike and body). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for short distances. Its body is made of polyester which is not strong enough to withstand jerky roads. Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it gets rattled during driving. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for the moto rickshaw but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a moto rickshaw body.

Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan so that her husband can buy a moto rickshaw body and can drive smoothly. 
Shazia thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new moto rickshaw body for her husband.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleada de una tienda de consumos diarios.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. De 30 años de edad soltera originaria del departamento de Suchitepéquez que tiene tres hijos el primero casado y tiene ya su familia, el segundo y tercero estudian en la comunidad donde viven. Ella realiza un impresionante esfuerzo a pesar de su edad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y dice que nunca es demasiado tarde para empezar a desarrollar y tener una visión en el futuro.

La actividad que ella dignamente a desempeñado durante 5 años es la compraventa de abarrotería en la comunidad ya que es por medio de ella puede obtener un ingreso económico para su familia y una ganancia para mejora su condición de vida.

El uso respectivo que pascuala le dará al préstamo que ella solicita es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería para así tener surtida su tienda para no perder la clientela con que ella cuenta.  

Los sueños de ella es que las condiciones de su familia sean las adecuadas para un futuro y es por eso que quiere compra dos molinos de nixtamal y instalarlas en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Life offered her the opportunity to work as an employee in a basic foods store. It was what she wanted, not only an open door but also what was behind the door. And through it she found something that defined what she wanted to be. At 30 years old she is single and a native of Suchitepéquez department. She has 3 children from her first marriage and has her family. The second and third children study in their community.

Pascuala has made an impressive effort in spite of her age. She is an enterprising woman who says it is never too late to start to develop and have a vision for the future. The business that she has been carrying out with dignity for the past 5 years is buying and selling groceries in her community. It is through this that she has generated economic revenue for her family and a profit to improve her living conditions.

The use that Pascuala will give to the loan that she is requesting is to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store so that she won't lose the clients that she has. Her dream is for her family to have decent living conditions for the future and for this she wants to buy two mills for nixtamal (boiled corn) and install them in her community.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Alba Nelis

texts.es:
Alba, opta por solicitar un nuevo financiamiento que le será de ayuda para mantener su negocio de  venta de antojitos, panes con pollo, comida, frutas y verduras funcionando, comprara frutas, verduras, pan, aderezos, bebidas, aceite, gas propano, etc., son la materia prima para negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior a logrado tener nuevos clientes y mantenerlos satisfechos, ya que elabora con mayor calidad sus productos, las ventas y ganancias han incrementado. Alba mantiene el mismo núcleo familiar y cancelo sus deudas.
texts.en: Alba is opting to ask for a new loan, which will be of help to her to maintain her business. She sells snacks, bread with chicken, food, fruit and vegetables. She will purchase fruit, vegetables, bread, seasonings, drinks, oil, propane gas, and more. They are the basic materials for her business. With the previous loan, she has been able to attract and satisfy new clients. Now that she makes products of better quality, sales and earnings have increased. Alba supports the same nuclear family and paid off her debts.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, vegetables, bread, seasonings, drinks, oil, propane gas, and more. They are the basic materials for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman, and she lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has been operating a business selling cereals from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and rice for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 34 years old. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 14 and 5 years, all of whom go to school. 

She sells fruits and has been selling in her business for the past 8 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more bananas, oranges and mangoes to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, oranges and mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida is the age of 43 and the mother of five children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Zahida has requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. He has been selling vegetables for many years, and he sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four-wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop to sell his vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy initial supplies to run his shop correctly. 

The needs of his family have suddenly increased recently and he does not have any other sources of income to cope with these needs. Therefore he decided to expand his current business, and he wants to increase his stock so that he can maximize his vegetable sales every day.

Zahida has therefore requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy an initial stock of seasonal vegatables for his newly established green grocery shop. 

Zahida thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an initial stock of seasonal vegetables for a newly established green grocery shop.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 36 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with 3 children. She has a food stall where she sells french fries. Her current monthly income is 10,000 KES.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of potatoes, cooking oil and tomato sauce. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and also to repay the loan.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.  In the future, she hopes to supply potatoes to various markets in her area.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cooking oil and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Gladys Milagro

texts.es:
Gladys, se ha decidió por un nuevo crédito por los buenos beneficios que estos le ayudan a tener en su negocio, comprara pan (dulce y francés), granos básicos, bebidas, verduras, etc., para elaborar la venta de antojitos, comida y tortillas.
Con la inversión anterior Gladys ha diversificado más su negocio, tiene activa su fuente de ingresos, la familia tiene un mejor nivel de vida y mantiene una buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en: Gladys has decided to ask for a new loan because of the good benefits loans have helped her obtain from her business.  She will  buy bread (sweet and French), basic grains, drinks, and vegetables, etc. to prepare food to sell (snacks and tortillas).  With the previous loan, Gladys has further diversified her business.  She has an active source of income; the family has a higher quality of life and she is maintaining a good credit record.

loans.use: to buy bread (sweet and French), basic grains, drinks, vegetables, etc. to make items for sale (snacks and tortillas)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing nets and pay for his children's expenses.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
The agriculture sector accounts for 45% of Kenya's gross domestic product, generates 70% of Kenya’s export revenue, and employs approximately 70% of Kenyans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Kenya and its economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Kenya remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. 

Meet Salina, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest mother who is 52 years of age! She hails from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of 8 lovely school-going children that she loves and treasures, and she will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. Salina’s primary source of income has been through keeping sheep, selling milk, crop farming and poultry farming. Through these ventures, she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 15 years, and through all these years she has never regretted going into farming. 

Salina sells her vegetables, eggs and milk at the nearby market. Milking and feeding her own cow is the most enjoyable part of farming. She is very thankful that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her to take care of her family and she has always yearned to have more dairy cows. Therefore she is now seeking a loan to buy a good breed of dairy cow. She has already identified the breed of cow that she will buy. The cow will produce between 15-20 liters of milk per day. This breed of cow will be producing milk referred to as “the ideal drinking milk” because it will not lack an adequate amount of fat and will possess desirable quantities of protein. This cow will certainly boost milk production on her farm, which will translate into more sales and better income for her and her family. Because of this higher milk production, she will save more money to fully repay the loan. 

She believes that through careful selection and the application of strict standards in keeping her dairy cow, she will have more income and will be able to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a good breed of dairy cow

loans.name: G.s. Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
EL G.S. Sagrado Corazón de Jesús está conformado por tres integrantes, madres solteras con seis hijos bajo su responsabilidad, todas son originarias de Nagarote lugar que está ubicado en la zona de  occidente de Leon.   Ellas se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas como  la elaboración de venta de tortillas y cuajadas, y la venta de ropa variada. Se caracterizan por ser luchadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente  no pudieron terminar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos, en la actualidad lucha porque como madres quieren proporcionarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, y brindarles estabilidad económica, afectiva, física, para que sean personas de bien.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos como: rubor, sombras, vanidad, delineador, lápiz de ojos, labial, astringentes, body, perfumes, bases liquidas, anti ojeras. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ochos horas diarias ofreciendo su productos de forma ambulante y por encargo a clientes fijos y eventuales.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cosméticos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. G.S. Sagrado Corazón de Jesús agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
G.S. Sagrado Corazón de Jesús is made up of three members. They are single mothers responsible for six children; all members are from Nagarote, which is located in the eastern part of León. They devote themselves to different economic activities, such as making tortillas and cheeses, and selling various types of clothing. They are known to be fighters, to be responsible, and to strive for personal improvement. Unfortunately, they were not able to finish their studies due to lack of funds, and now they fight because, as mothers, they want to give their children a better quality of life; they want to provide them with economic, emotional, and physical stability so that they can be good people. 

Thanks to their desire to move forward in life, they are selling cosmetics such as blush, eye shadow, vanity mirrors, lip liner, eyeliner, lipstick, astringents, body lotion, perfumes, foundation, and eye makeup remover. They work for eight hours each day, offering their products on-the-go to established and new clients. The objective of the loan is to invest in capital and to supply their business by buying and selling cosmetics, so that in the near future they can obtain better earnings.

G.S. Sagrado Corazón de Jesús is thankful for the help of the Kiva loaners, who give loans to people with scarce resources from poor countries like Nicaragua a way to have dignified work.

loans.use: to purchase and sell cosmetics such as blush, eye shadow, vanity mirrors, lip liner, eyeliner, lipstick, astringents, body lotion, perfumes, foundation, and eye makeup remover.

loans.name: Tupendane A Group

texts.en:
Revocatus is married and is a father of two daughters who are at school. He is in his early fifties. He is a doctor by profession, and manages his own medical center (dispensary), providing health services to his community. It's the only heath center around the street, so his patients say that it's helpful. He has had this business for five years now, and operates 24 hours. Revocatus is the only doctor providing all patients with consultation. He has a few nurses and other helpers. He believes his service will be better after some time of owning quality heath equipment. Currently, he is able to realize a good monthly return. 

Revocatus has a longtime relation with Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. This is his 25th credit cycle, which he needs to purchase medicine and drugs for his health center. These are the most needed daily items and need to be plentiful or available anytime. Revocatus keeps on trying his best to serve patients at a low cost, but having small capital and few quality medical equipment and medical helpers are his biggest challenges. 

Revocactus used the previous credits to buy medicine, drugs, medical equipment and to paint his medical center. He has since repaid them back successfully. He used the business return to pay salaries and cover his family expenses. He normally puts the returns back into his center to grow. 

Revocatus will share this loan with his loan group,"Tupendane A," which consist of five members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy medicine and drugs for his health center.

loans.name: Noeurn

texts.en: Noeurn is a 50-year-old married woman with two children, and is a farmer living in the Kampong Speu Province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 2000. Her husband is 41, and is also a farmer. Both of her children are workers. Together, they can earn approximately $9 a day. Now, Noeurn would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work. This loan will help to reduce her family’s transportation expenses. In the future, she is going to have an additional business, and will build a new kitchen and fill the soil around her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary operates a grocery and vegetables stall at the market, selling to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With this Kshs 15,000 loan, Mary wants to buy a variety of vegetables and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale enterprise in the future. She appreciates the support of both Yehu and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
María, continua mejorando su sala de belleza para tener más clientes por lo que se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comparar variedad de cosméticos, medicina natural y variedad de estilos de calzado, así ofrecerá nuevos productos a sus clientes y brindara un mejor servicio.
El financiamiento anterior le ha sido de ayuda para equipar su negocio y satisfacer las exigencias de los clientes, su situación económica es más estable, la familia tiene una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud, también cancelo la deuda con buen record crediticio.
texts.en:
Maria continues improving her beauty salon with the purpose of having more customers. That is the reason why she has decided to request a new loan to buy a variety of cosmetics, footwear and natural medicine. This way she will offer new products to her clients and a better service.

The previous loan has helped her to equip her business and satisfy her clients’ needs. Her financial situation is more stable, and her family now has a better diet, wardrobe and health. She also made her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics, natural medicine and footwear.
