loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 52 years old and married with six children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Margarita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Margarita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merashid

texts.en: Merashid appreciates the support for her previous loan, which helped her to grow and add stock to her business. Here again she comes to you requesting another loan of 40,000 KES to purchase sixteen goats to resell. She thanks Yehu and Kiva at large for the support.

loans.use: to purchase sixteen goats to resell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 46 years old and married with one child is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Dolores has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for three years. Dolores requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Joan. She is a beautiful, diligent Kalenjin farmer who lives in a very remote location called Kapsowar, found in the North Rift region of Kenya. A trip to Kapsowar will offer you views of the Great Rift Valley, escapements that will leave you breathless. A small town along the way called Iten hosts the famous training grounds where tourists come to train along with Kenyan Olympic runners.

Joan, a mother of one, started farming only two years ago. Her farm is still a start-up. Her primary income source comes from the personal businesses she has ventured into.

Her two years as a farmer have exposed her to a lifestyle she wants to maintain forever. She loves milking cows! Feeding cows, however, is still a bit of a challenge for her. She named her cow Birbir.

Joan is seeking a loan to pay for another dairy cow. An additional cow will bring Joan numerous advantages, including keeping Birbir company. She has been able to learn so much in the two years she has been a dairy farmer. She thinks it is now time to focus on dairy farming and scale up the business. 

With your loan, Joan will significantly increase the profits that she is making from the farm. She plans to plough the profits back into the business to fuel growth. The most important impact of the loan to her, though, is that her family will enjoy food security.

loans.use: to pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan, 21, is a striking, young, Kalenjin boy from Kapsowar, a remote location in Kenya. This ambitious bachelor has one goal in life, which is to succeed. He started farming one year ago, and his primary income source has been milk. He is thankful to God that his business has been profitable so far. 

Nathan is seeking a loan to jump start horticulture farming. Land in Kapsowar is very fertile, so the major challenge facing farmers, like Nathan, is usually weed management. In a country characterized by food insecurity, Nathan sees a big opportunity to start a business to grow vegetables and other food crops. He is currently unable to put up the money to get the horticulture farm going because of the high farm-input costs. For that reason, he is counting on your consideration to make his dream come true. 

With your loan, Nathan will realize his dream and contribute in a small way towards the fight for food security in Kenya.

loans.use: to start a horticulture farm.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Leila   de 24 años de edad soltera  y madre de  2 hijos, leila  tiene una pequeño negocio de ventas de productos de belleza   ya hace unos  3 año. Leila,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijos sean profesionales,    En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su negocio   (cosméticos)   Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez leila  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada.   Se le distingue por su chompa de color rojo es la primera de la mano derecha,   Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Leila is 24 years old, single, and mother to 2 children. Leila has had a small business selling beauty products for the past 3 years. Leila has gained loyal clients, which has provided her with earnings to cover household expenses and to help her children to move forward in life. Her big dream is that her children will be professionals. 

In the future, she would like to have her own store where she can sell her products and earn a better income. With the granted loan, she will invest in the purchase of more products for her business (cosmetics); this way she will continue to satisfy her clients' needs and will be able to move forward.

Leila and all the members are thankful to Kiva for the loan granted, and for the trust that has been given. Leila is shown in her red sweater, and is the first member of the right hand side. She leaves you with the promise to carry out all her proposed goals.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is a 37-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been sewing dolls for the past several years to support her family. She beautifully sews dolls at home and then sells them in the local market. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband also works in a factory but earns insufficient income to support his family alone.

Farzana is the mother of six children and is motivated to provide all facilities to her family. To cope with increasing demand, she has requested a loan to purchase stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, buttons and pearls of various colors. She hopes to increase her earnings through her large sales. She is in her third loan cycle and has an excellent repayment record. She wishes to utilize a portion of her revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

Farzana thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, buttons and pearls of various colors

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 44 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jennifer has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Jennifer aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 25 years old and lives in Nyahururu town, where he has a motorcycle transport business. He also sells cereals in the area and this has been profitable. He is married to Mary and together they have been blessed with two children.

Gabriel will use this loan to service his motorcycle so it will be in good condition. He will also buy more stock of cereals to sell and thereby earn more income. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a farm.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future he hopes to buy more assets, be successful and live a happy life with his family.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle and to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Sokun is a 44-year-old married woman. She has two children whom she is supporting, and she also has three married children. She lives in a small village in he province of Banteay Meanchey, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to local dealers. So far, she has been in this career for 21 years with an average income of USD 3.00 a day.

Sokun wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, wood and propane gas.

loans.name: Zulkada

texts.ru:
Зулкада 50-летний пекарь из района Фархор. Она живет там со своей большой семьей -  с мужем, тремя сыновьями, двумя невестками и внуками. Муж и сыновья в настоящий момент находятся на заработках в другой стране. 
Зулкада деятельная женщина. Она у себя во дворе дома имеет пекарню, где занимается производством таджикских лепешек для продажи. Оба невесток помогают ей в деятельности. Этот их семейный бизнес существует уже два года. Сейчас для продолжения деятельности Зулкада должна закупить партию муки и угля. Из-за нехватки финансов, она обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Zulkada is a 50-year-old baker from the Farkhor region of Tajikistan.  She lives there with her rather large family: her husband, three sons, two daughters-in-law and her grandchildren.  Her husband and sons are currently abroad as migrant workers.  Zulkada herself is rarely idle; she runs a bakery out of her home, baking and selling Tajikistani flatbread for a living.  Both of Zulkada's daughters-in-law help her run the bakery, which is in its second year of operation.  At the moment, Zulkada needs to stock up on flour and charcoal to keep her bakery up and running; to that end, she's seeking a loan, and is counting on your support.

loans.use: buy flour and charcoal for baking and selling flatbread

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, madre de un hijo de 1 año y su negocio es la producción de queso.
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora, fuerte, alegre, feliz, buena madre, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la comunidad Chiarpata que se caracteriza porque cada 24 de junio, los comunarios y Residentes de Chiarpata celebran la Festividad de San Juan con la tradicional entrada de danzas autóctonas y folklóricas de la zona.
Elizabeth es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, estatura mediana, su forma de vestir es típica (manta pollera y sombrero) y su lengua materna es el aymara, utiliza el español para el comercio. Su negocio es la producción de queso y derivados lácteos como el yogurt y la crema de leche, también se dedica a la ganadería, realizando la cría de ganado lechero para la producción quesera.
Ella sueña en mejorar su calidad de vida para darle un mejor futuro a su pequeño hijo, su deseo es mejorar su negocio realizando la compra de vacas lecheras para incrementar su producción y generar mejores ingresos económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Elizabeth, solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero y con los beneficios darle un futuro mejor a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 25-year-old single mother with a 1-year-old son.Her business is cheese-making.

She is enterprising, determined, strong, cheerful, happy, a good mother, responsible and very hard-working. She works in Chiarpata community, which is characterized by the traditional arrival of the region's local folk dances every June 24 when the community members and residents of Chiarpata celebrate the festival of San Juan.

Elizabeth has a dark complexion, long black braided hair and is of medium height. Her dress is typical (full, gathered skirt, poncho and hat) and her mother tongue is Aymara. She uses Spanish for commerce. 

Her business is the production of cheese and dairy products such as yoghurt and cream. She also farms, raising dairy cattle for cheese production.

She dreams of improving her quality of life to give her young son a better future. Her desire is to improve her business by buying dairy cows to increase production and generate more income.

It is for these reasons that Elizabeth is applying for a loan to buy dairy cattle and thus provide a better future for her young son.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle and, with the resulting income, provide a better future for her young son.

loans.name: Madafu Group

texts.en:
Bhoke is married and a mother of four children. She is in her late thirties and since last year, Bhoke has had a food business called mamalishe, where she serves breakfast and lunch foods. She cooks tea with chapati, donuts and ugali, rice with meat, beans and vegetables. She starts working from 05am to 09pm daily and is able to make a fair return. 

This will be her first credit request via Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy ingredients for her cooking business. Bhoke desires to build a house for her family. She will share this loan with her loan group, Madafu, which totals two women. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her cooking business.

loans.name: Sumini

texts.en: Sumini lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of one additional family member. She operates a shop at the market on retail basis. She has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of soda, rice, maize flour, bags of sugar, cartons of salt, soap, and cooking oil. She has been in this business for three years. She works in the shop seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters. She is aspiring to buy a delivery van to help with transportation. She resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap, cooking oil, crates of soda, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un joven soltero de 21 años con muchas ansias de salir adelante, trabaja como Operario de Construcción en su ciudad natal, Santiago. Con mucho esfuerzo y gracias al apoyo de sus padres está estudiando la carrera de Farmacia. Juan es consciente que trabajar y estudiar es un gran desafío, pero asume este reto con mucho entusiasmo porque quiere brindarle mayores oportunidades a su familia.
Juan está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales como cemento, arena, entre otros para poder reforzar las paredes de su casa, de esta manera su familia vivirá de manera más cómoda y segura ante cualquier temblor que pueda ocurrir. Gracias a esto Juan seguirá esforzándose para seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a young, single man of 21 years old, with a big desire of getting ahead. He works in constructions at his birth-town, Santiago.

With a lot of effort and with the support of his parents, he is studying a career in Pharmacy. Juan is aware that working and studying is a big challenge, but he takes it with a lot of enthusiasm because he wants to give his family more opportunities. 

Juan is grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support, he will be able to buy materials, like cement, sand and others to reinforce the walls of his house. This way his family will be more comfortable and feel safer in case of an earthquake. 

Juan will keep making a big effort to keep improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials to reinforce the walls of his house.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleada de una tienda de consumos diarios.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. De 53 años de edad soltera originaria del departamento de Suchitepéquez que tiene tres hijos el primero es casado y tiene familia aparte y los dos últimos son estudian en la comunidad donde viven. Ella realiza un impresionante esfuerzo a pesar de su edad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y dice que nunca es demasiado tarde para empezar a desarrollar y tener una visión en el futuro.

La actividad que ella dignamente a desempeñado durante 5 años es la compraventa de abarrotería en la comunidad ya que es por medio de ella puede obtener un ingreso económico para su familia y una ganancia para mejora su condición de vida.

El uso respectivo que Rosa le dará al préstamo que ella solicita es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería para así tener surtida su tienda para no perder la clientela con que ella cuenta.  

Los sueños de ella es que las condiciones de su familia sean las adecuadas para un futuro y dar estudios a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales en la vida y que ellos mejoren las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Life gave her an opportunity to work as an employee in a grocery store, and it was what she had hoped for, as it was not just an open door; there was something beyond that door, and when she found it, she knew what she wanted to be.  

She is 53 and single, and she comes from the department of Suchitepéquez. She has three children. The first is married and has a family, and the two younger ones attend school where they live.

She makes an impressive effort in spite of her age, and she is an enterprising woman.  She says that it is never too late to begin to develop and to have a vision for the future. 

The activity that she has carried out honorably for the past 5 years is buying and selling groceries in the community, as it is by this means that she is able to earn an income to support her family and improve their quality of life.

Rosa will use the loan that she is requesting for the purchase of merchandise for her grocery store. This way, she will have her store stocked, so that she will not lose any of her clientele.

Her dreams are that her family may have a decent standard of living in the future, and that she may provide her children with an education, so that they can become professionals in life and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Chanthin

texts.en: Chanthin is a 30-year-old single woman and garment-factory worker. She has been a garment-factory worker since 2011. She lives with her parents in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Chanthin can earn approximately $5 a day. Now she would like to request a loan to buy rice to resell. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to expand her business and fill the soil around her house and build fences.

loans.use: to buy rice to resell.

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en: To have additional income, Arleen runs a small retail store within her village. She is 30 years old and blessed with two children. Together with her husband, they are aspiring for a happy and successful life to give their children a better life. She aims to improve her store and increase her income but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to obtain a loan of PHP5,000.00 to buy assorted candies, biscuits, laundry soaps, eggs, noodles, dried fish, canned goods, beverages and seasonings to resell. She believes that this loan will be a great help for her to improve her retail store.

loans.use: to buy assorted candies, biscuits, laundry soaps, eggs, noodles, dried fish, canned goods, beverages and seasonings to resell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is married and has three children. She helps her husband operate their own farm for a living. She earns better income from their farm and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for their farm. It is their main source of income and she had to improve it in order to become prosperous. Now, she is taking a new loan to purchase organic liquid fertilizer. She is hopeful to improve her farm produce to save more for the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic liquid fertilizer.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of a 3-year-old daughter from Iloilo, Philippines. Myrna is engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than five years now.
 
Myrna is among those who were affected when a super typhoon hit the country several months ago. Their fishing boat was totally damaged, thus preventing her husband from going back to fishing. As of now, she is asking for a loan worth PHP30000 to pay for the repair of the fishing boat and to buy a new boat engine. Through this, her husband will be able to go back to fishing and augment his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Myrna hopes of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her fishing boat and to buy a new boat engine.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Merly works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Merly is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell, to earn enough money to cover the expenses of his family.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is a 58-year-old widowed farmer with three children living in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1999. Two of her children are garment factory workers and another is a construction worker. Together, they can earn approximately $15 a day. 

Now, Ly would like to request a loan to buy a motor vehicle with a trailer for her son to carry water for sale in the nearby villages. This loan will help her family have an additional business and earn more income. 

In the future, she is going to build a new house with fences around it.

loans.use: to buy a motor vehicle with a trailer for her son to carry water for sale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is grateful that she was previously granted 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase a greater quantity and variety of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Through her earnings she is able to provide for her family's daily personal and household needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries items, school supplies, ink and soft drinks. The more varied items displayed at her store will give customers more choice and will mean more sales and earnings for her store.  She ithanks God in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Teresita aims to expand her store so it will yield more sales. She dreams of living a peaceful and happy life with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, school supplies and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda is a mother who owns and manages a small variety store within the local community. She is 36 years old and blessed with four children attending school. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband want to continue sending their children to school so that they will be employed someday. In this regard, she wants to further improve her store to increase her income. Having insufficient capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more snack food, laundry soap, seasonings, beverages, eggs, noodles, canned goods and vegetables to resell. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack food, laundry soap, seasonings, beverages, eggs, noodles, canned goods and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha has operated a Khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of a lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas for resale.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Juan de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta 7° grado de educación básica, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y ambos han procreado una hija que tiene 4 años de edad que depende totalmente de él, también vive acompañado de sus suegra y su cuñada, pero no dependen de Juan.

Juan tiene 4 años trabajando como motorista desde las 4:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm manejando una moto taxi, al ser una persona emprendedora y ver los problemas de transporte de su comunidad y que mucha gente caminaba grandes distancias para llegar a sus destinos, compro el vehículo y presto su servicio de viajes. También trabaja con su madre y su hermana en una panadería que poseen.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar otro permiso que le permita trabajar todos los días con su vehículo, ya que el que posee solo le permite trabajar día por medio.

Las proyecciones de Juan son, tener su propia empresa de transporte de moto taxis y que la panadería rinda mayores frutos para así darle el estudio completo a su hija.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old, he studied until the 7th grade of basic education and is in a relationship. His partner works looking after the household and between them they have a 4 year old daughter, who is totally dependent on him. His mother in law and sister in law also live with them, but are not dependent on Juan.

Juan has been working as a driver for 4 years, driving a moto taxi from 4am until 7pm. As an entrepreneurial person, he saw the transport problems in his community and that many people were walking great distances to reach their destination. He bought the vehicle and provided his travel service. He also works with his mother and his sister in a bakery that they own.

The loan will be used to buy another permit that will allow him to work with his vehicle every day, as he only has a permit to work every other day.

Juan’s future plans are to have his own moto taxi transport business, and for the bakery to produce better results, to be able to give his daughter a full education.

loans.use: to buy a work permit.

loans.name: Rubylen

texts.en: Rubylen is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Iloilo, Philippines. She has had a fishing business with her husband for more than four years now. This is the source of their income. Last year, a super typhoon hit the country and ruined thousands of houses and businesses, including Rubylen's. She is applying for a loan to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets, lead weights, propeller, hooks and other supplies. Rubylen is optimistic that this loan can help them in improving their fishing venture.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets, lead weights, propeller, hooks and other supplies

loans.name: Mak

texts.en:
Mak is a 51-year-old and married woman .She has two children who are currently in school and she also has two married children. She lives in a small village of Battambang Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been in this career for 24 years with an average income of USD 5.00 a day.

Mak wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
This is Jennelyn. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan is also useful in the education of her child. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. As a single parent, she is working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jennelyn hopes to make income from other possible business opportunities. She also desires to renovate and extend their house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business, like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52 years old, married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with 2 children. She sells nets and seat covers as well as curtains. She has been in this business for 5 years and she makes a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of curtains, tablecloths and fabric nets to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and repay the loan. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, and in the future she hopes to be successful in her business and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wall and window curtains, tablecloths and fabric nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building a room in her house.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
Una oportunidad era lo que el esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que el quería ser. De 42 años de edad casado originaria del departamento de Suchitepéquez que tiene cinco hijos el primero es casado y tiene familia aparte y los cuatro últimos son estudian en la comunidad donde viven. El realiza un impresionante esfuerzo a pesar de su edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y dice que nunca es demasiado tarde para empezar a desarrollar y tener una visión en el futuro.

La actividad que el dignamente a desempeñado durante 3 años es la compraventa de abarrotería en la comunidad ya que es por medio de ella puede obtener un ingreso económico para su familia y una ganancia para mejora su condición de vida.

El uso respectivo que Pascual le dará al préstamo que el solicita es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería para así tener surtida su tienda para no perder la clientela con que ella cuenta.  

Los sueños de el es que las condiciones de su familia sean las adecuadas para un futuro y dar estudios a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales en la vida y que ellos mejoren las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
An opportunity was what he hoped for.  It was not only an open door, but also what was behind the door.  What he found was something that defined what he wanted to be.

He is 42 years old and married.  He is from the Suchitepéquez department.  He has five children. The first one is married and has his own family.  The last four go to the school in the community where they live.  He makes an impressive effort, in spite of his age.  He is an enterprising man.  He says that it is never too late to start to develop and have a vision for the future.

His business activity, which has respectfully engaged in for three years, is buying and selling groceries in the community.  It is through this that he is able to get income for his family and earnings to improve their living conditions.

Pascual will use the requested loan to buy groceries in order to have his store stocked and to not lose the customers that he has.

His dreams are for his family’s living conditions to be adequate in the future and to give his children an education so that they become professionals and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is married with four children, and three of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells used shoes at the market on a retail basis 6 days a week, and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes.  

Harriet also generates additional income from roasting maize. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to own a fully stocked stall of used shoes. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used shoes

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 34 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 12 and 18 years, and all of them go to school. She sells clothes, buckets and cups, and has been running the business for the past 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more dresses, shirts, cups and shorts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more dresses, shirts, cups and shorts for sale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
HELLO LENDERS! Meet Caroline, a very hardworking, energetic and young farmer. Caroline resides in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming activities. Caroline has been doing mixed farming for the past two years and through those years she has gathered so much experience with the techniques of farming. Through the income from farming she has been able to take care of her family and also provide the basic needs for her parents. Caroline is a very enterprising woman, and although she never got formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her family of a decent meal. The Kapsowar area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. 

Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Caroline feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Caroline is very disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits she will be able to improve her living conditions and also secure the future of her children to come.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Olga Mabel

texts.es: Doña Olga tiene 42 años de edad quien tiene un grado de estudio de primaria completa la cual se encuentra casada siendo su esposo caficultor y dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace varios años con quien tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian y su hija mayor quien ya está casada y en hogar a parte. Doña Olga se dedica al cultivo de café junto a su esposo porque en la zona esta es la única actividad que genera ingresos económicos para dar el sustento a su familia al igual que a las familias vecinas. En dicha actividad también se involucran sus hijos cuando están de vacaciones ya que ellos estudian. La propiedad que ellos en familia trabajan está ubicada frente a su casa de habitacion. Los planes que tiene a futuro es mejorar y ampliar su propiedad, apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y que ellos puedan también tener su propia parcela de tierra en la cual si ellos deciden hacer carrera en el trabajo de campo que tengan como defenderse en un futuro y dar a sus familias un buen patrimonio. Ella solicita apoyo económico el cual utilizara para la compra de fertilizantes y para pago de mano de obra para darle el mantenimiento adecuado a la plantación de café manifestando que el financiamiento será de gran ayuda porque así la propiedad finca estará bien asistida, la cosecha será mejor y las ganancias serán mayores al vender el café.
texts.en: Olga is 42 years old and completed the first grade of elementary school. She is married and her husband has been a coffee farmer for some years. She and her husband have 3 children, 2 of whom are in school and their oldest daughter is already married and has her own home. Olga works as a coffee farmer alongside her husband because this is the only economic activity in the area with which to sustain a family at the same level as one's neighbors. Her children are also involved in this work when they are on vacation from school. The property that the family farms is located in front of their house. Her plans for the future are to improve and increase their land, to support her children in their studies, and that they will each have their own land that they can work if they decided to follow careers in farming so they can build their futures and give their families a good base. She is requesting economic support to use to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor so that she can care properly for her coffee crops. The loan will be a great help because, with it, the farm will be well tended, the harvest will be better, and the income from selling the coffee will be greater.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor to assist with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Dalys

texts.es: Dalys de 50 años de edad,  se dedica a dos tipos de negocios, por un lado a  la venta de productos de tocador y de aseo personal, y por otro lado  elabora comidas. Sus negocios iniciaron hace 2 años por iniciativa de una amiga suya, quien como directora comercial  de productos,  mediante catálogos, le explicó  todos los procedimientos, para que se entusiasmara en esa tarea y obtuviera ingresos, ganado el 35% por la venta de los artículos.  Dalys decidida empezó a promover productos de belleza, ropa interior, y agregó como actividad secundaria la venta de comidas, aprovechando el conocimiento que el mercado tenia de ella. Hoy sus ventas las realiza a crédito y de contado y así mismo compra, para venderle a vecinos, amigos, referidos, pues su meta es lograr el crecimiento de su clientela y apoyo a su hijo que se encuentra sin empleo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará vestuarios, champú, colonias, artículos de aseo personal, con lo cual incrementará su oferta a los clientes y tendrá un fondo de efectivo, para invertir y  aprovechar ofertas e impactar su mercado, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión que mejora su negocio.
texts.en: 50 year old Dalys runs two types of businesses. On the one hand, she sells toiletries and, on the other hand, she makes food to sell. She began her businesses two years ago on the suggestion of a friend who is a commercial director for a business selling products from catalogues and explained how everything works. She is enthusiastic about the task and can earn 35% of the price of the products she sells. Dalys decided to start promoting beauty products and underwear and added a second business selling food, taking advantage of her market knowledge. Today, she sells on credit and for cash and she also buys in these ways. She sells to her neighbors and friends and people they refer to her, and her goal is to increase her customer base and help her son, who is currently unemployed. Currently, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she will use the loan to buy clothes, shampoo, perfumes, and toiletries that will enable her to offer her customers more and that will give her some capital to invest and take advantage of offers. Her Kiva loan is an investment in improving her business.

loans.use: to by clothes, shampoos, perfumes, and toiletries

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon, 19, is a young smallholder farmer based in Kapsowar. Kapsowar lies in the North Rift region of Kenya that is characterized by good weather and rolling hills. Agriculture is the thriving economic activity in the area. Philemon ventured into farming one year ago. His primary income source is crops.
Philemon enjoys his farming business mostly because it profitable. He spends a lot of time looking after animals. He is seeking a loan of KES 20,000 for expanding his horticulture farm. By scaling up the business, he will relatively reduce production costs and increase output. He is a very young farmer who is set out to achieve big things in his life. 
 
With your loan investment, Philemon will grow successful. His strategy is to use the returns from the investment to pay for farm inputs, which is a major problem that leads to the closing up of many farms due to poor quantity and quality of yields. If he makes a surplus, he plans to plough the profits back into the business since his lifestyle is not so demanding. As Juhudi Kilimo, we are behind Philemon because his business interest is aligned to our mission of bringing food security to our country.

loans.use: to pay for the expansion of his horticultural farm.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto de 28 años de edad, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ambos han procreado 2 hijas, una de 4 años de edad y la menor de mes y medio. Con Roberto viven su pareja y sus hijas, y dependen por completo de él.

Roberto se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, maneja un pick up con el que recorre grandes distancias para vender su producto. Con esfuerzo compro su vehículo y también lo busca para realizar viajes de grandes distancias.De lunes a sábado junto con sus padres, se levanta a las 2:00 am, viaja cerca de dos horas hasta llegar al lugar donde compra su mercadería, después de recorrer las calles vendiendo su producto regresa a su casa hasta en la noche.

El préstamo será utilizado para reparación de su vehículo, ya que es su fuente de trabajo e ingresos debe estar en buenas condiciones por lo que necesita comprar un repuesto y un par de neumáticos.

Roberto se proyecta que con esfuerzo comprará otro vehículo, ya que a veces no alcanza a satisfacer la demanda de viajes que le piden, con ello dará trabajo a otro motorista y mejoraran los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
28 year old Roberto is in a relationship and his partner works as domestic staff in someone's home. Together, they have 2 daughters, one who is 4 years old and the little one is a month and a half old. Roberto's partner and daughters live with him and are completely dependent on him. 
Roberto works selling fruit and vegetables. He drives a pickup in which he goes long distances to sell his produce. Thanks to his efforts, he was able to buy the vehicle and he travels long distances in it. From Monday to Saturday, along with his parents, he gets up at 2:00am, travels for about 2 hours to the place where he buys his produce, then drives through the streets selling the produce and returning home at night. 
He will use the loan to repair his vehicle. As it is his source of work and income, it has to be in good condition and he needs to buy spare parts and a pair of tires. 
Roberto predicts that, with effort, he will be able to buy another vehicle. He needs this because, at times, he is not able to make all the deliveries that he is asked for. With another vehicle, he could give work to another driver and improve his income for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Oudomrith

texts.en: Oudomrith is 21 years old, a trainee security guard, and also a student at a university. He lives with his parents in Takeo province, Cambodia. He can make $4 a day. Because of a lack of financial support, Oudomrith would like to request a loan to pay for his third-year tuition fee. This loan will help him to go on to his third year at the university. In the future, he wants to become a bank staff member and build a new house.

loans.use: to pay for his third-year tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to care for her orange crops.

loans.name: Maria Stefany

texts.es:
Maria es una joven entusiasta madre de familia de 22 años, vive en Huaraz junto a su familia.
Por iniciativa propia aprendió sobre el negocio de los salones de belleza, desde cortes de cabello hasta maquillaje, pintado de cabello, manicure, entre otros y es así que brinda estos servicios y tiene bastantes clientes. Maria cree que le va bien porque su servicio es de excelente calidad y siempre está a la vanguardia de la moda en cuanto a los peinados.
Maria está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar tintes y algunos accesorios para poder seguir brindando su servicio y así atraer más clientes, de esta manera seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder tener un local propio y sacar adelante a su familia y brindarle una educación de calidad a su hijo
texts.en:
Maria, age 22, is an enthusiastic young mother. She lives with her family in Huaraz. Through her own initiative, she was able to learn about the beauty salon business. This includes everything from haircuts to makeup, hair coloring, manicures, and other services. Maria offers her services to her substantial number of customers. She believes that she is doing well because her service is of excellent quality and she is always up-to-date on the latest hairstyling trends.

Maria is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the support they have offered. She will be able to buy dyes and a few accessories, which will enable her to continue providing her services and to attract more customers. As a result, she can continue to push forward so that she can have her own location. Her family will be able to get ahead and she can provide a quality education for her child.

loans.use: to buy dyes and a few accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is single and has three children, two of whom go to school. She has additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal.

She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and operational costs. She is aspiring to expand her business. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she was able to purchase products for her direct selling business. The loan is also useful in the education of her children. Her income from the loan assisted with their everyday expenditures at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 11,000 PHP loan. It will be used to buy additional supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nenita hopes that her business will continue to become successful and she also wants to have and manage her own shop for additional merchandise. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and merchandise, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Leap is 31 years old, a farmer, and a married woman with two children living in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 2003. Her husband is 31 years old. He buys recyclable things and resells them for profit. One of her children is a student. Together, they can earn approximately $10 daily. 

Now Leap would like to request a loan to buy a pump to use in her farming. This loan will help her reduce the expense of renting a pump. In the future, she is going to expand her farming, renovate her house, and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a pump to use in her farming

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is grateful for a prior loan for Php 30,000, which she used to buy items needed in her business, because the income she earned allowed her to support her family and meet daily basic needs. She is requesting a new Php 30,000 loan which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in her store the more she sells and the more she earns. She is sure that her earnings from her store will help meet her basic needs and pay for her children's schooling. She thanks God and her lenders in advance for any financial help she receives. 

In the future, Jovita hopes to open another store and give her family a decent life.  She faithfully meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study religion, build social capital, and repay mucrofinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for items needed in her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a farmer in Nakuru town and has been in the farming business for 15 years now. She grows cash crops such as maize and also does dairy farming. She is 49 years old, married and together with her spouse has been blessed with four children. Her spouse does provide additional income for the support of the family.

She will use this loan to buy dairy cows and thereby increase her milk production and supply. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

In the future Joyce hopes to be successful in her farming business and live a good life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for reselling.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Una oportunidad era lo que el esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que el quería ser. De 36 años de edad casado originaria del departamento de Suchitepéquez que tiene cinco hijos el primero es casado y tiene familia aparte y los cuatro últimos son estudian en la comunidad donde viven. El realiza un impresionante esfuerzo a pesar de su edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y dice que nunca es demasiado tarde para empezar a desarrollar y tener una visión en el futuro.

La actividad que el dignamente a desempeñado durante 8 años es la compraventa de abarrotería en la comunidad ya que es por medio de ella puede obtener un ingreso económico para su familia y una ganancia para mejora su condición de vida.

El uso respectivo que Cristobal le dará al préstamo que el solicita es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería para así tener surtida su tienda para no perder la clientela con que el cuenta para así tener mejores ingresos económicos.  

Los sueños de el es que las condiciones de su familia sean las adecuadas para un futuro y dar estudios a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales en la vida y que ellos mejoren sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
An opportunity was what he was waiting for, and not just an open door, but rather the thing that lay behind the door. And what he found was something that determined what he wanted to be. Cristobal is 36 years old and comes from the Suchitepéquez province. He is married and has five children, the eldest of whom is married and has his own family, and the other four study in the local area where they live. Regardless of his age, Cristobal makes a huge effort and is a very enterprising man. He believes that it's never too late to start developing and looking towards the future. 

The work that he has respectably carried out for 8 years is selling groceries in his community in order to earn an income for his family and make a profit to improve his living conditions. 

Cristobal will use the loan that he has requested to buy merchandise for his grocery store to keep it well-stocked so he doesn't lose the customers he counts on to make a better income. 

One of his dreams is that his family's conditions are fit for the future and his other dream is to enable his children to study enough to become professionals and in turn improve their own living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grocery store merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise and sell them to earn money that will help him in improving the living conditions of his family.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Her name is Wilma. She is grateful that she was granted a Php50000 loan which she used to purchase computer parts and accessories needed in her computer shop. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. On the side she also does direct selling of branded personal products. 
 
She would like to apply for another Php30000 loan, which she will use to buy orders of Avon, Natasha, MSE beauty, cleaning and undergarments. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods from dealers for quality and convenience. Wilma is positive that she will have good returns on her investment.

Wilma aims to have more branches for her internet shop and have more customers for her direct selling business. She desires also to share her blessings to her less fortunate relatives. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for personal products like cosmetics and undergarments to resell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 23 years old; she is married with one child aged 2 years. She has been selling sorghum for 10 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be use to buy land for farming.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violate is 24 years old and married, with one child, aged 3 months. She has been selling from a shop for three years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more salt, sugar, and rice. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more salt, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Hamoud

texts.en:
Hamoud is a 44-years-old married man and a father of three children. His oldest child is 13 years old and the youngest one is 3 years old. Hamoud lives with his family in their own house in Taiz,Yemen. He is an uneducated but very vigorous man. 

A long time ago, Hamoud purchased a piece of land and built a few rooms, a small kitchen, and a small bath on that land. Due to the miserable condition which the family crosses in, Hamoud couldn't complete all the building of the house. He strives strongly to finish all the building of the house. Now, Hamoud and his family lives in that a small and uncompleted house. The family can't afford this condition. 

He wants to expand and complete the building of his house. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do that. As a result, Hamoud is requesting a loan of 88,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials as cement, wood, and bricks in order to expand and complete the building of his house.

Hamoud's dream in the future is building more of one floor and renovating them. He hopes to open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, wood, and bricks in order to expand and complete the building of his house.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, who lives in Kampala,Uganda, is a single mother of six children, five of whom go to school. She has additional family members. Helen has her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food. 

Helen has been selling sweet bananas at the market seven days a week for six years. Her major business challenges include perishability of bananas, seasonality and transportation. Helen has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of sweet bananas, and aspires to eventually purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy bunches of sweet bananas

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 37 years old and has a business selling clothes in Nakuru town. She is married, and she and her spouse have been blessed with 3 children. Her spouse does provide additional income for the support of the family.

This is Naomi's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and she will use this loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell and also to open a stall for selling them. She will use the anticipated profits to service her loan.

In future, Naomi hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 41 years old and runs a quarrying business in Nakuru town which supplies building blocks and stones to various construction sites. He is married and the father of six children. Peter will use this loan to buy more quarrying tools and also to hire more quarry workers. He will use the profits he expects to earn to educate his children. This will be his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya, and he has paid previous loans successfully. In the future, Peter hopes to start a rental housing project.

loans.use: to buy tools and hire workers.

loans.name: María Isidra

texts.es:
María de 60 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ahora está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 7 hijos que viven con ella.


María tiene experiencia en la agricultura desde hace aproximadamente 40 años, ella siembra con su esposo y sus hijos en un terreno propio, ya que este trabajo ha sido su medio de sustento durante años.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abono y veneno para aplicar a su milpa y a la siembra de frijol.

Su sueño es tener fuerzas para seguir trabajando y sacar buenas ganancias cuando vendan parte de la cosecha.
texts.en:
María is 60 years old and did not have the opportunity to study. She is now married and her husband works in agriculture. They have seven children who live with them.

María has approximately 40 years of farming experience. She works along with her husband and their children on their own land. This work has enabled them to support themselves over the years.

María needs a loan in orer to buy fertilizers, compost, and poisons that she can use for her cornfield and the crop of beans that she will plant. Her dream is to have the strength to keep working so that she can earn a good income when the time comes to sell part of her harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and poisons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food and soft drinks for his small shop, in order to be able to meet all the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en:
Gurgen, 65 years old, lives in Dilijan with his wife.  For many years he worked at the Dilijan excursion agency, as the city is a very popular tourist site.  He now works for the municipality. 

Gurgen is a very active person, but lately has been feeling weak and in some pain. He is therefore requesting this loan in order to undergo a medical examination to diagnose his illness and, if necessary, undergo treatment.

loans.use: to seek a diagnosis and possible treatment for his medical problems.

loans.name: Batisha

texts.en: Batisha wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which she used to purchase more materials for her handicrafts, allowing her to increase her income and continue her work. As she was very satisfied with the process and the results and has continued in her line of work, she is requesting another loan in order to purchase more materials to continue to expand and improve her business. She wants to thank all of the lenders for the support and opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to continue to expand and improve her business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Her name is Rosalinda.  She is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
She would like now to apply for a PHP16,000 loan  which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She is positive that the more items displayed at her store will increase her sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income will definitely sustain their everyday expenses and the school needs of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Rosalinda hopes to expand her store in the near future. She dreams to give her children the best education possible and for them to have a bright future.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sweden

texts.en:
Sweden is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of two children, aged 10 and 5. She lives with her family in Iloilo, Philippines. Sweden has engaged in fishing business with her husband for more than two years now. This is their source of income.  

Sweden and her husband strive to make a living after a super typhoon ravaged their place and ruined their fishing materials including their fishing boats. As of now, Sweden is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the fishing boat and to buy more stocks for her store like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, and toiletries. Sweden believes that this loan could help her and husband improve their way of living. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat and to buy more stocks for her store like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Oeurn, 34 years old, is a lovely mother of six dependent children. She lives in a small community of Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a fish seller in a village of her community. Her husband, Khan, is a motorcycle taxi driver. The total earning that this couple can make is around USD 10.00 a day.

Oeurn is lacking money to use as a capital investment for her business now. Thus, to continue her business, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy fish to re-sell to her customers. She hopes that this loan can ensure the stability of her business.

She would like to thank all the lenders for their financial support of poor people.

loans.use: to buy fish to re-sell to her customers.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: This is Susanna, who is 23 years old and lives in the town of Spitak with her parents. Her mother is a housewife and her father works at the local school as a wrestling trainer. Susanna studies at the nearby Economical University, where she is going to get master’s degree in Banking. She is also studying Stock Market Analysis at the same university, and will graduate this year. While she is doing this, she simultaneously works at a local bank as a senior specialist. She is a very clever and intelligent person who always busy with self-development. She is requesting this loan to buy a computer and professional literature which will greatly help her prepare for her graduation exam and write her thesis.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature.

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik lives in Sevan City which is in Gegharkunik region. He is 57 years old. He is married and his two children are already married; they live abroad with their families. Rubik happily lives in his native city with his wife. He has a higher pedagogical education and for many years till now, he has worked at a school as a teacher of physics. Rubik is a specialist of really high quality and he does his work with great patience and devotion.

Rubik will be very happy to receive this loan in the amount of 500,000 Armenian drams  in order to buy a computer, a scanner, and a printer which he needs to make his lessons more informative.

loans.use: to buy a computer, a scanner, and a printer

loans.name: Monique

texts.en: Monique, 28 years old, has been operating a retail shop for three years. With this loan, she would like to buy more biscuits, cooking oil and sugar for resale. She will use her profits to improve her welfare.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits, cooking oil and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine, aged 39 years, is married with three children aged between 3 and 12. Two of them go to school. She has been selling household use items for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more milk powder, sugar and cooking oil for sale. The profit from business will be used to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy more milk powder, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Angela Rosa

texts.es: Doña angela de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa y por los buenos precios con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Doña Ángela está solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, leche, huevos, golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, etc. para obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Angela is 62 years old, and she lives in her own house with her family. She owns a general store locate in her house, and she has been running it for many years. She can count on many customers thanks to the wide variety and the fair prices of the products she sells. Thanks to the income she earns she succeeds in paying for some of her household expenses. Angela is requesting a loan to buy soup, milk, eggs, sweets, soft drinks and basic grains in order to improve her income and grant her family a better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase soup, milk, eggs, sweets, soft drinks, and basic grains

loans.name: Chn

texts.en:
Chn,44 years old,  lives in a village of Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three dependent children and one married child. To make a living and support her family, she and her husband manage and operate a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. The daily profit for her house is USD 10.00 a day. So far, this couple has been in this career for eleven years.

Currently, Chn wants to have a motorbike to use in her house. Because there is not enough money, she would like to request her second KIVA loan to buy a motorbike. She would like to thank all the lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy has a pharmacy in Nyahururu town and has been running it for two years now. She is 24 years old and a single mother of one child. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of medicines to sell. These include both tablets and syrups. She will use the anticipated profits to open another pharmacy.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to open a wholesale pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy more stock of medicine to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 35 years old and married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with two children. She has rental houses and has been in this business for six years. Her spouse is employed and he does provide additional income for supporting the family. 

She will use this loan to buy building materials for repairing the rental houses so they can be in good condition and also attract more tenants. She will use the anticipated profits to service her loan.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to be successful and live a good life  with her family.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing rental houses.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 31 years old and married to Tom and together they have been blessed with 3 children. She has a food stall in Nakuru town. She sells different kinds of meals to her customers and has been in this business for 5 years.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of baking flour, cooking flour, beans, and rice. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in the future she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, cooking flour, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Hanidina

texts.en:
Her name is Hanidina. She is grateful  that she was granted a PHP 20,000 loan which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
She would like to apply for a PHP 16,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. More items displayed at the store will mean more sales and thus increase her earnings. She is positive that this will greatly help meet their everyday and school needs of her children.

Hanidina hopes to be able to expand her store in the future. She dreams to live a peaceful life and give her family a better future.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Meri

texts.en: Meri is the mother of six children (four sons and two daughters) and divorced so she is fully responsible for the care and education of her family. She is 36 years old and lives with her children in the city of Vedi in Armenia's Ararat region. The only income she receives is from farming. She rents a plot of land on which she cultivates tomatoes that she sells at the city's wholesale market. Meri says that her devotion and love for her children is infinite, but her lack of money causes so many difficulties and problems that she occasionally loses hope and the belief that she will manage to overcome her problems. She is requesting a loan for her son, who we see in the photo and who has very serious health problems. He urgently needs liver surgery, and only with the help of this loan can Meri can pay for it.

loans.use: to pay for her son's liver surgery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
Denise is 36 years old, she is married with 4 children between the ages of 7 and 16, with all of them attending school.  She has been a tailor for 6 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell.  The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes de 55 años de edad, está casado y su esposa se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos a quienes ha sacado adelante junto a su esposa.

Mercedes tiene más de 40 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, lo aprendió gracias a su padre desde muy pequeño, y ahora dicho trabajo le ha servido como sustento diario para él y su familia.

Él necesita mucho de este crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para la temporada productiva, y de esa forma tener  mayor control de plagas y abundantes cosechas para el consumo.

Su sueño es contar con buena salud para seguir cultivando, que sus hijos sean grandes personas y que nunca les falte lo necesario.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 55 years old and married. His wife works in agriculture. He has four children, so he and his wife want to enable them to get ahead.

Mercedes has more than 40 years of farming experience. He learned the trade from his father at a very young age. Now this type of work allows him to provide for his daily needs and those of his family.

He is in great need of a loan so that he can buy farming supplies for the productive season. As a result, he will have greater control over pests and achieve an abundant harvest for consumption. His dream is to be in good health so that he can continue farming. In addition, he would like to see his children become successful people who are not lacking whatever they need.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica, who lives in Kampala, Uganda, is a married mother of five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. The family lives in a rented house, and they have access to electricity but not piped water. Monica's monthly expenses include rent and food.

For six years, Monica has been selling used clothes at the market on a retail basis, and earns additional income from tailoring. Working seven days a week, her major business challenges include seasonality. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes.  Monica aspires to own a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with two children, with 1 of them attending school.  She has no additional family members.  She rents a house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food. 

For 5 years, Rose has operated a cafe in a rented shop, selling her goods on a retail basis.  She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy sugar, donuts, cakes, biscuits, sweets and soda.  She works seven days a week.  Her major business challenge is fluctuating commodity prices.  She aspires to buy a better fridge and a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy sugar, donuts, cakes, biscuits, sweets, and soda.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne has a food stall in Nakuru town where she sell fried potatoes. She has been in this business for six years now and it has been profitable. Anne also sells second-hand clothes. She is 46 years old, married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with eight children. She also supports three members of her family.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of potatoes and tomato sauce. She will also buy more clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and service the loan.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to grow her business and be successful.
