loans.use: To buy potatoes and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is 44 years old and he lives in the city of Kapan of Syunik region. Without having higher education, Ara manages to sustain his family needs by working as a driver. He has been doing this for many years. Using his own car, he gives taxi and cargo services at very convenient prices, which is why he has a lot of regular customers during the years. 

Ara would like to remind that this will be his second deal with Kiva, and he hopes that it will be as successful as the first one. Ara is married and he has two children. Besides his driver’s occupation, now Ara has a small business; during spring and autumn months at the rented stall, he sells fruits and vegetables in the city wholesale market.

Ara asks for this loan because he wants to buy new assortments of fruits and vegetables, and he also must do some repair works on his car.

loans.use: to buy new assortments of fruits and vegetables and to do some repair work on his car.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem, age 38, is a married woman.  She has been involved in the business of selling rice for a period of about seven years.  She counts a good client list and earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.  She has four children. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase stock of good quality rice. It will allow her to meet the demands of her customers on time. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her eighth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase stock of good quality rice.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is the age of 31; she is living with her four children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been selling fruits and vegetables for many years. He uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling. As a hawker he can easily travel near to the people. The people like to buy fruits at their doors instead of going to the market. Due to the fruits' freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for fruits has increased and by noon he has run out of stock.

Farzana feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for the family. Farzana is receiving a loan for her husband so that he can buy fruits in more quantity and an equilibrium scale to weigh. 

Farzana wants to save the excess profit amount so that she can utilize these savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal fruits for her husband's business.

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en:
Winifred is aged 35 years and is married with five children aged between 4 and 15, and all of them go to school. 

She has been selling vegetables for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more items such as tomatoes,onions, and culottes for sale. The profit from the business will be used to buy a modern cow.

loans.use: To buy more items such as tomatoes, culottes, and onions for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 32-year-old married woman. She is involved in the business of manufacturing ladies’ shoes with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They have been doing it together for the past seven years. She also beautifully designs buckles for the embellishment of shoes. By this time, they have attained a regular list of customers and make enough to contribute to the family income. 

She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase threads, soles, leather, plastic soles, and beads. It will help them to meet market demand consistently.

loans.use: to purchase threads, soles, leather, plastic soles, and beads.

loans.name: Mega

texts.en:
Mega lives in Kampala,Uganda. She is married with one child.  She has no additional family members. She operates a beauty salon at the market. She has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from Kiva partner MCDT-SACCO to buy braids, weaves, hair relaxers, treatments and oils.  

She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenge is power shortages. She aspires to buy a plot of land.  She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy weaves, braids, hair relaxers, treatments and oils.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is married and the mother of four children, and earns a living by selling clothing at the local market to neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is the seasonal nature of her business, which can be very slow at certain times of the year. She is requesting a loan to buy a bale of clothing to resell. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Sweta Swarna

texts.en:
Young Sweta Swarna is 22 years old and lives with her parents in Bhubaneswar, the capital city of Odisha state, India.

She is in the finance profession and wants to continue improving herself professionally, to achieve many goals in her life.

Sweta Swarna describes herself as a persistent person, capable of focusing on her life goals, fighting to achieve them, and keeping herself consistent. She is also proactive and tries to take a step forward and take on more and more responsibility to be able to solve problems that appear these days. She also believes that she is a young woman with initiative since she likes to stand out in her professional and academic work.

Her motivation to continue studying is to increase her knowledge in different areas such as banking, administration, marketing, and business to apply it to her work and, in the future, to her own business.

She wants to contribute to her country's development, serving as an example to other young people so that they have the desire to improve themselves and fight for their dreams and goals where they can apply their various professional skills.

For Sweta Swarna, the ability to offer support for the education of all the young people means a great opportunity that no one should let pass by.

For her plans, Sweta Swarna wants personal happiness, considering God as the centre of her life and of her future family. She also wants to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to pay the course fee for banking and administration studies

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina is 44 years old and the mother of four children. She went into the business of selling cloth because her husband’s income was not enough to meet her family's basic needs. Over the years, her business flourished and now she has a strong customer base and is famous in her area for good-quality cloth. Zarina has requested her fifth loan, for 40,000 PKR, to buy more cloth in different varieties and colors. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy cloth in different varieties and colors.

loans.name: Husan

texts.en:
Husan is a 50-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her son’s fruit selling business. He owns a fruit selling business in a nearby fruit market. With the increase in the household expenses, she wants to grow the business also.

Therefore, Husan has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner Brac Pakistan so that her son will be able to buy fresh fruit. She wants to save the profit amount so that she can face any sudden incidents or for medical treatment for her children.

Husan hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon. Husan is very thankful to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits to resell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 33 years old. She is married with four children, aged between 5 and 15, and all of them go to school. She has been selling fruit for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fruit for resale. 	The profits from the business will be used to grow her savings.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for resale.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is 42 years old and he lives in Kapan City of Syunik region. He has a higher education and he graduated Yerevan State Architectural Institute. From 1997 till now he has worked at the State Architectural Institute of Kapan branch in the Mathematics Chair. Aram is also a candidate. He is married and he has two nice daughters; the elder is a student at the medical university and the smaller is still school-aged. 

Aram’s wife is also a pedagogue. She works at the school as a teacher of English Language and Literature. Aram’s wife at this moment feels a little bit weak and unhealthy about which Aram and his daughters are very worried. 

This loan is very important for Aram and his family. It will be used for the medical examination and for the expected course of treatment for his beloved wife.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical examination and for the expected treatment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cattle, vitamins, and animal feed

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 54-year-old hard working woman. She has 5 children. She has been providing the service of stitching in her locality for many years. She is quite popular for her skill of stitching. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. In her 4th loan cycle, Amina has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread, laces, and buttons. She is very thankful for her previous loans and hopes that this loan will generate a healthy source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, laces, and buttons.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 26-year-old married woman and mother of two children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; recently she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 45 year old, married woman. 

The man shown in the photo is Abida’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Abida has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to purchase some auto spare parts and tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Abida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase some auto spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en: Kubra has successfully built her business selling cloth with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Over time she attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase a new variety of cloth in different colors and designs. It will help her to inflate her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase new variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida has successfully built her business sewing clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Over time she has become famous in her town and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads along with the packs of needles, ribbons, and buttons. In this way she will be able to stitch up more dresses and to earn maximum profits.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of needles, ribbons, and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of medicine to be able to meet all the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en: Kubra is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business of flower making for the last one year. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events like birthdays, parties etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies in the local market.  She is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy raw material such as fabric, glace papers, floral tapes, shiny papers, and packs of paints in various colors. In this way she would be able to meet with the increasing demands of her customers consistently. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as fabric, glace papers, floral tapes, shiny papers, and packs of paints in various colors.

loans.name: Priyanka

texts.en:
Priyanka is a young, 24-year-old girl. She is a permanent resident of a small city of Odisha called Choudhwar, but she lives in Bhubaneswar to pursue higher education. She wants to make her career in the banking sector, so she took admission in a one-year Post Graduate Diploma in Banking after completion of her graduation. Her father is a farmer engaged in paddy and vegetable cultivation. His income is very low so it was difficult for him to manage a huge course fee for Priyanka's banking course.

Getting a job in the banking sector is a dream of Priyanka's, so she does not want to miss this opportunity and for this she applied for a loan through People's Forum to pay for her Banking diploma course fee. Priyanka is very happy with this loan and thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this great support.

loans.use: to pay for her Banking diploma course fee.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita hails from Dhupguri.  She is 28 years old, and is a married housewife.  She and her husband Rabindranath together are raising two children (one son and one daughter). They live in the small village of West Magurmari in the Jalpaiguri district in their small mud house.

Dynamic and hard-working, Sabita's husband is running a business of growing seasonal vegetables.  Though a housewife, Sabita helps her husband in every way and especially at the time of sowing seeds and harvesting. They sell their products to the local markets. Due to the seasonal nature of his job, his income is unsteady and insufficient for the family's household.  With the addition of cultivation of paddy, he will not only be able to increase his monthly income but also add to its reliability because paddy is all-season crop and has a high demand in the market.  They are looking for a loan to purchase necessary agricultural supplies.

In order to help her husband, Sabita has applied for a loan from Kiva partner BJS.  She wants to use the loan to purchase good quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to start cultivation. The loan will help Sabita keep her family afloat and stable financially. She dreams to construct a better and decent concrete house for them.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for their financial help.

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es:
La señora Gilda trabaja en el marcado desde hace 20 años. Su trabajo lo viene realizando con sus padres, y ahora que sus padres ya son mayores es ella sola la que está trabajando.
Vende mate (bebida típica paraguaya) con yuyos y, para el desayuno café o cocido con leche para la gente que trabaja desde la 01:00 de la madrugada en el mercado. Es una mujer muy sacrificada que quiere ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para poder seguir con su venta de mate y con la venta de desayunos.
texts.en:
Sra. Gilda has been working at the market for 20 years. She had been working with her parents, but now that they are older, she is working alone.

Gilda sells beverages such as “mate con yuyos” (a traditional Paraguayan drink), breakfast coffee, or “cocido” (a bitter herbal drink). She begins her work at the market at 1:00 A.M. Gilda is a self-sacrificing woman who wants to help her family and loved ones.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy various supplies so that she can continue selling “mate” and breakfast items.

loans.use: to buy various supplies for her business of selling beverages.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children; three of them go to school. She has additional family members. She has her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees.

Hajara sells green bananas and has been in this business for eight years. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. She gets additional income from rental houses.

Hajara's major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to increase her sales, to out-compete her competitors, and also to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children and both her children go to school. She also cares for additional family members. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market. She operates her business on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 3 years and works six days a week. She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings of 300,000 to buy onions, cabbages, cassava, fresh beans, cow peas and sweet potatoes. Her business challenge includes transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expense includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy fresh beans, onions, cabbages, cow peas, and sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Rosario De Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora Rosario es una socia amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito Mujeres Triunfadoras desde hace 10 años, le gusta su grupo por que entre todas se esfuerzan y se ayudan para sacar adelante sus familias, es un grupo unido y alegre. Vive por el Centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se caracteriza por ser de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gente es muy cálida, su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraño. 
La Señora Rosario tiene 42 años de edad, está divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 22, 18 y 13 años, su primer hijo se estudia en la universidad, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija está en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Rosario labora de domingo a domingo como empleada privada, este trabajo le permite tener la solvencia económica para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la comprar de útiles escolares, libros y uniformes para el ingreso a clases de sus hijos. Su meta es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
Rosario is friendly and kind. She has been a member of the community bank Mujeres Triunfadoras for 10 years. She likes the group because everyone encourages and helps one another to get their families ahead. The group is united and happy.

She lives near the city center of Cuenca, a city known for its cold climate. It has architectural and natural beauty, with warm people whose varied cuisine captivates the palate of locals and foreigners.

Rosario is 42 years old, divorced, and has three children aged 22, 18, and 13. Her eldest son studies at the university, her second son is in high school, and her young daughter attends a small school in the city. She does not own her own home, but rents instead.

Rosario works every day of the week as a private employee. Her work allows her to have the financial stability to give her children a better future. The money from this loan will be used to buy school supplies, books, and uniforms for her children’s return to classes. Her dream is to own a bazaar.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, books, and uniforms.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 45 years old and married to Ann. Together they have been blessed with four children. He runs a quarrying business in Nakuru town which has been profitable. 

He will be using this loan to buy more land for quarrying. This will enable him to supply more building blocks and make more profit as well. He will use the expected profits to educate his children.

This is his sixth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he repaid his previous loans successfully. In future he hopes to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more land for quarrying.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María desde hace 2 años forma parte del grupo de crédito Mujeres Triunfadoras,  los créditos le permite mejorar sus negocios. Vive por los alrededores de ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que se caracteriza por ser de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gente es muy cálida, su variedad en la gastronomía que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraño. 
Doña María tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 17, 16 y 11 años, todos sus hijos se encuentran estudiando en el colegio, su esposo es propietario de un local de venta de motos, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros.
La Señora María se dedica al comercio, vende ropa americana recorriendo toda la ciudad, también labora medio tiempo como empleada privada, estos trabajos son los que le permiten ser independiente y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su crédito va a invertir en la comprar de ropa. Su meta es tener un almacén para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
María has been a member of the "Mujeres Triunfadoras" communal bank for two years and the loans have helped her to improve her business. The members live around the city of Cuenca, a city that is characterized by a cold climate and beautiful architectural and natural beauty. The people are warm and the variety of foods captivates the taste of both locals and visitors.

María is 35 years old, married and from this union has three children aged 17, 16 and 11 years old. all of them study at school. Her husband is the owner of a business selling motorcycles. She doesn't have a house of her own so they live in the house of her in-laws.

María works in business, selling American clothing going through the whole city. She also works half time as a private employee. These jobs allow her to be independent and get her children ahead. She will use this loan to buy clothing. Her goal is to have a store to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar has successfully built her business of tailoring with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Over time she attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 6th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of laces, zippers, needles, and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads along with packs of laces, zippers, needles, and buttons.

loans.name: Jose Matilde

texts.es:
José de 72 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo, es ya mayor de edad y tiene su propio hogar. Vive con su esposa que se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José tiene 20 años de trabajar como panificador, inicio trabajando como ayudante, al aprender bien el oficio y ver que daba buenos frutos decidió poner un negocio propio. Hoy en día, se levanta a diario a las 5:00 am a elaborar el pan que luego sale a vender en su vehículo, una vez lo vende todo regresa a su casa, por lo general cerca de las 10:00 am.

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales para la panadería azúcar, bandejas, harina, huevos, levadura, etc. debido a que el negocio está creciendo, además piensa contratar personal para agilizar la preparación y venta del producto.

José se proyecta tener una gran panadería, y trabajar también por encargos, para tener ingresos económicos seguros y disfrutar su vejez al lado de su esposa.
texts.en:
José is 72 years old, he is married and he has an adult son who lives in his own house. José lives with his wife who is a housewife.

José has been working as a baker for 20 years; he started as an apprentice, and seeing that he was good at learning the job and that things were going well he decided to start an activity of his own.

Nowadays, he gets up at 5:00 am to make bread and he then goes about to sell it with his vehicle. Once he has sold it all he gets back home, and generally around 10 am.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy ingredients and supplies for his bakery such as sugar, trays, flour, eggs, yeast; as his activity is growing he is also planning on hiring personnel in order to speed up the making and selling of his product.

José plans on owing a big bakery as well as on accepting orders, in order to earn a steady income ad to enjoy his retirement together with his wife.

loans.use: To buy sugar, trays, flour, eggs, yeast and to hire personnel.

loans.name: Fehmida

texts.en: Fehmida is 41 years old, married and the mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Fehmida’s husband who is in the business of selling sanitary material. He earns a good amount of income to bear their household expenses. In order to meet with the increasing demand of the customers, he needs to purchase good quality tiles, tubs and sinks. For this reason Fehmida has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. In this way her husband will be able to increase his sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase good quality tiles, tubs and sinks.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 51-year-old lady, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities for her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her son has been driving a moto rickshaw from several years, but his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her son would be able to buy a new body for the moto rickshaw. She hopes that now she can make enough savings to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new body for a moto rickshaw.

loans.name: Sandhya

texts.en:
Sandhya is a 26-year-old housewife from the small village of Kalirhat in Jalpaiguri district. She lives with her husband Manik and two little kids in a small mud house.

Sandhya’s husband is a farmer. He works on their own agricultural land, growing different kinds of vegetables and making an earning for their family of four.  As the income is scant, it is far from enough to meet all the household expenses.  So, they are seeking financial help to cultivate a crop to create a sustainable income source that will see her children through school and higher studies.  They have decided to cultivate paddy on their farmland, which is a profitable business.

Sandhya is requesting a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, etc. to be able to have a better quality of harvest, which will earn good revenue.  
Sandhya aspires to acquire more lands with the profit. She says thanks to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase good quality paddy seeds and other necessary agricultural supplies for cultivating paddy.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is a 30-year-old woman from Dhupguri. She is staying with her husband Bhadreshwar and one little daughter. They live in the remote village of Purba Magurmari of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. 

Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. He is engaged in vegetable cultivation, especially potatoes and many other different kinds of vegetables. Sumitra is a housewife who manages the household activities and in her spare time helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Now they decided to cultivate paddy in their field, as it’s a very in-demand crop in West Bengal. So, they hope to earn good profit from this cultivation. 

Sumitra requested a loan from Kiva partner BJS to purchase standard-quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She has a very good relationship with her customers, because she supplies her products on time to her customers for a cheaper rate.

She hopes to build a house for her family, and so she is very grateful to Kiva and BJS for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es casado y tiene 6 hijos, toda la familia vive en la comunidad de Avichaca en una casa de adobe  que es de su propiedad y no tiene ningun defecto Juan es agricultor y quiere comprar una motobomba para el riego de sus sembradios, adicionalmente trabaja como albañil en su comunidad, Juan no tiene quien le colabore, es la unica persona que pone dinero al hogar por eso quiere su ayuda
texts.en:
Juan is married and has six children. His entire family resides in the community of Avichaca. They live in an adobe house with no defects, which he also owns.

Juan is a farmer and he wants to buy a motorized water pump for the irrigation of his fields. He also works as a bricklayer in his community. Juan has no one helping him and he is the only breadwinner in his household. Therefore, he is in need of assistance.

loans.use: to buy a motorized water pump for irrigating his fields.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 41-year-old hard working woman. She has four children. She has been providing the service of stitching in her locality. She is quite popular for her skill of stitching. Rehana’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. In her sixth loan cycle, Rehana has requested for a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine along with spools of thread and buttons in different colors. Rehana is very thankful for her previous loans and hopes that this loan will further diminish her family’s financial problems

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, spools of thread and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is a 27-year-old housewife who lives in the small town of Dhupguri, West Bengal in her own house. She is married to Niren. Both Pratima and her husband are illiterate, and can only sign their names. They are blessed with two little daughters who are too young for school.

Pratima is a housewife and her husband is a cycle-van puller. He carries loads and people on his cycle van and earns income for the family. A cycle van is a kind of carriage that is pulled using a bicycle and is widely used in rural areas by the regional people. Niren's income is low and it is difficult to maintain the family. Therefore, he thought to purchase another cycle van and rent the old one, so that his income will be more.

Pratima came to know about BJS (a Kiva partner) and has taken a loan to purchase a cycle van for her husband. Now they hope to have a better income than previous. Their future dream is to strengthen their family economy and send their children to renowned schools to become professionals.

Her full thanks go to BJS as well as Kiva for giving the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for carrying goods and people.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36 years old and married. She sells clothes in Nakuru town and it has been profitable. Her spouse does provide additional income and together they have been blessed with 3 children. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of clothes for selling. These include sweaters, shirts, blouses, and dresses. She will use the anticipated profits to boost her poultry project.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. In the future she hopes to finish the construction of her rental houses and provide a good future for her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes for selling.

loans.name: Emith Glomer

texts.es: Emith habita al sur occidente de la ciudad,  con su cónyuge y es padre de 3 hijos en las edades de 4 a 9 años.  El es un empleado de vigilancia en una empresa de Barranquilla, que decidió aprovechar las necesidades de sus compañeros de trabajo,  para ofrecer variedades de artículos de acuerdo a pedidos que estos requerían. Poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y hoy está necesitando más capital de trabajo para invertir, en tanto a que sus ventas las realiza  a crédito y debe esperar recuperar el dinero,  para responder a su clientela. Esta es  la razón por la cual ha acudido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará camisueter y calzado,  con el fin de tener más variedad y de incrementar sus utilidades.  Su meta es lograr el crecimiento de su negocio y hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda, para tener un mayor bienestar.
texts.en: Emith lives in the southwestern area of his town with his wife and their 3 children aged from 4 to 9. He works as security guard for a company in Barranquilla, and he decided to satisfy the necessities of his co-workers by offering g them a variety of products according to their needs. His activity has been growing little by little, and he nowadays needs to invest more money to meet his customers’ requests, as he sells on credit and has to wait in order to get the money back. For this reason, he has decided to ask for a loan; this is the first loan he has requested to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he will use it to buy polo shirts and shoes in order to offer a wider variety of products and to increase his earnings. His goals are to succeed in making his activity grow, and to make some improvements to his house in order to enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy polo shirts and shoes.

loans.name: Rasna

texts.en:
Rasna is a 34-year-old mother of four children. She lives with her husband and children in a small village of Dhupguri, in rural West Bengal. She studied only up to grade four. She is an energetic, enthusiastic lady who always tries to generate more income for the wellbeing of her family. All of her children go to school except one, who is too young.  

Rasna’s husband drives a cycle-van as a transportation service in the village in order to make a living. It is a kind of cycle-operated transport, which is used in rural West Bengal to carry loads and people to other villages and local markets. He has been operating this business for many years to earn income for the family. Now their children are growing older, so the cost of the family is also increasing. Thus, Rahim decided to expand his business to generate more income for the family. 

Rasna decided to help her husband thus: she is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a new cycle-van to be used for expansion of her husband's business. She hopes this loan amount will provide more income, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to bear the educational expenses of her children.

Rasna and her husband are very much happy after getting the loan and thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Berta Veraly

texts.es: Berta es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta de desinfectantes su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa, pero también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, Berta vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella solicita un crédito para comprar más productos por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Berta is a hardworking and responsible woman. For the last few years she has made a living by selling disinfectants. Her business is located in her home, but she also sells in an itinerant fashion in the various neighborhoods near her home. Berta lives with her husband and their four children. She is asking for a loan to buy more products wholesale to keep up with her sales and to have greater financial stability without any limits for her family.

loans.use: to buy disinfectants wholesale

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana de 48 años de edad posee un negocio de productos varios como: ropa, granos básicos, productos de uso personal, etc. desde hace varios años ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Ana es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo y su madre, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor y asi seguir con sus ventas y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana of 48 years old has a store with different products, like: clothing, staple grains, products of personal use, and others. For many years it has been located at her place of residence. With what she gets from her sales, she manages to pay some of the household expenses.

Ana is a single mother living in a house of her own along with her son and her mother. She is requesting this loan to buy wholesale products so she can continue with her sales, and provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale products.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Don Teodoro de 61 años de edad es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, desde hace algunos años decidió poner una tienda en su lugar de residencia la cual le ha generado buenas ganancias hasta el día de hoy, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa, vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, don Teodoro esta solicitando un crédito para la compra  de mas mercadería como: huevos, granos básicos, café, aceite, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en: Teodoro is 61 years old and is a very hardworking and responsible man. A few years ago he decided to open a store in his home, and it has generated good earnings for him so far. He has a large customer base due to the variety of products he sells. He lives in a house he owns with his family. Teodoro is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise like eggs, basic grains, coffee, oil, candy, drinks, etc. so he and his family will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy eggs, basic grains, coffee, oil, candy, drinks etc.

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is a 39-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband owns a clothing business. His practice is to buy clothing from a wholesaler and sell it to the retailers. He has lot of customers who like to buy clothing from him; sometimes he purchases clothing from out of the city at a low cost and sells it to the retailers. He has a good reputation in the market and his current customers refer his clothing to the other retailers which becomes good advertising. One of her sons also helps her husband in the clothing business; both give part of their time to the shop. 

Asiya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy more clothing of various colors and designs to fulfill the demand. She is in a repeated loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. She has already been taking the loan from BRAC and investing in the business. Asiya hopes that the savings will much increase so she can arrange the marriage ceremony for her daughter. 

Asiya dreams of the bright future of her children, the establishment of their business, and a better living standard for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing of various colors and designs

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 59 años de edad, es soltero, estudio hasta 5° grado de educación básica debido a que sus padres no tenían la capacidad económica para darle un estudio completo. 

Carlos desde pequeño y con sus padres trabajo como agricultor, todos los días se levanta a las 5:00 am a trabajar en su cultivo de maíz hasta la 1:00 pm, también trabaja en parcelas ajenas prestando su mano de obra y como vigilante de una planta procesadora de basura que inauguraron recientemente.

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de insumos agrícolas, tales como semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y herbicidas, todo esto para la siembras de 7,000 mts cuadrados de frijol, con ello pretende recuperarse de las pérdidas que le dejo la reciente cosecha de maíz debido la poca cantidad de lluvia.

Carlos se planea diversificar la producción, no solo depender de granos básicos, sino, también cultivar hortalizas y frutas.
texts.en:
Carlos, 59 years old and single, studied through 5th grade in school since his parents didn't have the financial ability to provide him a complete education.
Even when he was a small boy, Carlos worked with his parents as a farmer.  Every day he gets up at 5 AM to work at caring for his corn crop until 1 PM.  he also works in fields neighboring his own providing labor,  and he works as a guard at a garbage processing plant that opened recently.

The loan will be used to buy farm supplies such as seeds, pesticides and herbicides, all this for sowing 7,000 square meters of beans.  Carlos intends to recover from losses sustained in the recent corn harvest due to scarcity of rain.  Carlos plans to diversify his farming, not just to depend on basic grains but also to grow vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and herbicides for planting beans

loans.name: Getu

texts.en: Getu is married with three children and all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market. She has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy tomatoes, sweet potatoes, cassava, green bananas and onions. She sells to all categories of people seven days a week. Her business challenges include defaulters and seasonality. She is aspiring to get a permanent business premise. She resides in the family house which has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy banana fingers, cassava, onions, sweet potatoes, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Edis Yojana

texts.es: Edis  con su anterior credikiva compró un congelador fortaleciendo su capital de trabajo, por una mayor liquidez y mejorando su infraestructura.  Sus ingresos familiares fueron favorecidos con nuevos ingresos y por eso dice a sus financiadores: Muchos agradecimientos, sigan apoyándome, para seguir progresando. “ Hoy esta aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará sillas, mesas, insumos como panes aceite, lácteos, cárnicos, etc) Con esta inversión aprovechará aun mas su ubicación comercial sector de gran afluencia de transeúntes y vehículos, lo cual potencializa su éxito.
texts.en: Edis used her previous loan to buy a freezer, to consolidate her working capital through a better liquidity and to improve her infrastructure. The increased income has benefited her family’s economy, and for this reason she tells her lenders “Thank you very much, please keep on supporting me so that I can keep on progression”. She is now requesting a loan to buy chairs, tables and ingredients such as bread, oil, dairy products and meat. This investment will help her make the most of the location of her activity, an area of great traffic busy with passers-by and vehicles, and this will boost her success.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, bread, oil, dairy products and meat.

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Ahmmed is a 52-year-old married man and the father of 9 children. His oldest child is 20 years old and the youngest one is 5 years old. He lives with his family in a miserable condition in Taiz city, Yemen. He is an uneducated man and he is the sole breadwinner of the family. His income is small and unfixed. 

Ahmmed lives with his large family in a very old house which he inherited from his father. This house is very old and needs repair and maintenance. He wants to make it more spacious and comfortable, but he doesn't have enough money to do that. As a result, Ahmmed is requesting a loan of 98,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as iron, steels, bricks, cement, and other materials in order to make repairs on his old house.

Ahmmed hopes to complete all building and renovation of his house to make it more comfortable and spacious. He is waiting your support.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to make repairs on his old house.

loans.name: Sara Leida

texts.es:
Sara tiene 27 años, es una persona luchadora que día a día se esfuerza para sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo porque es madre soltera, pero eso no la impide a salir adelante. Gracias al apoyo de sus padres está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad y también trabaja como Cajera, ella cree que le va bien porque pone en práctica la ética con la que sus padres la educaron desde pequeña.
Sara está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá terminar de construir la fachada de su casa, de esta manera estará mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para más adelante tener toda su casa construida.
texts.en:
Sara is 27 years old. Being a single mother, she is a determined individual who strives each day to move forward on behalf of her young son. Nothing has kept her from getting ahead. Thanks to the support of her parents, Sara is studying for a degree in Accounting. She also works as a cashier. Sara believes she is doing well because she puts into practice the values that her parents instilled in her when she was young.

She is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the support they have given. Sara will be able to finish building the façade of her house, which will improve her family’s quality of life. She continues to push forward so that she can eventually have a house that is completely finished.

loans.use: to finish building the façade of her house

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор родилась в 1977 году. Она заботливая мать 4 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант  в Российской Федерации. Она занимается купле продажей женской одежды на местном рынке. Гулбахор этим бизнесом занимается уже более 12 лет. Она имеет свою торговую лавку. Гулбахор всегда стремится к тому, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Ее дочь Азиза студентка первого курса. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери и поэтому она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своей дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulbahor was born in 1977 and is the caring mother of four children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Gulbahor has been working for more than 12 years buying and selling women's clothing at the local market from her own retail space. She has always wanted her children to get a university education. Her daughter Aziza is a first-year student and Gulbahor needs to pay her tuition, therefore she is requesting a loan to cover her daughter's tuition costs. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 49-year-old, married woman. Her son provides transportation services, using a motorized rickshaw. He has been driving it over rough roads, which has caused a lot of depreciation. His rickshaw had become fully depreciated, so he sold his old moto-rickshaw. Now he wants to buy a new one. But the amount he received by selling the old one, does not fully cover the purchase price of a new rickshaw.

This is the reason Bushra has requested a loan. She will use the loan money for her son, so he can buy a new moto-rickshaw and can drive it smoothly. Bushra thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new, motorized rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Nigorakhon

texts.ru: Нигорахон молодая и энергичная девушка. Она студентка второго курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Таджикистана Политики и Бизнеса. Нигорахон учится успешно и активно участвует во всех мероприятиях университета. В дальнейшем, после окончания университета она хочет стать высококвалифицированным специалистом. Нигорахон не за мужем и живет с родителями. Ее родители работают учителями в средней школе и получают маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для оплаты учебного договора Нигорхона. Нигорахон запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nigorakhon is an energetic young woman and a second-year student at Tajik State University of Political Science and Business. She is a good student and actively participates in university events. In the future, after she graduates, she wants to become a highly qualified specialist. Nigorakhon is not married and lives with her parents, who are both high school teachers with a small income that is not enough to pay for her education. Therefore she is requesting a loan to cover her tuition expenses. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es casado y vive con su mujer en la comunidad de Avichaca en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad y no tiene defectos, Francisco es agricultor  y quiere comprar una motobomba para el riego de sus sembradios Francisco es la unica fuente de sustento en su hogar por eso requiere de su ayuda, el cliente goza de buena salud  y su esposa no tiene problemas de ese tipo, ellos agradeceran su ayuda
texts.en:
Francisco is married and lives with his wife in the community of Avichaca. They own an adobe house that has no defects.

Francisco is a farmer and wants to buy a motorized water pump for irrigating his fields. He is the only breadwinner in his household, so he is requesting assistance. Francisco is in good health and his wife also has no problems of this type. They appreciate the help.

loans.use: to buy a motorized water pump for irrigating his fields.

loans.name: Adeluz

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Adeluz;la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de llamadas telefonicas,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le realiza en su negocio, la socia continua realizando llamadas nacionales y locales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de nuevos celulares.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Sra. Adeluz continues to operate her call service business. She has been in business for a long time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Adeluz still continues to make local and national calls. She is a responsible and industrious individual. By working in this manner, she is able to help her family get ahead.

Adeluz is requesting a loan in order to buy new mobile phones. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy new mobile phones for her call service business.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a young entrepreneur of only 29 years old. She is married and from Kathapara, a small village in Jalpaiguri district. She is the mother of two children (one son and one daughter).  She lives with her children and husband in their mud and straw-made house. Sadly, for lack of economic resources, Rama studied until grade five and was unable to pursue further education.

Rama's husband works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing seasonal vegetables. He always has high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. As the family has only seasonal income, Rama decided to start a dairy business. She owns a dairy cow. She sells milk and milk products (cottage cheese, butter and curd) in her neighborhood and earns for the family. As their joint income is also insufficient to cover the basic needs of her family, she likes to improve on her business to strengthen the family economy.

So, she has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase one more dairy cow to grow her dairy business. With this new cow, she can start producing more dairy products to sell and satisfy her customers. They also use the milk products for family feeding. She is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure the financial stability of her family.

Rama is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her existing business.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
¿Porque financiar al señor Gustavo?
 Una simple razón es que Gustavo es un trabajador incansable dedicado a la elaboración de calzado la cual la aprendió donde su tío y llego a ser oficial de calzado hasta que se independizo buscando un mejro futuro para sus hijos de 1 y 2 años de edad que tan pequeño requieren una mayor inversión pues están forjando ese tallo que en unos años será un gran árbol y el espera que sea uno que de buenos frutos. 

Sueña con comprar un terreno para construir su casa y dejarla a sus hijas que es lo único que le importa en su vida estas dos criaturas que siempre le mantiene esa desbordante sonrisa que muestra en la foto. 

Una razón más es que este hombre trabaja 10 horas diarias que el mismo fábrica el calzado que el mismo sale y lo vende, que se busca sus clientes que hace lo posible e imposible por generar recursos y alcanzar sus sueños.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de nuevo material para fabricar calzado, cuerina (cuero sintético), broches, plataformas y diseños  tan locos y diferentes que crearan expectativa a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Why support Gustavo?

One simple reason is that Gustavo is a tireless worker who makes a living as a shoemaker. He learned the trade while working at his uncle's, where he rose to the level of journeyman. In search of a better future for his children, he later decided to work for himself. His children, aged one and two, are so young that they require a great deal of care. Like sowed seeds, his children are growing, shaping a stem that, in a few years, will turn into a majestic tree—one he hopes will bear good fruits

He dreams of buying a plot of land where he will build a home, which he will leave to his children. These two children are his priority and are responsible for making him smile from ear to ear always, as shown in the picture.

Other reasons are that this man works 10 hours a day; that he makes the footwear himself; that he goes out to the streets, looking for customers to whom he will offer his products; and that he does everything he can to generate income and fulfill his dreams.

He is requesting a loan to buy new materials such as imitation leather, shoe clips, and platforms to make footwear with designs so funky and different that they will create a buzz among his customers.

loans.use: to purchase different materials (platforms, imitation leather, and shoe clips) to make the footwear that he designs and sells himself.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 32-year-old lady, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to provide better living facilities for her children, but it seems impossible, in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a motorized rickshaw for several years; his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient capital to fix the problem. Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to enable her husband to buy a body for the motorized rickshaw.

She thanks Kiva and the field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for husband.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is a young woman of 19 years old from a small village of Dhupguri, West Bengal. She is married, a housewife, and a mother of a toddler. She lives with her husband and son in their own kachha house (made of straw, bamboo, and mud).

Her husband is a farmer and has a plot of land. He works hard to come out ahead in vegetable cultivation. He mainly grows potatoes, eggplants, bitter gourd, etc. He has many years of experience working on his farm. His products are in much demand in the markets.  

Swapna is an energetic and hardworking woman. Though she is a housewife, she helps her husband in his work a lot. Especially at the time of harvesting, she carries the products to the market for sale. The income of her family greatly depends on this agribusiness, so she and her partner want to develop it by growing some other vegetables. Now they have chosen ribbed gourd for cultivation, as it is a vegetable that is widely used in India.

So, Swapna is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to be able to support her for the purchase of agricultural inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. Her dreams are to improve her quality of life and continue strengthening their family assets with the profit from her business.

She dreams to construct a concrete-made house for them in the future with the profit from the business. She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivating ribbed gourd.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris has a carpentry business in Nakuru town, where he makes and sells sofa sets, wooden tables, chairs, and wall units. He is 26 years old and married. He and his spouse have been blessed with two children. Morris also has a retail shop business.

He plans to use this loan to buy more materials for his carpentry business. These include lumber, nails, sandpaper, upholstery materials, and wood glue. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of goods for his retail shop.

This is his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he has repaid his previous loans successfully. In future, he hopes to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more carpentry materials, for making furniture

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her spouse and five children. Her husband owns a small gemstones shop, in which he sells precious gemstones for rings, earrings, and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a display glass case, for the attraction of customers.

He is the family's sole source of income; he has to afford the expenses of utility bills, school fees of his children, and household expenses, alone. The condition of his house is not up to the mark for living.

Therefore, Bushra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan funds so her husband can buy precious gemstones, which will enable him to increase his earnings.

Bushra hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members may pass their lives comfortably. She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to buy gemstones for reselling.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La Sra. Edith, la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de cafetín, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de galletas, gaseosas entre otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Edith continues to manage her café business. She is grateful for the loan that has been offered and promises to complete her payments.

Edith has been in business for a long time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. By working in this manner, she is able to help her family get ahead. She is requesting a loan in order to buy cookies, sodas, and other items.

loans.use: to buy cookies, sodas, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase high-quality breeds of poultry

loans.name: Yunior Rafael

texts.es:
Yunior es un joven luchador de 22 años, es soltero y vive en Parcona junto a su familia.
Debido a algunas situaciones económicas no pudo estudiar una profesión, sin embargo siempre se esfuerza para sacar adelante a su familia. Trabaja como chofer desde hace más de 2 años , él cree que le va bien porque siempre se esmera, es responsable, se preocupa por el bienestar de los clientes y es muy amable.
Yunior está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá empezar a construir su cuarto en un espacio de su casa que su madre le ha cedido, de esta manera mejorará su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando día a día para poder comprarse un carro propio y tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Yunior is a resourceful young man aged 22, he is single and lives in Parcona with his family.
Due to some economic difficulties, he was not able to study a career, but he always makes efforts to provide for his family nevertheless. He has been working as a driver for more than 2 years: he thinks things are going well because he always does his best, he is responsible, he is very nice and he cares for his customers’ wellbeing.
Yunior is grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their support he will be able to start building his room in a part of his house that his mother has given him; this will improve his standard of living, and he will keep on fighting on a daily basis in  order to buy himself a car and to increase his income.

loans.use: To build a room in his house.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por 4 miembros, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace mas de 7 años, adicional a eso vende productos de uso personal por catálogos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  maíz por quintales y cal para seguir con la elaboración de las tortillas y así obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia la mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 39 years old. She lives in her own house with her family group, made up of 4 members. She has worked making and selling tortillas for more than 7 years. In addition to this, she sells personal care products by catalog. Her business is located in her place of residence. Ana is requesting a loan to buy corn in large sacks as well as lime, in order to continue making tortillas. In this way she will obtain a better income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lime and corn in large sacks.

loans.name: Arbanus

texts.en:
Arbanus is a 36 year old man married to Annastacia who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children.  Arbanus has been a farmer for a period of 5 years earning an income of 7,000 KES at the end of every month.

Arbanus was introduced to VisionFund Kenya and is now taking his first loan of 10,000 KES. He intends to use this amount to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm plantation.

Arbanus plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm plantation.

loans.name: Skenderpeng

texts.en:
Skenderpeng is a married woman and the mother of three children. She is from Iloilo, Philippines. Skenderpeng and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than 10 years, and it is the source of their income. Several months ago, a super typhoon hit the country and ruined thousands of houses and businesses. Skenderpeng's business was not spared. The boat was totally damaged after the typhoon.

As of now, Skenderpeng has started to rebuild again. She is requesting a loan to buy a new fishing boat and a new engine. This will enable her husband to go back to fishing and augment his catch, thus allowing them to sell more fish to the market.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and a new engine

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es: Mabel se dedica a la confección de ropa en todas las líneas; aunque es empírica en su oficio ha logrado poco a poco  aumentar la calidad de sus prendas, siendo así muy aceptada en el segmento de su mercado. Los jeans, las bermudas, masculinas, son los principales productos en los que ha invertido y  vende a personas naturales, mayoristas y amas de casa, de contado y a crédito, recuperando semanalmente su inversión y trabajando durante 10 horas diarias en la producción de prendas de vestir. Su nueva meta es mejorar su espacio productivo, y como su taller está ubicado en la sala del lugar donde habita, y este espacio resulta estrecho para ubicar ordenadamente sus maquinarias, necesita resolver resolver esta situación, por lo que está acudiendo a un nuevo credikiva,  mediante el cual comprará  materiales constructivos, para entechar el patio y ubicar la mesa de corte en él,  lo cual ofrecerá una mayor amplitud a su sala de producción, para  una ubicación eficiente de sus maquina de coser.
texts.en: Mabel engages in fashioning clothes of every style; despite having learned her job through experience, she has succeeded in improving the quality of her clothes little by little, thus becoming well established in her area of activity. The products she has mainly invested in are jeans, bermuda and men’s clothing, and she sells to individual customers, wholesalers and housewife’s, both for cash and on credit, retrieving her money on a weekly basis and working 10 hours a day to create clothes. Her new goal is to improve her working spaces, as her workshop is located in a room of her house, a space too narrow to place her machines in an organized manner. She needs to solve this problem and for this reason, she is requesting a new loan to buy construction materials to roof her patio and to place the cutting machine there. This will add more space to her production area, allowing her to place her sewing machine in a more efficient way.

loans.use: To buy fabrics in a variety of colors and designs in order to respond to growing demand.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru:
Это Мухайё. Она  экономически активная молодая жительница района Фархор. Ей 23 года. Мухайё разведена и живет с двухлетним сыном у матери. Помимо них там еще живут ее два братья с женами и старшая сестра с двумя детьми. 
Мухайё самостоятельная женщина и сама зарабатывает на жизнь. Она на протяжении более 5 лет занимается продажей одежды, платков, полотенец и других вещей на рынке. Ей усердно помогают мать и сестра. Мухайё для развития бизнеса хочет привезти побольше товара, чтобы таким образом привлечь больше клиентов и увеличить объем продаж. Она действительно нуждается в данном кредите.
texts.en: Meet Muhayo, an active young woman from the Farkhor district of Tajikistan.  Muhayo is 23 years old, divorced, and she lives with her 2-year-old son and her mother.  Also living with them are Muhayo's two brothers and their wives, as well as her older sister and her two children. Muhayo is an independent woman who makes her own living.  For the past five years, she has been selling clothes, scarves, towels and other goods at the market.  Her mother and sister work hard to help her.  Muhayo would like to develop her business, and to do so, she wants to bring in more merchandise, so she can attract more customers and increase her sales.  This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy goods such as men's clothes, women's scarves and towels, in order to increase her business.

loans.name: Reyna Emely

texts.es: Reyna de 35 años de edad  es una mujer muy trabajadora vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, son una familia muy unida y honesta, ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, siembra maíz, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en las siembras, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella solicita  un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, abonos, etc. para seguir con su trabajo de agricultora, tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reyna, aged 35, is a very hard-working woman, who lives in her own home with her husband and their children. They are a very tight-knit and honest family.

She has been making a living as a farmer for the last 15 years. She grows corn, and her husband and their children help her out in the fields. She sells her products in the surrounding area. With the earnings from her sales and her husband’s help, they manage to cover their household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, inorganic fertilizers, pest control products, organic fertilizers, and the like to continue farming, earn a better income, and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, inorganic fertilizers, pest control products, organic fertilizers, and the like.

loans.name: Fazeelat

texts.en: Fazeelat is a 55-year-old married woman. She has been running a hotel from her home for many years.  She enjoys making food and she has become famous in her town for providing good tasting breakfast items. She is earning enough to lead a decent life. Her husband assists her in taking orders from customers and then sends it to respective places. She is a responsible mother and needs to earn more to bear daily expenditures of her family members. That is why she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy stock of grains, salt, flour and oil at lower rates from the market. In this way she would be able to increase her sales. Fazeelat wishes to utilize her earned profit on providing  a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy stock of grains, salt, flour and oil.

loans.name: Keang

texts.en:
Keang, aged 46, lives in a rural village in the Baray district of Kampong Thom province. She has five children, two of whom are still her dependents. To earn a living, Keang farms rice and cassava on two hectares of farmland. She has been in this business for 28 years, earning 20,000 KHR per day.  

Keang is taking out her first loan with VisionFund to pay for her daughter's school fees. She hopes to keep her daughter in school until her graduation.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's school fees

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is only 24 years old and studied up to grade five in her local school. She couldn't continue her study, as her parents could not provide. Now she is married and has three children (one son and two daughters). Two of them go to school, and one is an infant. She resides at West Magurmari in Jalpaiguri district with her husband, Hafizar, and children. She is a homemaker who manages the household, and in her spare time does agricultural jobs with her husband.

Amina's husband is a farmer by profession and mainly grows paddy on his inherited farmland. His wife and children are the only ones dependent on him. For them, he works tirelessly from dawn to dusk. He works in agriculture, mainly cultivating rice, and has been in the business for many years. He is very hardworking and responsible, and sells his produce to basic grain dealers. He uses his income to cover the household needs. As the basic needs of his family are increasing day by day, his income is insufficient to cover those. So, they have decided to grow more paddy, and for this, they have to invest more.  

Amina heard from her neighbors about BJS and applied for a loan for her husband to buy agricultural inputs, such as fertilizer and herbicides, to grow rice. In this way, he can ensure food for his family. His dream is that his family will live more comfortably and that he can support his children in their studies so that they are well prepared and get good work.

Amina wants to purchase more land with the profit in the future. She is very much thankful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and paddy seeds for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose esta casado y tiene dos hijos, este cliente vive con sus padres en Avichaca en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad, la casa tiene luz y agua Jose es agricultor y quiere comprar una motobomba para el riego de sus sembradios Jose es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y no tiene otra actividad, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Jose is married and has two children. He lives in an adobe house that he owns in Avichaca, along with his parents. The house has electricity and running water.

Jose is a farmer and wants to buy a motorized water pump for irrigating his fields. He is the only breadwinner in his household and has no other business activities. For this reason, he is in need of assistance.

loans.use: to buy a motorized water pump for irrigating his fields.

loans.name: Miriam De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Ayudar a las personas es la vocación de Miriam, una joven de 28 años, quien desde pequeña le ha gustado apoyar a quien la necesite, en especial a los niños, razón suficiente para que decidiera estudiar la licenciatura en psicología. Ella trabaja como docente, pues miró en la educación una forma para ayudar en el crecimiento individual de las personas y del país. Afortunadamente ha contado con el apoyo económico y moral de su esposo para poder terminar su cuarto año de la carrera.
Esta madre de un bebé de un año de edad, estudia todos los sábados para poder cumplir con el sueño de llegar a tener su título. Ahora solo necesita un paso más, la culminación de sus estudios. Por esta razón, solicita de un préstamo para hacer los pagos de la titulación y así poder tener un diploma que garantice mejores opciones de empleo. En un futuro quiere optar por una maestría, pues quiere seguir creciendo profesionalmente.
texts.en:
Miriam’s life mission is to help people; she is a young woman of 28 who has been willing to assist those in need, particularly children, since she was child, and this was all the reason she needed to take a degree in Psychology. She is a teacher, as she considers that education is a way to support the growth both of the single individual and of her country. Luckily enough, she could count on her husband’s moral and economical support to finish the fourth years of her academic career.
She has a child aged 1, and she studies every Saturday in order to fulfill her dream and get a degree. She only needs to take one last step, the completion of her studies. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to pay for her degree fees, thus getting a diploma that grants better employment opportunities. In the future, she wants to choose a Master’s degree, as she wants to keep on professionally growing.

loans.use: To pay the fees for her diploma.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara, 42 years old, is a widow and has 3 children. For the past 10 years, she has had a food stall in Nakuru. Her current monthly income is KES 20,000. Sara will be using this loan to buy more stock of baking flour and cooking oil. This will enable her to earn more income. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is Sara's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to grow her business, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sheku

texts.en:
Sheku, 60 years old, is married, and has six children aged 10, 16, 21, 28, 30 and 36. In 2010, Sheku established his used clothing business. He began his business just to be self reliant after retiring from the civil service. His business is located in the city centre and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, Sheku earns about SLL 672,000 every month. 

Sheku would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to buy used trousers, shirts and t-shirts. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his stock and expand the business. In the future, Sheku plans to to educate his children with the profit from this business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for his shop

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in this picture is her husband who also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 in order to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand in their store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años principalmente a la siembra de maíz y pipianes, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, el joven vive con su compañera de vida y su hija, el solicita un crédito para poder comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
