texts.en: The young man whose face is blurred because he's 22 years old and lives in a high-risk area has made a living in agriculture for a number of years, primarily growing corn and winter squash. He sells his products in the various markets. The young man lives with his life partner and their daughter. He is asking for a loan to be able to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, insecticides, herbicides, etc. as shown in the photograph to be able to maintain his crops and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, insecticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Laudid Esther

texts.es: Laudid dedicada el comercio de variedades, con su credikiva anterior compró calzado, ropa, accesorios femeninos y para el hogar,  sobre los pedidos y ajustados a la ocasión. Con este crédito adquirió mayor liquidez, aumentó su capital de trabajo, sus ventas se incrementaron, al igual que sus utilidades, lo cual contribuyó con el mejoramiento de su ingreso familiar. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva : “ Muchas gracias por este apoyo, quiero seguir progresando y por eso solicito un nuevo préstamo”. Esta es la razón por la cual se acercó nuevamente a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, donde se encuentra aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará artículos alusivos a las fiestas venideras del fin de año, como adornos, ropa, calzado, variedades femeninas y para el hogar. Con esta inversión atenderá los pedidos de su clientela, que han aumentado de acuerdo a lo que marca las fiestas navideñas y de año nuevo.
texts.en:
Laudid earns a living selling various products. With her earlier Kiva loan, she bought shoes, clothing and women's accessories for the home, on orders and adjusted for the occasion. 

With this loan, she acquired better liquidity and increased her working capital. Her sales increased as well as her profits, contributing to the improvement of her family's income. 

She sent the following message to Kiva investors: "Thank you very much for this support. I want to continue progressing, and because of this, I'm seeking a new loan." This is the reason she came back to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, where she applied for a Kiva loan. 

With this, she'll buy articles related to the coming end-of-year holidays, such as ornaments, clothing, shoes and women's household products. With this investment, she will serve her customer's orders, which have increased along with the celebrations for Christmas and the New Year.

loans.use: to buy articles related to the coming end-of-year holidays, such as ornaments, clothing, shoes and women's household products.

loans.name: Iván

texts.es: Ivan dice a los financiadores de Kiva : “Muchas Gracias, por tanto apoyo; he progresado, bastante, tengo mi local propio y el negocio está prospero.“ Ivan recibió anteriormente un credikiva con el que logró  comprar celulares, diademas, accesorios, repuestos, planes de minutos amplios y recargas a celulares, así mismo aumentó la compra de refrescos y de dulces, los cuales vendió. Su anterior crédito le permitió incrementar su liquidez y sus inventarios, aumentar sus ventas y con ello sus utilidades. Iván está muy satisfecho,  pues adquirió casa propia en el macro proyecto Villas de San Pablo, lugar donde la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, apoya la construcción del tejido social y ha apoyado la gestión de Ivan para acceder a los planes de vivienda del estado nacional  Colombiano.  En la actualidad Ivan está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará celulares, accesorios tecnológicos, repuestos, memorias, recargas, refrescos, confites. Con esté nuevo crédito, Ivan aprovechará aun mas, que se encuentra ubicado en una vía  cercana al estadio metropolitano de la ciudad, donde se practica el futbol profesional, porque  la gran afluencia de personas, que esta instalación recreo cultural genera , impactará sus ventas para lograr el éxito de su nueva  inversión.
texts.en:
Ivan says to Kiva lenders, "Thank you very much. With so much support, I have progressed a lot. I have my own location, and the business is prosperous."

Ivan received an earlier Kiva loan, with which he was able to buy cell phones, headsets, accessories, spare parts, plans with more minutes and cell phone recharges. He also increased his sales, and with that, his income. 

Ivan is very happy, as he acquired his own house in the Villas de San Pueblo development, where the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo supports the construction of the social fabric and supported Ivan management to access the housing schemes of the Colombian national state.

Currently, Ivan is applying for a Kiva loan, with which he'll buy cell phones, technological accessories, replacement parts, memory cards, refills, soft drinks and candy. 

With this new loan, Ivan will benefit even more. He's located on a road close to the city stadium, where professional football is played. Because the large number of people this cultural recreational facility generates, it will impact his sales to achieve success with his new investment.

loans.use: to buy cell phones, technological accessories, replacement parts, memory cards, refills, soft drinks and candy.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Hello, world. Meet Benard. He is a 21-year-old farmer with dreams of being a successful poultry farmer. He is based in Litein, which is a remote location in the South Rift region of Kenya. He has been doing farming for the last two years. He makes an income selling milk, offering motorcycle transportation services, and generating income from other side-businesses. 

Benard is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. By venturing into poultry, Benard will be diversifying his product portfolio. This will help him to not only make profits, but also spread risks that may be associated with the other products. The demand for poultry products is always very high, yet most farmers are stuck in dairy farming due to traditional factors. 

With your loan, Benard is going to grow his business. He is a natural farmer. His most enjoyable farm activity is milking! The income that he is going to generate from poultry will help him to comfortably afford the high farming expenses. His end game is to pull his family out of poverty

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en: Rasheeda, age 40, is a married woman.  She has 7 children. For a living she stitches clothes for women living around her locality. Through her work, she has been able to support her family. She needs more funds to finance the day-to-day expenses of her tailoring business. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. With this loan amount she wants to purchase more raw materials including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc. Her aim in life is to make her children happy.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. Her husband (the man shown in the picture) deals in a construction business, which is the major source of their income. He is responsible for the roofs of the houses during construction. In this way he earns sufficient amount of income to meet the family expenses. In order to meet the everyday household expenditures, more income is required, so Shazia contacted Kashf foundation and has applied for her 6th loan of 40,000 PKR for the growth of her husband's business. Her husband will utilize this loan amount to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate. Shazia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase good quality timber, metal, and slate.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela de 19 años de edad es propietaria de una miscelánea desde hace 2 años, cuando decidida a tener sus propios ingresos,  emprendió en el año 2012,  su propia aventura de negocios. Su esposo trabaja en otra ciudad y ella habita con sus suegros, mientras estudia “Asistente Administrativo”, una carrera técnica,  en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje  “SENA “ ,, que es un ente especializado en carreras técnicas y tecnológicas, de carácter público-privado. Los productos que vende Marcela son la ropa interior, el calzado, accesorios y ropa exterior, ella cuenta con un local donde exhibe sus mercancías, para impactar  a su clientela conformada por personas ubicadas en el barrio y amigos de estos,  que son sus referidos. La meta de Marcela es ampliar su negocio, con un mayor surtido y tener su propia vivienda, Ella hoy en día  se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, mediante el cual comprará perfumería, ropa exterior, productos de papelería, ropa interior, con lo cual tendrá un diverso y abundante surtido,  en este segundo semestre del año, donde usualmente las ventas se incrementan y esto hará que su negocio, con esta inversión mejore.
texts.en:
Marcela, 19 years old, has been the owner of a miscellaneous store for two years. She launched this business in 2012, when she was determined to have her own source of income.

Her husband works in another city, and she lives with her in-laws while studying for an administrative assistant technical career at the National Apprenticeship Service (SENA), a public-private entity specializing in technical and technological careers. 

The products Marcela sells are underwear, shoes, accessories and outerwear. She relies on a location where she displays her merchandise to affect her customers, made up of people located in her neighborhood and their friends, who are her references. 

Marcela's goal is to grow her business, with a better stock, and to have her own home. Right now, she's gone to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for a Kiva loan, the first loan this organization does. 

With this, she will buy perfume, outerwear, stationery, underwear, with which she will have a diverse and abundant supply. In this second semester of the year, sales normally increase, and this will happen to her business improve with this investment.

loans.use: to buy perfume, outerwear, stationery, underwear, with which she will have a diverse and abundant supply.

loans.name: Moises Rodrigo

texts.es:
Moises es un joven emprendedor, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Chincha junto a su familia.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como Obrero de Campo, trabaja más de 10 horas al día porque quiere brindarle una mejora calidad de vida a su familia. Moises es una persona muy trabajadora, con muchos deseos de superación. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque gracias al apoyo que le brindaron podrá comprar enseres para su hogar, de esta manera su familia vivirá en mejores condiciones y seguirá esforzándose al máximo para cumplir todos sus objetivos trazados.
texts.en:
Moises is a young entrepreneur. He is 28 years old, single, and he lives in Chincha along with his family.

For many years, he has worked as a farm laborer. He works more than 10 hours a day because he wants to provide a better quality of life to his family. Moises is a very hard-working person with a great desire for self-improvement. 

He is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the support that they have provided to him, he will be able to purchase necessities for his home. In this way, his family will live in better conditions and he will continue making maximum effort to complete all of his outlined objectives.

loans.use: to purchase necessities for his home.

loans.name: Surriya

texts.en:
Surriya is a 58-year-old married woman. She has seven children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past eight years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates, and then sells it to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Gull  Bano

texts.en:
Gull Bano is a 44-year-old, hardworking woman. She has five children. For the last ten years, she has been providing the service of stitching in her locality. She is quite popular for her skill of stitching. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

In her third loan cycle, Gull Bano has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread, laces, and buttons. 

Gull Bano is very thankful for her previous loans and hopes that this loan will generate a healthy source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, laces, and buttons.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 41 years old married woman and a mother of five.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 40000/- PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc., to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 45-years-old.  She has been selling sorghum for 17 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Estrellita  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Estrellita está formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes tienen una gran amistad, siempre se apoyan en lo que necesiten para salir en adelante y que sus familias se sientan beneficiadas. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada como la tercera ciudad más importante económicamente del Ecuador, es reconocida por sus paisajes, su cultura, sus iglesias y su centro histórico, su gente y quienes la visitan se enamoran de esta ciudad.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mercedes, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos que son casados y viven  independientes, su esposo es un comerciante que se dedica a la venta de productos naturales, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Mercedes se dedica al comercio, vende ropa en especial de niños esta actividad la realiza desde muy joven, su mercadería lo vende recorriendo por la ciudad. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa. Su meta es tener su propio local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
The credit group Estrellita is made up of 7 female members and 1 male member who have a great friendship. They always support each other in what they need to succeed and so that their families feel benefitted. They live in the city of Cuenca. This city is considered as Ecuador’s third most important city, economically. It is known for its scenery, its culture, its churches, and its historic center. Its people and those who visit fall in love with this city.

One of the members of this group is Mercedes. She is 60 years old. She is married, and her conjugal union has conceived three children who are married and live independently. Her husband is a businessman who makes a living from the sale of natural products. The house in which they live is their own.

Mercedes makes a living from commerce. She sells clothing, especially children’s. She has performed this activity since she was very young. She sells her merchandise all over the city. She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of clothing. Her goal is to have her own store to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mangoes, palm fruit, mandarin oranges, watermelons and melons.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 46-year-old man married to Ruth who adds additional income to support their family's welfare.  They are blessed with three children.  Martin has been operating a cereals stall business and a retail shop as a secondary business, for a period of eight years earning himself an income of KES 5,000 at the end of every month.

Martin was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of 10,000 and intends to use this amount to buy maize, beans and green grams to sell to his customers.

Martin plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children, stock his retail shop with sugar, rice and cooking oil and hopes to become a successful business man.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, and green grams to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en: Hameeda is a 59-year-old, hard working woman. She has four children. For the last 12 years, she has been providing stitching services in her locality. She is quite popular for her skill of stitching. Hameeda’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. In her third loan cycle, Hameeda has requested a loan amount of 35,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads, cloth and ribbons.  Hameeda is very thankful for her previous loans and hopes that this loan will further diminish her family’s financial problems.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads, cloth and ribbons.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos de hombres pues es la actividad que ellos realizan y les gusta  trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación. Domingo  de 54 años de edad quien vive en Solola, casado con  tres hijos que son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.

 La actividad que Domingo realiza es la agricultura en la comunidad donde el vive, el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante más de 20 años, dicha actividad lo aprendió de su padre que también se dedicaba a dicha actividad. La segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero en su pueblo.

El motivo de la realización de su  préstamo es para la compra de terreno ya que desde un tiempo ha venido trabajando por ello para poder cultivar la tierra sin pagarle a otra persona por usar sus tierras como lo ha vendió haciendo.
Las metas de el es pagar sus deudas con que el cuenta y en un futuro comprar más terrenos para sus hijos y brindarles estudios a sus hijos para que ellos sean profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
The land has been blessed by the hands of men, as the activity they do and enjoy is to work and take care of it. It is a decent job, to admire then men who do it for years and for a lifetime. The land, without the labor of farming men dedicated to cultivating it, would not give all the fruits that sustain the entire generation.

Domingo, 54 years old, lives in Solola. He's married with three children who are excellent students in their community school. The activity Domingo does is agriculture in the community where he lives. 

He's been doing this for more than 20 years, and learned it from his father, who also did this activity. The second thing he does is day labor in his town.

The goal for this loan is to buy land. For some time, he has been working for this to be able to cultivate the land without paying other people to use as he has been doing.

His goals are to pay his debts on his account, and in the future to buy more land for his children and bring them education so they can be professionals in life.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Aneya

texts.en:
Aneya is 42 years old and married with one son. She hails from Dhupguri. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband is a farmer. She lives in their own kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw) with her husband and son.  Her son is a worker in a local tea factory.

Her husband Nur is 46 years old. He is engaged in an agribusiness. He has a plot of land where he grows a variety of fruits to earn a living for his family. He grows quality products, so his customers like him and his products. Now he wants to grow paddy on his farmland.
 
Aneya is asking for support from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She needs a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds of the highest quality to plant and, therefore,  diversify their income. With this loan, she plans to purchase paddy seed of high quality so that they will have good growth and an adequate harvest. With this purchase of products and assistance, his crop will be of better quality for his customers. He wants to stop depending on vegetables to be able to support the needs of his family.

Aneya wants to build a concrete-made house for them.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 26-year-old single lady, the sole breadwinner for her family, responsible for the living of four other members.

Suzan is a hard worker, well known in her region. Two years ago, she got employed in a pharmacy, where she is currently working. She used to work in a lawyer's office. Her job is going on just fine, and she is getting a good experience. Since her limited income is always invested in covering her family's increasing needs, Suzan finds herself in need of extra income to cover sudden unexpected requests.

Thus, for this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for her necessary dental needs.

She hopes to develop her working career and one day establish her own business.

loans.use: to pay for necessary dental needs.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 33-year-old man married to Christine, who adds additional income to support their family.  They are blessed with two children.  Anthony has been a farmer for a period of three years earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Anthony was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 15, 000 and intends to use this amount to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm plantation.

Anthony plans to use the anticipated income to buy a dairy cow, pay school fees for his children and hopes to own land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm plantation.

loans.name: Berardo

texts.es: Con su anterior crediiva, Berardo vendió bollos de mazorca, queso, suero, galletas y carnes al pormayor y de contado. Sus ventas se incrementaron, su liquidéz mejoró y los ingresos familiares fueron mucho mas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva mediante el cual compará bollos de mazorca, queso, suero, al pormayor y de contado, atendiendo a su clientela, quienes saben que sus productos son de muy buena calidad , y con ello, los  mantiene fieles y persistentes en la compra. Berardo envia el siguiente mensaje a sus finaciadores de Kiva " Muchas gracias a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, espero seguir contando con este apoyo para continuar progresando. "
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Berardo sold corn rolls, cheese, whey, crackers, and meats wholesale and for cash. His sales have increased, his liquidity improved, and his family income was much higher. 

Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan through which he will purchase corn rolls, cheese, and whey wholesale and for cash. He attends to his customers, who know that his products are very good quality, and with which he keeps them loyal and persistent buyers. 

Berardo sends the following message to the Kiva lenders: “Many thanks to Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. I hope to continue counting on this support to continue improving.”

loans.use: to purchase corn rolls, cheese, and whey.

loans.name: Johnnys

texts.es: Johnnys de 41 años de edad,  tiene un taller de electrónica desde el año 1994;  pues desde muy joven se dedicó a esta actividad, la cual realizaba a baja escala, aunque  con el tiempo fue perfeccionándola mediante estudios en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje  “SENA “ ente especializado en carreras técnicas y tecnológicas y es una organización  de carácter público-privado.   Hoy en día Johnnys ha logrado incrementar la calidad en sus servicios y genera   ingresos únicos con esta actividad, que lo sostiene a él y su familia. En su taller ubicado en un local, trabaja a domicilios y directamente es sus instalaciones, el mantenimiento y reparación de abanicos, equipos de sonido televisores y en general electrodomésticos menores. Su horario de trabajo inicia a las 8 de la mañana y finaliza a las 7 de la noche de lunes a sábados,  pues tiene como meta ampliar más su negocio y tener su propia casa para aumentar su bienestar. En la actualidad  Johnnys está aplicando un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará repuestos, que son insumos para reparar electrodomésticos, y servir a su clientela lo mejor posible,  con el propósito de obtener mas utilidades y mejorara su negocio con esta inversión.
texts.en:
Johnnys is 41 years old. He has had an electronics workshop since 1994, and undertook this activity at a very young age. He started doing it at a mall scale, but was perfecting it over time through studies at the National Apprentice Service, SENA, a public-private entity specializing in technical and technological careers.

Now, Johnnys has succeeded in increasing the quality of his services and earning income solely from this activity to support his family. He works directly from his workshop facilities, and in homes doing maintenance and repair of fans, televisions and sound equipment and generally smaller appliances. His work schedule begins at 8 am and ends at 7pm Monday through Saturday. 

His goal is to further expand his business and have his own home to increase his welfare. Currently Johnnys is seeking a Kiva loan, first financing that the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo makes available, with which he will buy spares, which are inputs to repair appliances, and serve his customers best, in order to get more profits and improve his business with this investment.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, which are inputs to repair appliances.

loans.name: Langat

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Langat. The 31-year-old farmer has aspirations to become a very successful farmer. He comes from Litein, where the demand for dairy and poultry products is very high. He has been a mixed farmer for 7 years now. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, transportation services and other personal business.

Langat is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. He is looking to greatly boost chick and egg production. The chicks are reared to become fully grown and productive while eggs are consumed and sold.

With your loan, Langat is going to get the income necessary for his child's education. Langat's family will also benefit from an improved healthy diet.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Alema

texts.en:
Alema is a 23-year-old married woman living in a remote village in West Magurmari in the area of Jalpaiguri. She is the mother of four children (two sons and two daughters).  Three of them go to school and read in different grades and one is too young for school.  Alema is an illiterate housewife and can sign only her name. 

Her husband runs a business retailing ice cream. He purchases ice cream in bulk quantities from the ice cream factory and sells it in the market. Nowadays, as it is summer season, his customers demand more ice cream. To cope with the demand of his customers, he wants to purchase more ice cream but he does not have sufficient funds.

Therefore, Alema requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BJS so that her husband can buy ice cream for his business. She hopes that lenders will support him and this loan will prove productive for her husband's business as well.

With this loan, she will purchase a variety of different flavors of ice cream and attract more customers. Alema hopes that her husband’s income will increase and with the profit, she can support her children so that they can study.

She is very much grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more varieties of ice cream to sell

loans.name: Oudai

texts.en:
Oudai is a 22-year-old single man who has been employed since January 2011 in a company specialized in selling construction needs.

Oudai is a hard worker who puts so much effort into developing his career. Oudai is working hard to develop his living, so for this reason he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car necessary for making his transportation to work easier.

Oudai used to work as an electrician, and through this business he is seeking to take the maximum knowledge and open his own business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car necessary for his transportation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Paul. Paul is an extra-ordinary farmer. He comes from the South Rift region of Kenya where dairy farming is a booming business. Most, if not all, farmers there have dairy animals. Most farmers keep traditional cattle breeds for subsistence. A number of farmers have graduated into commercial farming by replacing the grotesque, unproductive, traditional breeds with grade cows. However, only just a handful of visionary farmers have taken the big gamble of investing in pedigree breeds.
 
Paul, a father of 3, has been doing dairy farming for the last 12 years. He is very passionate about the dairy business. His passion drives him as he strives to push himself up to a mastery level in dairy farming. Throughout the years, he has observed that most farmers do dairy farming either because they were born in families that were doing it, or because everyone is doing it. This mind-set cultivates contentment and the kind of humility that kills any hopes of progress. To people like Paul, constant progress and value addition makes the world go round. He uses every opportunity to learn more and keeps company with the best.

Paul is seeking a loan of 200,000 KES for paying for a pedigree dairy cow. Venturing down that route is by no means an easy option, though, and it requires investment of both time and money, but Paul is ambitious and not afraid to invest in the future. While other farmers may only have the scope to increase production, Paul can also sell good genetics. This, to him, makes this path worthwhile.
  
With your loan, Paul is going to make a big difference. Through Juhudi Kilimo, he has been able to attend numerous training programs. He has solid knowledge on: Feeding the Dairy Cow; Improving Herd Fertility; Good Agricultural and Environmental Practice; Improving Herd Health; Record Keeping.
The money Paul will make from this investment will help him to comfortably afford other farm expenses.  Improving his dairy business will bring untold benefits to his family. Paul’s prioritizes paying for food, then his children’s education, and building up his savings account.

loans.use: to purchase a pedigree dairy cow

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 28-year-old single man who has been a farmer for a period of three years earning himself an income of KES. 8,000 at the end of every month.

Lawrence was introduced to Kiva partner VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES. 15,000 and intends to use this amount to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm plantation.

Lawrence plans to use the anticipated income to buy his own plot, build a permanent house and he hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase other goats to raise them in order to enlarge his small flock of sheep.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is single and she has one child who goes  to school. She has no additional family members. She has a business of selling vegetables and fruits. She has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 from Kiva partner MCDT-SACCO in order to buy sweet potatoes, onions, cabbages, tomatoes and fresh beans.  She also generates additional income from baking cakes.  She sells on a retail basis six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and medication.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes, onions, cabbages, tomatoes and fresh beans.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane does poultry farming in Nakuru town and has been in the business for 10 years now. She is 45-years-old, widowed and she has four children. She also keeps livestock and it has been profitable.

This is her first loan term with Kiva partner VisionFund Kenya and she plans to use it to buy more poultry to raise. She will use the generated profits to add more stock and also service the loan.

In the future, Jane hopes to be successful in her business and to be able to provide education to all her children so they can be independent.

loans.use: to buy more poultry to raise.

loans.name: Astkhik

texts.en:
Astkhik is a 58-year-old housekeeper, who lives in Akhaltsikhe district. She is divorced and lives alone. The only source of income for her is from rent. She had repaired one part of her house and rented it at a normal price. However, Astkhik finds it hard to cover all expenses and make financial stability. So she decided to repair the other rooms in her house and also rent them. Astkhik has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times and lastly her application was approved through a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that gives people a chance to have their own businesses.

Astkhik is a very motivated woman, with a great desire to live better and make savings for the future. She awaits your support and kindness and will be really grateful for the help.

loans.use: to repair the house and then rent it, in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 30-year-old man, married to Marriam who adds additional income to support their family, and they are blessed with three children. Daniel has been a farmer for five years earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Daniel was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and he is now accessing his first loan of KES 20,000 and intends to use the entire amount to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm plantation.  

Daniel plans to use the anticipated income to offer quality education to his children and hopes to be a stable business man with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as iron and steel in order to expand his house more through building other rooms.

loans.name: Fran Wilmer

texts.es:
Fran de  26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato y luego estudio un técnico en computación, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios de la casa y a cuidar de su único hijo, que por el momento no estudia, solo ellos viven con Fran y dependen totalmente de él.

Tiene 4 años de trabajar como empleado en una institución de gobierno, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8:00 am hasta las 4:00 pm, se desplaza 5 kilómetros en su motocicleta. También tiene experiencia con ganado en su casa tiene un par de bueyes para trabajar y dos vacas en ordeño que le producen para consumo y venta.

El Préstamo será utilizado para la compra de ganado, quiere comprar una ternera para criarla y que después de leche para aumentar la producción y venta.

Fran planea trabajar con más ganado, pero siempre conservar su empleo pues quiere que su hijo termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fran, 26 years old, studied through high school and then studied as a computer technician. He is married. His partner takes care of the domestic chores and cares for his only son who, at the moment, does not study. Fran lives with just them and they depend on him completely. 

He has been working as an employee of a government institution for 4 years. He works from Monday to Friday from 8:00am until 4:00pm traveling 5 kilometers on his motorcycle. He also has experience with cattle. At his home, he has a pair of oxen for working and two milking cows who produce for consumption and for sale. 

He will use the loan to buy cattle. He wants to buy a calf to raise. After the milking phase it will increase production and sales.

Fran plans to work more with cattle but to still maintain his job since he wants his son to finish studying.

loans.use: to buy a calf to raise.

loans.name: Karimi

texts.en:
Karimi is a woman eager to get ahead. She is 40-years-old, single and lives with her family in the Chuka area of Kenya. She is blessed with a daughter who is 10-years-old who is her greatest motivation in life to persevere, because she wants to provide her a better future. 

Karimi was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced.  However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Karimi always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” Because of how much she likes farming she has even nicknamed one of her cows “Kairu” which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10-15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family. 

Karimi also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Karimi is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Karimi believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her child a solid educational background. This loan will be Karimi’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 37 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with 3 children. 

Judith sells clothes in Nakuru town and has a clothes selling business which she has been running for 3 years now. Right now her monthly income from her business is 15,000 KES.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of t-shirts and sweaters for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her house by renovating it.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. In future she hopes to be successful and educate her children to a higher level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija has owned a shop business for neighbours and town dwellers. She appreciates the support of the previous loan that helped her to stock her business.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan she wants to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat to sell in her business. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Grupo Las Trabajadoras De San Lucas Group

texts.es:
Las calles de San Lucas  es testigo de los colores más vistosos impregnados en las blusas y fajas típicas.  Es imposible que cualquier turista deje de admirar este producto, pararse y hacer una buena compra de ello. Es el trabajo de Katy de 30 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene cuatro hijos los primeros dos hijos ya tienen familias apartes y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad, (Caty es la que se encuentra con una blusa de color verde en la mano en la fotografía)
	
El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 10 años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de panes negocio que realiza con su esposo por más de cinco años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.
Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Caty para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.
El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería de trajes típicas para luego venderlas por los alrededores de su comunidad. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
The streets of San Lucas are witness to the most brightly colored blouses and typical shawls. It is impossible for any tourist to stop and not admire this product, and get a good deal for it. This is the work of Caty, 30 years old with great aspirations to publicize her community and acquaint all who visit with the work she does with so much effort and dedication.  She is married and lives with her husband and together they desire to get ahead in life and achieve the big dreams that she wants to do in life.  She has four children.  The first two children have families of their own and the last two are excellent students in the school community. (Caty is the one holding a green fabric in the center of the picture.)

The work she does so lovingly is the buying and selling of typical fabrics.  This activity is done at home and in nearby places in the community where she lives.  She has been doing this work for 10 years.  The second job she has is selling breads made ​​with her ​​husband for the past five years.  Thus they generate a profit for the welfare of his family and improve the economic conditions of their families and communities.

She has been an example in her community and that is why a group of women have joined with Caty to improve their business so that each of them can be get ahead and generate more revenue.

The purpose of this loan is for the purchase of merchandise such as typical costumes which she will then sell them around her community. One of her aspirations is to have a stall in the local market in her community and see her children become professionals in life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as typical clothing.

loans.name: Asesewa Group

texts.en:
Faustina is married and the mother of one primary school age child. She is in her forties and, for eighteen years now, she has been selling frozen food, chicken thighs and smoked fish. She works from 6 am to 6 pm each working day and is able to make a good profit each month.

This is her seventh loan request From ID-Ghana Tanzania. She will use it to buy more chicken thighs, fish and firewood, to smoke fish for sale to customers. She used the previous loans very wisely and has made very good use of her profit. Faustina managed to use her profit to cover school fees, household expenses and saved part of it. 

Faustina will share this loan with her loan group member, Victoria who sells fish. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicken thighs, fish and firewood, to smoke fish and sell it to customers.

loans.name: Rina Esmeralda

texts.es: Doña Rina es una señora de 45 años de edad quien tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el quinto grado año, es casada y trabaja junto a su esposo el cual se desempeña en el campo en la siembra de café. De su relación procrearon 4 hijos los cuales viven con ellos y dos de ellos están estudiando. Su principal fuente de ingresos económicos es el cultivo de café el cual practica desde hace 25 años actividad que aprendió junto a su padre mismo que le heredo la tierra donde ahora trabajan en familia sembrando este producto. La zona donde está ubicada la propiedad de café se encuentra aproximadamente a unos 20 minutos desde su casa caminando en el cual se involucran sus 2 hijos mayores cuando están de vacaciones. Ella solicita en esta ocasión financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL el cual será utilizado para la compra de fertilizantes, insecticidas pago de mano de obra entre otros mejorando su plantación por el buen mantenimiento. Sus planes a corto plazo son la mejora continua de su propiedad y cultivo, comprar más propiedad para poder seguir ampliando la existente y generar mayores ingresos. Ella tiene la fe de que con este financiamiento obtendrá mejores resultados sobre su producto para el final de la temporada y le da la opción de poder enviar a estudiar a sus hijos a mejores institutos para que se puedan superar y también poder hacer mejoras a su vivienda la cual necesita mejoras.
texts.en:
Doña Rina is a 45-year-old woman who studied until the 5th grade of elementary school. She is married and works with her husband in the fields cultivating coffee. They have 4 children from their relationship. The 4 live with them, and 2 are currently studying. 

Her main source of income comes from cultivating coffee, an activity that she has practiced for the last 25 years, and learned from her father. He left her the land where they now work as a family cultivating this product. It is located approximately 20 minutes from her house, and the 2 older sons help with this activity when they are on vacations.

She is requesting this loan to cooperativa COMIXMUL to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay for labor, among other things, in order to improve her plantations through a good maintenance. 

Her short-term plans are the continuous improvement of her crops and property. Also, to buy more land in order to expand the one that she now has and generate more incomes. 

She has faith that with this loan she will get better results with her products by the end of the season, and it will give her the option of sending her children to study to better schools so they can improve themselves. She also hopes that it will help her to make some improvements to the house.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for labor for her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Florence operates an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the KES 30,000, Florence wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is a married woman. She lives together with her husband and six children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seventeen years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of firewood and charcoal in the village. 

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Febronia

texts.en:
Febronia is a single woman; she lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her one child.

Febronia has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the KES 20,000 Febronia wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Cleydy Milka

texts.es:
Cleydy es una joven estudiante de Odontología, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia:Soy  Cleydy, tengo 20 años de edad. Nací, crecí y vivo en los alcarrizos al oeste de santo domingo, tengo dos hermanos, soy soltera y no tengo hijos.
Mi madre es empleada del Ayuntamiento municipal y mi padre está desempleado debido a que se le quemó el negocio donde trabajaba.
Tengo cursado 8 cuatrimestres de Odontología en la Universidad Federico Henríquez y Carvajal (UFHEC).  Escogí esta carrera porque desde temprana edad me daba mucha curiosidad acerca de cómo se realizaban los procedimientos odontológicos. 
Quiero por favor  que me ayuden a terminar mi carrera ya que ni mi familia ni yo tenemos los recursos para seguir costeándola y con este préstamo puedo realizarme profesionalmente; de no recibir el préstamo por esta institución se me haría imposible terminar mis estudios faltándome tan poco para ver mi sueño y el de mis padres hecho realidad.
Este préstamo cambiaria mi vida en un 100%, por que las cosas que me preocupan, este préstamo me las quitara y así sería mejor estudiante de lo que ya soy.
Quiero graduarme con honores y cuando termine la carrera con los mismos materiales que la institución me ayudará a comprar,  poner mi propio consultorio dental en mi sector para comenzar a pagarle.
texts.en:
Cleydy is a young Dentistry student. She is asking for loan to be able to cover her education costs. This is her story:

I am Cleydy, and I am 20 years old. I was born, grew up, and currently live in Los Alcarrizos, in the west of Santo Domingo. I have two brothers, I am single, and I do not have children. My mother is an employee at the municipal city hall, and my father is unemployed because he was let go from the business where he used to work. 

I have taken 8 quarters of Dentistry in the University of Federico Henríquez y Carvajal (UFHEC). I decided on this focus of study because, ever since a young age, I have been curious about how dental procedures are carried out. I want you to please help me finish my degree, as neither my family nor I have the resources to go on paying for it. With this loan, I can find fulfillment professionally; without a loan from this institution it will be impossible for me to finish my studies, with so little to go to see my - and my parent's dream - come true.

This loan will change my life 100%. It would take away the things that I worry about, and therefore I could be a better student than I am now. I want to graduate with honors, and when I finish my degree with the supplies that the institution will help me to purchase, I will open my own dental practice in the industry in order to begin paying it back.

loans.use: to cover higher education expenses.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 47-year-old divorced woman, living in the small village of Koki. She has two sisters and a daughter. One of her sisters is disabled and gets a pension. For taking care of her family's increased needs, Maia is engaged in agricultural activities. Particularly, she cultivates a plot of agricultural land  where she grows vegetables and also harvests nuts. Maia sells these mentioned products at the local market. In spite of this, her income is really insignificant for a family of four to even cover basic needs. 

The family belongs to the subsistence poor category as they have no source of significant income and live in poverty. According to the above mentioned situation, Maia lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business as they require stable income and business experience. The startup program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Maia to get a loan of 3,000 GEL and start a trading business. She plans to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and sell it door-to-door at increased prices. 

It is obvious that the job is hard for Maia, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The startup credit will be a great support for the family as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase clothing at wholesale prices

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is married with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a cosmetic shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: o purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Mary, a very hardworking mother who is 40 years of age. She is a small holder farmer from Magumoni, a remote village in the fertile Chuka area of Kenya. 

This charming mother of three has been engaged in mixed farming for the past 15 years. She commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers in her village. Her main source of income has been eggs, milk, tea, and a variety of food crops that she plants. Taking care of her poultry is an activity she finds very enjoyable. Feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Chuka. Mary has a good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market. However, the demand is so high. Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. 

Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Mary will achieve their dreams and goals. Mary believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding of poultry and taking good care of them. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry.
